story:
Short Summary

We are Stephen and Nancy. We've owned and operated the Boulder Creek Brewery for the last 26 years. Boulder Creek is a small town in the Santa Cruz mountains of California. We are a unique community.

In March of 2015,  the Brewery was destroyed by a catastrophic fire. The fire was caused by a faulty exhaust fan in one of the bathrooms. There is a law suit against the manufacturer. It is expected to be in litigation for years to come. The odds of receiving payment are very low. The original fan manufacturer was purchased by another company and then the purchasing company was sold to a large Japanese corporation.

Presently, we have    completed all environmental studies. The property is  certified clear of any issues. No lead or asbestos issues.

We have completed clean up from the fire. Removed about 20 container loads of fire damaged materials.

We have secured building permits for the rebuild. 

We were insured, however, we were significantly under insured. This is our  poor stewardship & miss judgment.  The business grew over the years. We did not adequately increase coverage to meet this . In addition, we insured the the property for the market value. Not the replacement cost. The building was a poured in place concrete structure built in the lates 1920s. It requires significant steel moment framing and engineered foundation work to  meet California seismic code.

The cost rebuild the structure and brewery is about 1.7 million and an additional 200K is required to recapitalize .  We have an SBA approved  loan for a little over 1 million  and we have  the required 20% down payment.  In addition we have already spent 150K on the clean up,  environmental studies, structural engineering and permits.

The commercial appraisal values the project at 1.5 million.  

What We Need :


Our shortfall is 200K

If for any reason we are unable to use these funds for their intended purpose we will transparently donate  100 %  of any raised money to our local schools.

The Impact

The brewery and restaurant have been a hub of the community for over 25 years.

We are community business in every sense . From being a local employer, to supporting local school and non profits.  And simply as place where our small town comes together.  

We've been in Boulder Creek Through four decades now good times and bad. From the  great Earthquake of 1989, the fall of the Berlin wall, the rise of the internet, the age of terrorism, the wars in Iraq & Afghanistan, the great recession.  We've seen generations grow up in our community. We raise our families here. We've worked long and hard. Sometimes failing. And sometimes succeeding.

Risks & Challenges

Building is Santa Cruz  county is not without challenges. There may yet be unforeseen hurdles that totally side track the project.

If for any reason we are unable to use these funds for their intended purpose we will donate  100 %  of any raised money to our local schools.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please  get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Please Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Blackbird Tactical will provide a new venue of entertainment for almost a third of Maine, as it will be centrally located within an hour or less travel time of the most populated parts of the state. We will be able to provide a positive oulet for young people needing something to do, families a great place to make memories, and our community a fun place to be a part of.

A place to have a great time is exactly what is needed in our community! Just down the road from University of Maine-Farmington, and next to Titcomb Mountain Ski Resort, we are eager to offer paintball year round, with indoor/outdoor fields, low impact markers for younger players, and play fields mapped on 2 to 5 acres each.

Being within walking distance from University of Maine-Farmington, there is a consistent pool of customers close by and eager for activity! We have young people of all ages telling us how much they wish there was something more to do, especially in winter, in this area. Helping us provide this service brings an outlet for what the community is asking for!

Blackbird Tactical is owned by Allen and Vanessa Alexander. Allen has spent the last 13 years in Law Enforcement, bringing specialized skills in safety, tactical based scenarios, and serving large groups of people. Vanessa has spent 13 years in Retail Management and is skilled in merchandising, vendor relations, compliance, personnel matters, and outstanding customer service.



What We Need & What You Get

Here is a small vision of our needs: and it's really no small thing!

The truth of the matter is, awesome facilities require an awesome amount of money to bring them to life. All totaled, we are needing a half million dollars. However, we are trying to raise $385,000 to use as leverage to work with our local banking and small business industry for the remaining loan we will need. The land is $209,000. Equipment, supplies, taxes, and beginning wages will cost $168,000. Having these funds will allow us to build our indoor facility, clear and create outdoor maps, pay employees, and get supplies needed to ensure we get our business good footing. 

Every dollar donated is essential! You are essential!

If we don't quite meet our goal here, we will attempt a second round of fundraising to make this the best place to visit in Maine and beyond. We won't give up on this.

The Impact

Your contribution to help us meet our needs helps provide 10 to 15 new jobs in just the first year. The success of our business will be based on how well we take care of people who come visit us. Being able to do something, and do it well, means everything. That means having the right personnel in place to do the job. Customers who are treated well, will return, and will tell others about the great time they had- that provides more business and even more jobs.

We want to host themed paintball events that draw hundreds of players, at least 2 to 3 times a year and tournaments at least 3 times a year. The overflow from our business to other local businesses will be like a flood. From lodging to restaurants to retail shops, our business success means our community's businesses are successful.

Risks & Challenges

Our largest opportunity will be overcoming timing of construction on undeveloped parts of the property. We wish to purchase 208 acres in the middle of town that provide endless options for play fields, however, those play fields will need to be constructed from the ground up. Part of our solution is to incorporate the shape of the land on many of the outdoor play fields to minimize our dependency on clearing and reconfiguring entire mulit-acre tracts of land.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate right now? That's okay, if you're excited about the possibility of having a venue of this type, and would like to join, please share our page! Tell everyone with the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
A Little Background

People I've had the honor to cook for always ask me, “Why don’t you open a restaurant?” Well, I can finally say that I’m actually working on it. But there is still some work to do before I can do that, and I need your help to make it all happen. For me, it’s not only the idea of owning a restaurant that excites me. It’s the opportunity to tell a story through my food and pass on what I’ve had the privilege of learning about global foodways that make it so meaningful to me.

Meridio is the culmination of years of research, travel and cooking. I’ve wanted to own my own restaurant for a long time, but it wasn’t until recently that I found the perfect concept. I grew up in the kitchen, watching my great grandmother, grandmother, and mother cook American Southern and rustic Italian cuisine. Since childhood, I’ve been experimenting, learning and perfecting my personal cooking style. Growing up in Mississippi, I saw most of the state and had the opportunity to experience a large majority of the various ingredients, cooking techniques, and culinary cultures not only of Mississippi but of the entire American South as well. 

I’ve worked in and around the restaurant industry throughout my life, albeit on the side. It wasn't until I visited the magical city of Cartagena, Colombia -- and fell in love with a beautiful woman there -- that I discovered the phenomenal flavors and cultures of South America. Through that discovery, I found a connection between the cuisines of South America and the American South that I never knew existed, and now I want to share this newfound knowledge with the world. 


The Concept

The name is a play on the Spanish word "meridional," meaning southern. Meridio Southern-Latino is an innovative restaurant and bar featuring a rare and exciting blend of American Southern and South American cuisines and beverages.

The restaurant will offer diners a refined yet approachable dining experience with swift, knowledgeable service and affordable pricing. We'll use fresh, quality ingredients in all of our dishes and strive to source our meat and produce from community farmers, growers and other local and regional purveyors whenever possible. In addition, we’ll strive to source ingredients unique to geographic regions in South America  in order to maintain authenticity and sustainability, and to nurture the relationships between the U.S. and emerging economies in South America.

By combining the various native ingredients and presentation methods of these wonderful regions, we create something entirely new, yet surprisingly familiar.


Why you?

Most dreams cannot become reality without the support of friends and family, and it takes a village to open a restaurant. Through Indiegogo, I am raising initial capital to fund the research and development phase of the start-up process. The business plan has been thoroughly vetted by business coaches and lending consultants, and the consensus is that the plan is sound. I just need to go out and find the collateral needed to obtain financing.

For banks and investors to really believe in me and my concept, I need to show that there is a market for Meridio. So, the R&D phase will consist of one part underground supper club, one part private chef service. Highly valued feedback will be gathered and documented after each event, and a small but hopefully steady income will stream from the events and go towards the stretch goal of $200,000 needed for financing collateral.

To fund this phase, I need to raise $25,000 that will go toward purchasing cooking equipment, dishes, tables, storage, transportation and other items essential to the success of the R&D project. The necessities are not unlike what a typical catering company uses. 


Perks!

Fulfillment of perks will begin tentatively in March of 2016 after funding is complete and orders can be placed. This will include anything that can be emailed or shipped. 
Fulfillment of perks at higher contribution levels will depend largely on timing and scheduling. The perks specific to the actual restaurant will be fulfilled upon the successful opening of Meridio. I'm shooting for a Fall 2017 opening, so mark your calendars (if you have a 2017 calendar). 

Meridio Underground Supper Club events will begin in Spring 2016 and will run throughout the year. Go here to sign up for Meridio Underground emails. 


The Impact

Your contribution is more powerful than you might think. It shows investors that there is undeniable support and demand for a restaurant like Meridio. 

You'll also be helping to promote sustainability and support our global foodways by fostering the partnerships Meridio will build between U.S. and Latin American businesses, farmers, and artisans. 

With your help, I can follow my passion for cooking great food and bring this exciting new cuisine to the dining public! No donation is too small!! There are some great perks for all contribution levels. 

I love you all so much and look forward to cooking for you very soon!

Brad


Risks & Challenges

Every business venture comes with its own share of risk and challenges, and restaurants are no exception. That is why I have assembled a world-class advisory board with over 50 years combined experience in restaurant operations, hotel management, hospitality, sales, event management, food and beverage, tourism, and economic development. If and when issues arise, I know I can go to my advisory board for solutions.

Beyond that, you have my promise that I will focus all my energy on seeing this through. After all, this is my dream! I wouldn't dare take it on unless I was completely dedicated. 

Meridio will have a strong online presence to make sure all customers and supporters have timely notice of all Meridio happenings and project updates.


Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, I know from experience. Somtimes funds are low, and you just can't contribute. No worries! There are other ways you can help.

Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. 

Tell your friends and family to go out and consider supporting my project. 

You can use Indiegogo's share tools to easily share with your friends and followers on social media.

story:
Englsih version, get down please.

Thanks

Bonjour,

De par mon savoir Etre et savoir Faire, riche de diversités et de pluriactivités, j’ai développé une grande rigueur, une qualité de présence et d’écoute.

De la flexibilité, de l’enthousiasme et du plaisir dans tout ce que j’entreprends...

Ce qui me décrit : dynamique, spontanée, créative, bienveillante, ferme, optimiste, empathique, pleine d’humour... 

Mon métier aujourd'hui est de trouver des solutions économiques et humaines pour répartir les richesses. Par la suite avec des équipes efficientes, nous les mettrons en place. SMB 361 en est la première action. Cela a du sens pour moi, c'est ma manière de contribuer à améliorer le monde.

SMB 361 est un nouveau modèle de réseau Premium autour du milieu du Sport de Haut-Niveau Montpelliérain. Il permet aux TPE/PME locales de pouvoir participer aux salons VIP des sports majeurs, sans avoir à en payer les abonnements annuels parfois trop coûteux pour leur structure.

L'adhésion annuelle inclue les prestations suivantes:

-  Une carte privilège (assimilable à un Comité d'Entreprise externalisé)

-  Une autre visibilité, sur le net, plus performante

- Huit rencontres « Business Afterworks »

- Deux cycles de " trois Business ateliers" concrets

 - Trois rendez-vous « Business Events » pour accroître votre chiffre d'affaires.

 -  Une place VIP à l’ALTRAD Stadium

 - Une place VIP au Palais des sports René BOUGNOL.

Je me suis intéressée à la situation des TPE en France, aux problématiques que nous rencontrons pour pérenniser nos entreprises. QUOI et COMMENT faire pour répondre aux impératifs du marché ?

Nous devons travailler sur les attitudes et aptitudes, favoriser l'accès des places to be dans le milieu sportif, lieux incontournables des Homme d'affaire.

Je contribue ainsi à  améliorer le bouche à oreille et le travail de recommandations en mutualisant les coûts.

J'ai fait le choix d'associer Thierry Mouraux en charge de la communication (créateur du logo et de la charte du SMB 361) et Sébastien TOURNIER le directeur. 

Pourquoi eux ? Nous avons appris à nous connaître, nous partageons les mêmes valeurs et avons une vision commune futuriste. Si je disparais demain, ils sont à même de continuer le SMB 361 et de prendre les décisions appropriées. Ce que j'aime c'est le plaisir et la richesse de nos échanges et en plus nous travaillons dans la joie et la bonne humeur. Dans ces conditions créer est un plaisir et un épanouissement personnel. 

Je vous invite à aller voir la page facebook du SMB 361 où je raconte l'histoire de la création de SMB 361. www.facebook.com/smb361France/

Nos besoins et vos contreparties

Aujourd'hui ce modèle est inconnu en France, je ne saurais m'avancer pour le reste du monde. J'ai besoin d'un coup de pouce afin de lever les doutes des membres potentiels. B. CYRULNIK a précisé que le doute est le premier pas vers la liberté. Vous savez comme moi qu'une grande partie de la population a peur de l'inconnu. 

La somme demandée aux donnateurs soit 11 200 €  va servir à couvrir : les frais administratifs, ceux de la communication et une partie des abonnements des places. Je souhaite multiplier par 5 la donation initiale afin de permettre à  SMB 361 de prendre son essor et d'être franchisé en 2017.

  • Le lancement du SMB 361 a pour objectif de permettre aux TPE de générer du chiffre d'affaires. L'équipe du SMB 361 n'est constituée que de chefs d'entreprise. Nous souhaitons accueillir la collaboration d'un commercial indépendant pour le second semestre 2016.
  • Nous faisons appel aux dons. En devenant notre donateur,  avec un minimum de 150 €, vous avez la possibilité de choisir une entreprise du Languedoc Roussillon à laquelle nous offrirons une place supplémentaire au MHB.
  •  Le montant de la cotisation du SMB 361 étant de 1 592.4 € TTC, si votre contribution est supérieure ou égale à la cotisation,nous attribuerons une remise de 25% à une entreprise de votre choix.
  • A vous de nous mentionner si vous souhaitez apparaître sur le site web qui est en construction et dans le futur livre animé !

Si la somme espérée n'est pas atteinte, 5% hors frais seront reversés en don à un projet présenté par indiegogo.

L'impact

Nous avons établi les partenariats avec le Montpellier Hérault Rugby (MHR) et Montpellier Handball (MHB). Le projet est venu d'un constat de la réalité locale.

 Je me suis interrogée: 

 comment accéder aux places to be ?

 Où rencontrer les décideurs locaux?  

Comment répondre aux impératifs du marché ? 

SMB 361 mutualise et permet aussi aux PME d'accéder à des réductions sur les loisirs et spectacles.  Nous participons à maintenir l'emploi. Les chefs d'entreprise participent à améliorer l'économie locale et nationale.

J'ai déjà créé un groupe de business via le BNI expérience riche d'enseignements. Je me suis rendue compte de l'importance des moments informels et du bouche à oreille. Sébastien est un ancien sportif de haut niveau, un homme qui sait réseauter. C'est un compétiteur dans l'âme qui a su rester humble. Il connait la vie des réseaux et c'est un homme de terrain.

Oui l'idée de SMB 361 est novatrice, vivante et évolutive. L'investissement pour le membre n'est pas forcément mesurable immédiatement mais les retombées, pour lui et les autres membres, ne se feront pas attendre. La synergie fera que le membre gagnera en attitude et aptitudes afin de qualifier son business. Un travail d'investissement pour avoir des recommandations à vie et augmenter son chiffre d'affaires.

Risques et défis

J'ai fait le choix de créer une SAS et non une association car je défends l'entrepreneuriat et il est important pour moi d'être cohérente.

Sébastien et Thierry sont des chefs d'entreprise également. 

SMB 361 est une marque de SMB GROUP et deviendra une société à part entière quand elle aura acquis son autonomie financière. 

Je souhaite franchiser SMB 361. L'argent est un sujet tabou en France, je crois que nous pouvons tous améliorer nos vies si nous savons répartir les richesses. 

Je relève également le défi que nous pouvons créer et développer ailleurs qu'à Paris. 

J'ai choisi la ville de Montpellier pour sa situation géographique stratégique et ses infrastructures. De la même manière nous pouvons innover différemment des NTIC ou de la santé. Des innovations qui ont fait la notoriété de Montpellier.


SMB veut dire Solidarity Means Business too !

Ce concept je l'ai pensé et créé, j'ai la volonté de le mener jusqu'au bout. il n'y a que dans le dictionnaire que réussir se trouve avant travailler. Je sais trouver des solutions et les refus sont justes des étapes avant la réussite. Une optimiste et obstinée née !

J'ai foi en ce que je fais et je crois en mes collaborateurs.

Pour tout problème !Bonne nouvelle ! Les solutions existent.

D'autres façons de nous aider

Diffuser autour de vous. Vous pouvez nous joindre pour de plus amples renseignements par mail : contact@smb361.fr

Je me suis fixée comme défi d'obtenir 10 000 dons de 10 € à travers le monde ou 10 000 dons de 5€. 10 000 personnes représentent environ 0.00027% de la population mondiale active.

 Avez-vous trouvé de l'intérêt à SMB 361 ? si oui, nous vous invitons à multiplier vos actions,  à inviter d'autres personnes à faire des dons et/ou du sponsoring en direct

( voir la  législation en vigueur dans votre pays).

  • Partagez, partager et utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

Merci ! Merci ! Merci !

Soraya M'BATA


Dears friends,

I won't to translate the french pitch. I hope that you could understand it. In fact my english is very bad. I prefer to write a letter with my heart.

I don't think that you need more details for why i do a crowdfunding campain.

You know as most of companes we want to raise funds. of course !

Here i want to share why i create the SMB 361.

My job is to lead community and humanist actions. How to dsitribute the wealth.

That's why i create SMB GROUP.

SMB 361 is a brand of SMB GROUP until it reaches the financial autonomy.

What is SMB 361 ?

It's a new Premium Networking with a global offer.

How to help business manager to develop their business ?

How to help companies to access to business spots ?

How to help business manager to have recommandation a life ?

How to get discount for leisure ?

I create the SMB 361 with :

  a privilege card

  8 business afterworks 

  2 cycle of business tools

  3 business events

   and the possibility of buying places from the VIP lounges of the major sports places.

Why sports spots ? Business manager is like a high level sportman. We modelize that's why is better to modelize winner people.

I allow the business managers to reach places and tools without having to pay the full price.Only we go faster, together one go farther.

We need the help of the community to rease funds, to help french companies first to create more value and raise doubts.

The SMB 361 team : Sébastien TOURNIER the Director, he was a high level sportman and Thierry MOUREAUX the managerof communication.

We share same values like respect - freedom - growth - sharing - humor - success...

We have a common vision : contribute to imporve the world.

They are able to take decisions. I can trust them !!!! 

You have the detail of what we need in the "contreparties".

to change the world we have to think and do bigger. We want to share our action with the world and to find friendly people around the world.

May be it will make other opportunities !!!!

Thanks to share it ! We have 21 days to reach our goals.

the fisrt goal : 11 200 € 

the other is to x by 5 the first goal !

then we hope to work in freelance with a community manager and a business networking developper

What can we do for you ? Let your contact to get news...

Thanks ! Thanks for your help.

Kinds regards !

Soraya
story_txt:
Englsih version, get down please.ThanksBonjour,
De par mon
savoir Etre et savoir Faire, riche de diversités et de pluriactivités, j’ai
développé une grande rigueur, une qualité de présence et d’écoute.
De la
flexibilité, de l’enthousiasme et du plaisir dans tout ce que j’entreprends...
Ce qui me
décrit : dynamique, spontanée, créative, bienveillante, ferme, optimiste, empathique, pleine
d’humour... 
Mon métier
aujourd'hui est de trouver des solutions économiques et humaines pour répartir
les richesses. Par la suite avec des équipes efficientes, nous les mettrons en
place. SMB 361 en est la première action. Cela a du sens pour moi, c'est ma
manière de contribuer à améliorer le monde.
SMB 361 est
un nouveau modèle de réseau Premium autour du milieu du Sport de Haut-Niveau
Montpelliérain. Il permet aux TPE/PME locales de pouvoir participer aux salons
VIP des sports majeurs, sans avoir à en payer les abonnements annuels parfois
trop coûteux pour leur structure.
L'adhésion
annuelle inclue les prestations suivantes:
-  Une
carte privilège (assimilable à un Comité d'Entreprise externalisé)
-  Une
autre visibilité, sur le net, plus performante
- Huit
rencontres « Business Afterworks »
- Deux
cycles de " trois Business ateliers" concrets
 - Trois
rendez-vous « Business Events » pour accroître votre chiffre d'affaires.
 - 
Une place VIP à l’ALTRAD Stadium
 - Une
place VIP au Palais des sports René BOUGNOL.
Je me suis
intéressée à la situation des TPE en France, aux problématiques que nous
rencontrons pour pérenniser nos entreprises. QUOI et COMMENT faire pour
répondre aux impératifs du marché ?
Nous devons
travailler sur les attitudes et aptitudes, favoriser l'accès des places to be
dans le milieu sportif, lieux incontournables des Homme d'affaire.
Je contribue
ainsi à  améliorer le bouche à oreille et le travail de recommandations en
mutualisant les coûts.
J'ai fait le
choix d'associer Thierry Mouraux en charge de la communication (créateur du
logo et de la charte du SMB 361) et Sébastien TOURNIER le directeur. 
Pourquoi eux
? Nous avons appris à nous connaître, nous partageons les mêmes valeurs et
avons une vision commune futuriste. Si je disparais demain, ils sont à même de
continuer le SMB 361 et de prendre les décisions appropriées. Ce que j'aime
c'est le plaisir et la richesse de nos échanges et en plus nous travaillons
dans la joie et la bonne humeur. Dans ces conditions créer est un plaisir et un
épanouissement personnel. 
Je vous
invite à aller voir la page facebook du SMB 361 où je raconte l'histoire de la
création de SMB 361. www.facebook.com/smb361France/
Nos besoins
et vos contreparties
Aujourd'hui
ce modèle est inconnu en France, je ne saurais m'avancer pour le reste du
monde. J'ai besoin d'un coup de pouce afin de lever les doutes des membres
potentiels. B. CYRULNIK a précisé que le doute est le premier pas vers la
liberté. Vous savez comme moi qu'une grande partie de la population a peur de
l'inconnu. 
La somme
demandée aux donnateurs soit 11 200 €  va servir à couvrir : les frais
administratifs, ceux de la communication et une partie des abonnements des
places. Je souhaite multiplier par 5 la donation initiale afin de permettre à
 SMB 361 de prendre son essor et d'être franchisé en 2017.

Le lancement du SMB 361 a pour
     objectif de permettre aux TPE de générer du chiffre d'affaires. L'équipe
     du SMB 361 n'est constituée que de chefs d'entreprise. Nous souhaitons
     accueillir la collaboration d'un commercial indépendant pour le second
     semestre 2016.
Nous faisons appel aux dons. En
     devenant notre donateur,  avec un minimum de 150 €, vous avez la
     possibilité de choisir une entreprise du Languedoc Roussillon à laquelle
     nous offrirons une place supplémentaire au MHB.
 Le montant de la
     cotisation du SMB 361 étant de 1 592.4 € TTC, si votre contribution est
     supérieure ou égale à la cotisation,nous attribuerons une remise de 25% à
     une entreprise de votre choix.
A vous de nous mentionner si
     vous souhaitez apparaître sur le site web qui est
     en construction et dans le futur livre animé !

Si la somme
espérée n'est pas atteinte, 5% hors frais seront reversés en don à un projet
présenté par indiegogo.
L'impact
Nous avons
établi les partenariats avec le Montpellier Hérault Rugby (MHR) et Montpellier
Handball (MHB). Le projet est venu d'un constat de la réalité locale.
 Je me
suis interrogée: 
 comment
accéder aux places to be ?
 Où
rencontrer les décideurs locaux?  
Comment
répondre aux impératifs du marché ? 
SMB 361
mutualise et permet aussi aux PME d'accéder à des réductions sur les loisirs et
spectacles.  Nous participons à maintenir l'emploi. Les chefs
d'entreprise participent à améliorer l'économie locale et nationale.
J'ai déjà
créé un groupe de business via le BNI expérience riche d'enseignements. Je me
suis rendue compte de l'importance des moments informels et du bouche à
oreille. Sébastien est un ancien sportif de haut niveau, un homme qui sait
réseauter. C'est un compétiteur dans l'âme qui a su rester humble. Il connait
la vie des réseaux et c'est un homme de terrain.
Oui l'idée
de SMB 361 est novatrice, vivante et évolutive. L'investissement pour le membre
n'est pas forcément mesurable immédiatement mais les retombées, pour lui et les
autres membres, ne se feront pas attendre. La synergie fera que le membre
gagnera en attitude et aptitudes afin de qualifier son business. Un travail
d'investissement pour avoir des recommandations à vie et augmenter son chiffre
d'affaires.
Risques et
défis
J'ai fait le
choix de créer une SAS et non une association car je défends l'entrepreneuriat
et il est important pour moi d'être cohérente.
Sébastien et
Thierry sont des chefs d'entreprise également. 
SMB 361 est
une marque de SMB GROUP et deviendra une société à part entière quand elle aura
acquis son autonomie financière. 
Je souhaite
franchiser SMB 361. L'argent est un sujet tabou en France, je crois que
nous pouvons tous améliorer nos vies si nous savons répartir les richesses. 
Je relève
également le défi que nous pouvons créer et développer ailleurs qu'à
Paris. 
J'ai choisi
la ville de Montpellier pour sa situation géographique stratégique et
ses infrastructures. De la même manière nous pouvons innover
différemment des NTIC ou de la santé. Des innovations qui ont fait la notoriété
de Montpellier.

SMB veut dire Solidarity Means Business too !
Ce concept
je l'ai pensé et créé, j'ai la volonté de le mener jusqu'au bout. il n'y a que
dans le dictionnaire que réussir se trouve avant travailler. Je sais trouver
des solutions et les refus sont justes des étapes avant la réussite. Une
optimiste et obstinée née !
J'ai foi en
ce que je fais et je crois en mes collaborateurs.
Pour tout
problème !Bonne nouvelle ! Les solutions existent.
D'autres
façons de nous aider
Diffuser
autour de vous. Vous pouvez nous joindre pour de plus amples renseignements par mail : contact@smb361.fr
Je me suis
fixée comme défi d'obtenir 10 000 dons de 10 € à travers le monde ou 10 000
dons de 5€. 10 000 personnes représentent environ 0.00027% de la population
mondiale active.
 Avez-vous
trouvé de l'intérêt à SMB 361 ? si oui, nous vous invitons à multiplier vos
actions,  à inviter d'autres personnes à faire des dons et/ou du
sponsoring en direct 
( voir la
 législation en vigueur dans votre pays).

Partagez, partager et utiliser
     les outils de partage Indiegogo !

Merci !
Merci ! Merci !
Soraya

I prefer to write a letter with my heart.I don't think that you need more details for why i do a crowdfunding campain.You know as most of companes we want to raise funds. of course !Here i want to share why i create the SMB 361.My job is to lead community and humanist actions. How to dsitribute the wealth.That's why i create SMB GROUP.SMB 361 is a brand of SMB GROUP until it reaches the financial autonomy.What is SMB 361 ?It's a new Premium Networking with a global offer.How to help business manager to develop their business ?How to help companies to access to business spots ?How to help business manager to have recommandation a life ?How to get discount for leisure ?I create the SMB 361 with :  a privilege card  8 business afterworks   2 cycle of business tools  3 business events   and the possibility of buying places from the VIP lounges of the major sports places.Why sports spots ? Business manager is like a high level sportman. We modelize that's why is better to modelize winner people.I allow the business managers to reach places and tools without having to pay the full price.Only we go faster, together one go farther.We need the help of the community to rease funds, to help french companies first to create more value and raise doubts.The SMB 361 team : Sébastien TOURNIER the Director, he was a high level sportman and Thierry MOUREAUX the managerof communication.We share same values like respect - freedom - growth - sharing - humor - success...We have a common vision : contribute to imporve the world.They are able to take decisions. I can trust them !!!! You have the detail of what we need in the "contreparties".to change the world we have to think and do bigger. We want to share our action with the world and to find friendly people around the world.May be it will make other opportunities !!!!Thanks to share it ! We have 21 days to reach our goals.the fisrt goal : 11 200 € the other is to x by 5 the first goal !then we hope to work in freelance with a community manager and a business networking developperWhat can we do for you ? story:
SanCloud is enhancing the open source hardware BeagleBone Black design you love with more features than you thought possible! It still has a blistering 1GHz processor and just like the BeagleBone Black, has two 46-pin expansion  headers, micro HDMI for audio/video output, USB ports, Ethernet and other I/O features. The SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced is an ultra-powered embedded computer that can (still) fit in a mint tin!

  • 1 Gigabyte DDR3 RAM - twice the amount of the normal BeagleBone Black
  • Gigabit Ethernet
  • Extra USB ports, 2 on board plus 2 via expansion header
  • Optional serial NOR flash for boot loader
  • Optional 6 axis gyro + accelerometer (we will fit 9 axis '+ compass' if target is reached)
  • Optional barometer pressure and temperature sensor


Since early 2015 we have been working on the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board. We have listened to user feedback of what people would like to see on an Enhanced BeagleBone and combined this user wish list with our own requirements and produced the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced platform. We have produced several prototype versions and this has allowed us to iron out hardware and software issues and to fully test the new SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board. As a result, we now have fully functional hardware and software drivers for all the new features and are ready to go.

The SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced  board is fully supported and licensed by beagleboard.org. This means the same software images from BeagleBone that work on the Black will also work on the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board. It also ensures you can expect the same high quality as you have come to expect from BeagleBone.

What we need now is your support to bring the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced to the market. Your support will allow us to start mass production of the board and deliver to you, our Backers.



Our hardware is designed to be flexible and this has allowed us to offer several versions:

SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced Light

This board offers the same AM3358 1GHz processor from Texas Instruments and like the BeagleBone Black, two 46-pin expansion headers, micro HDMI for audio/video output, 4GByte eMMC flash, micro SD storage card, USB host/device via mini-USB OTG socket. It is fully compatible with BeagleBone Black capes and supported via BeagleBone software releases. This version additionally provides 1GByte of DDR3 800 RAM, ultra fast gigabit Ethernet networking, two on-board USB2.0 type A ports and two further ports via expansion header with the same compact form factor as the older BeagleBone Black.


SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced

This board offers the same AM3358 1GHz processor from Texas Instruments and like the BeagleBone Black, two 46-pin expansion headers, micro HDMI for audio/video output, 4GByte eMMC flash, micro SD storage card, USB host/device via mini-USB OTG socket. It is fully compatible with BeagleBone Black capes and supported via BeagleBone software releases. This version additionally provides 1GByte of DDR3 800 RAM, ultra fast gigabit Ethernet networking, two on-board USB2.0 type A ports and two further ports via expansion header. Also provided are 1MByte SPI NOR flash for protected, separate boot loader and room for kernel, additional on board sensors in the form of ST Microelectronics LP331 260-1260mbar Barometer pressure sensor and InvenSense MPU-6050 Six-Axis (Gyro + Accelerometer) and we will fit MPU-9250 Nine-Axis (Gyro + Accelerometer + Compass) if target is reached. As with the "Light" version it has the same compact form factor as the older BeagleBone Black.


SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced Light + WiFi/BT

This has the same features as the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced Light version with the addition of a RealTek RTL8723 802.11 b/g/n WiFi and Bluetooth 2.1/4.0 LE module. 


SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced + WiFi/BT

This has the same features as the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced version with the addition of a RealTek RTL8723 802.11 b/g/n WiFi and Bluetooth 2.1/4.0 LE module. 



SanCloud is the only company to offer a fully compatible BeagleBone Black board with many of the additional features requested by you, the fans and users of the BeagleBone Black. As with the current BeagleBone boards the hardware will be fully open sourced with all the design data being released at the same time as when we deliver to Backers.



The extra features of the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board allows for faster networking with gigabit Ethernet and larger applications due to the extra system RAM. Additional USB ports remove the need for external HUB. The twin USB ports also allow for the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board to be used as a single board PC for keyboard and mouse, while the micro HDMI port allows for connection to monitor or TV and internet connection via the RJ45 or the SanCloud WiFi + Bluetooth board.
On the fully featured SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board the 6 axis gyro + accelerometer ( 9 axis '+ compass' if target is reached) is perfect for robots or autonomous vehicle use. When combined with the barometer, the Enhanced board can be used for quad-copters. The extra sensors are also perfect for educational use.
We also added SPI NOR flash along side the current eMMC flash. This was done so that the BeagleBone u-boot boot loader can be kept separate and secure from the system flash. If the user accidentally erases the eMMC there is no problem as the board can still boot u-boot and there is even enough for the kernel to be stored leaving all the eMMC for root file system. 
On all versions two USB ports are provided on a header next to the cape expansion ports. This can be used with the SanCloud WiFi + Bluetooth plug in board, or for your own projects and even combined with the current cape system for even greater flexibility.


On top of all this the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced is still 100% backwards compatible with BeagleBone Black capes and it will work with all future BeagleBone Black Debian software releases, fully supported by beagleboard.org
Our funding target will allow us to fully certify the SanCloud Enhanced board. This will include  and  compliance. The advantage of completing this testing gives greater flexibility and confidence for yourselves of high quality reliable hardware.

If we don't hit our full funding target, the funding you our Backers have given us will still allow us to ship fully functional boards. Depending on how close we get to our goal we may still be able to complete  and  testing or we will ship boards with the same disclaimer as the standard BeagleBone Black.




The building of our current fully functional boards has given us the chance to test and debug the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced hardware. However as with all projects there are some risks.

We want to ship the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board fully  and tested. This gives you our Backers greater flexibility on what the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board can be used for. While SanCloud has experience with the effort required with getting  and  approval, this does carry some level of risk. We have already started the testing with the current hardware. This means when we come to test the pre-production version we will have a high level of confidence in passing first time. 




The reason for building the early prototype hardware was to prove the new design and complete the software changes for the gigabit networking and extra sensors on the fully featured SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board. This also means less work to do to get our Backers the platform. Most of the testing has already been done, we need your help to get the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board into people's hands.



Q - If you don't hit your funding goal will I still my hardware?

A - Yes, we will build and ship boards for each Backer that has ordered them

Q - If you don't hit your funding goal will the hardware still be  and  approved?

A -  Maybe, depending on how close we get to our target we may still be able to get   and  approval.

Q - Can I reuse my BeagleBone Black case for the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board?

A - Sorry no, in order to fit all the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced features without making the board bigger we had to move the DC jack and make space for the extra USB port. 

Q - Why blue and not black PCB?

A - The company colour for SanCloud is blue so we designed the PCB to match.




We are thankful for any type of support you can provide us. Please share this project using the Indiegogo share tools with friends, family and followers. 

Follow us on Twitter.

BeagleBone and BeagleBone Black are trade marks of beagleboard.org www.beagleboard.org

The reason for building the early prototype hardware was to prove the new design and complete the software changes for the gigabit networking and extra sensors on the fully featured SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board. This also means less work to do to get our Backers the platform. Most of the testing has already been done, we need your help to get the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board into people's hands.


Q - If you don't hit your funding goal will I still my hardware?
A - Yes, we will build and ship boards for each Backer that has ordered them
Q - If you don't hit your funding goal will the hardware still be  and  approved?
A -  Maybe, depending on how close we get to our target we may still be able to get   and  approval.
Q - Can I reuse my BeagleBone Black case for the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced board?
A - Sorry no, in order to fit all the SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced features without making the board bigger we had to move the DC jack and make space for the extra USB port. 
Q - Why blue and not black PCB?
A - The company colour for SanCloud is blue so we designed the PCB to match.



We are thankful for any type of support you can provide us. Please share this project using the Indiegogo share tools with friends, family and followers. 
Follow us on Twitter.
BeagleBone and BeagleBone Black are trade marks of beagleboard.org www.beagleboard.org

story:
We believe that high quality meals should be available to everyone!

Our food brings together fresh flavours with an emphasis on simplicity and responsibly-sourced ingredients.



We have seasonal specials, as well as a host of traditional favourites, and we also cater for vegetarians and vegans.

We are extremely proud of our all-mediterranean wine and spirits menu and have brought together a unique and exciting range of wines, beers and spirits from all around the world.

How it works*:


  • Step 1: Choose from 2 healthy main options and salad.
Our chefs prepare main dishes and 1 salad every day using only the freshest of ingredients.
  • Step 2: Order in 3 clicks from our website www.doeatbetter.uk
  • Step 3: Enjoy your meals in less than 45 minutes!

*delivery is available to London and Cardiff in UK.


Don't worry! If you live outside from delivery area you can still order from our delicatessen online shop: http://eshop.doeatbetter.uk !

story:
**Update** Thank you for all your contributions!  We are now in the process of editing more episodes, and we'll keep you posted when we are planning to launch more content.  In the meantime, if you have any questions or comments, please send me an email at thehungrypartier (at) gmail (dot) com.  

Hi! My Name is Drew Binsky. 

I'm a full time traveler, travel blogger, and social media influencer, having visited 74 countries since 2012.  

My Background

I first caught the travel bug when I studied abroad in Prague during college. That semester opened my eyes up to the world, as I was able to visit 20+ countries in Europe, followed by a 4-week backpacking trip after my program ended. 

That was the point in my life when I knew I was never going to stop traveling. 

A few months after I graduated college, I moved to a small village in South Korea to teach English for 18 months. Taking this job was a huge risk, because it was my first time in Asia and I didn't know anything about teaching -- but I saw it as a great opportunity to live and work abroad. 

During my time in Korea, I became conversational in the Korean Language, visited 20+ Asian countries, and started my travel blog, The Hungry Partier, from scratch. In my free time, I would spend 40+ hours a week writing, networking and building up my blog to what it is today. 

My ultimate goal of starting a travel blog was not only to share my travel experiences, but also to be an inspiration for others to step outside their comfort zones and see the world.  Therefore, I strive to respond to every single email, blog comment, Tweet, Instagram comment, Snapchat message, and any other questions that come my way.  

When I left Korea in January 2015, I decided pursue my dream of traveling, so I took off to explore the world with just my 40 liter backpack. I spent the last 12 months exploring Asia, the Middle East and Europe, while working as a full-time travel blogger and social media influencer.

Through years of hard work, I'm proud to say that my blog is thriving, and I have gathered more than 130K social media followers. I am also honored and excited to be recently ranked as the #1 Male Travel Blogger in the world by Huffington Post.  (complete media list on my blog)

About The Show

Travel Hungry is an inventive travel show exploring the cultures and lifestyles of select cities, while also giving its viewers the details they need to confidently plan their own adventure.    

Our goal in creating the show is to make travel easier for you, by providing tons of travel tips, advice, "how to guides" and much more!

I’ve come together with 6 college friends, who are all filmmakers in LA and NYC.  Our motive for creating “Travel Hungry” was to inspire people to travel, by presenting them with relatable stories from our experiences on the road. Given that I spent the majority of the last 3 years living and traveling through Asia, we decided that it was the perfect setting to launch our series.  

So, last December, we each flew out to Asia, and filmed 4 weeks of content across Bangkok, Taipei, Hong Kong and Phuket. 

What Exactly Did We Film?

In each city, we filmed a variety of subjects to give you a perspective on what it’s like to visit each place.

We shot more than 1.5 terabytes (85+ hours) of footage, which include:

- Meeting and interacting with local people
- Eating delicious food (and some crazy dishes too)
- Exploring the nightlife scene
- Explaining different forms of public transportation (metros, taxis, boats, planes, etc.)
- Trekking through markets
- Diving into culture (like Muay Thai Lessons in Bangkok)
- Visiting parks, landmarks, and city attractions

Along the way, we provide exclusive travel tips and advice, including how to navigate cities, learn local languages, stay safe, negotiate prices, and much more!

Meet The Crew:

I can confidently say that our crew is an excellent group of talented professionals, and it has been a pleasure working with them! 

Everyone has their own skill set that he or she brings to the table, in order to make this the best production possible.

Here are the members:

Drew 'Binsky' Goldberg - Host

Drew is a proud graduate from The University of Wisconsin-Madison with degrees in economics and entrepreneurship.  Since graduating college, Drew has been living in Asia and traveling the world nonstop.  He runs a popular travel blog called The Hungry Partier, with the ultimate goal of inspiring young adults to travel, and take that leap outside their comfort zones. 

Jake Kitaeff - Producer, Co-director

A graduate from The University of Arizona, Jake has worked primarily in television, on Emmy Award winning shows such as The Voice and The Ellen Degeneres Show. Residing in sunny Los Angeles, Jake is currently working in post-production on a feature documentary that he has been shooting for the last 18 months. When he is not working, he likes to pretend he knows how to golf, and goes hiking when he gets too frustrated in doing so.

Ethan Moore - Director, Post Production Director

Ethan is a producer and director of sponsored content, and travels both domestically and internationally for brands such as Pepsi, Hilton, Under Armour, and Citibank. A resident of Los Angeles, Ethan has a strong love of filmmaking, but also a growing passion for emerging tech and media. He’s also, like, really into drones right now.

John Sears - Cinematographer

John is a Brooklyn-based Director of Photography, who is cultivating cinematography with emphases in strong compositions, color contrast, and motion. With a background in music and photography, John strives for high technical knowledge and abilities at every level of production, including editing and color, under the working theory that a rising tide lifts all boats.  His career experiences have put him behind the camera for national commercial campaigns for clients such as Capital One and Staples.

Rafael Gomez - Cinematographer

A graduate of The University of Arizona, Rafael is now a director and cinematographer working in Los Angeles.  Originally from Mexico, he has always had a passion for getting to know different people and cultures. 

Ben Montemayor - Editor, 2nd unit Cinematographer

Ben attended the University of Arizona, graduating Cum Laude with a degree in Film Production.  He now resides in Los Angeles, working as a Freelance Creative -- a director, editor, and photographer. He's passionate about music and works in-depth editing sponsored musician content and interviews. He's worked for artists such as: Drake, OneRepublic, U2, Kiesza, Wiz Khalifa, Imagine Dragons and Steve Aoki. 

Misha Scott – Editor

Misha Scott is an editor based out of Los Angeles, California. She focuses on digital documentary-style work, always seeking out impactful, innovative stories. She finds inspiration in music, the mountains of the Pacific Northwest, and avocados. 

-----------------

The chemistry and dynamics of our crew has been great to work with. As much fun as we had shooting together, we also had a strong element of professionalism.

Here’s a look at our camera equipment:

Although the gear seems smaller than you’d expect, the low profile allowed us to capture each country as naturally as possible, without drawing too much attention. 

Where Does Your Money Go?

Right now, our funding goal allows us to produce an initial five episodes, plus the corresponding social content for each platform. 

We have a variety of costs associated with our project. 

Our production costs include:

- Cinematographers’ shooting rates
- Equipment rentals
- Media (SD cards and Hard Drives)
- Crew meals
- Tourism and guide fees

Our post-production costs include:

- Editing rates
- Music Licensing

Our travel costs include:

- Crew airfare and transportation
- Crew accommodations

Overfunded?

With more funding, we will be able to continue producing new episodes and social content, as well as plan for production on a second season.

Where Can I Watch the Show?

We will be launching full length episodes on YouTube, as well as exclusive content on various social media platforms such as Instagram, Snapchat, and Facebook.  

Sign up for our mailing list to be the first to know when an episode is released.

Thank You!

We appreciate your time and support.  

If a donation to our project doesn’t seem feasible at this time, a simple Facebook share of our Indiegogo campaign would be greatly appreciated! 

Lastly, please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any further questions -- I am reachable via email (thehungrypartier@gmail.com) or Facebook.   

We truly can't wait to help guide your next adventure!

story:
Cycling across Europe once more before it crumbles

… well, across a small portion of it. We're three guys from different other portions: Jorge (Madrid, soon Stanford), Leon (Münster) and Nelson (ex Madrid, now Kraków). Through a lengthy and complicated string of coincidences we found ourselves determined to cycle from Paris to Rome. Our tastes and styles of travelling come in slightly different flavours: There's the art, the architecture, the cityscapes, there's the athletic challenge, the curiosity to discover the hidden villages you cannot expect to reach by any other means, there's the desire to find out which place is most terrible.

We're doing a big bad – hopefully awesome – trip and you can be part of it. We're going to write you from and about our travels: Leon – whom nobody told yet loudly enough which century he's supposed to live in – is mostly communicating via letters, somehow he managed to infect Nelson with this habit and so Jorge is likely going to fall prey to them, too. When's the last time you received a letter? A really fancy one, even? Hm, perhaps it's just that you dislike mail. No, not that sort? Well, then we might have something for you …


What We Need & What You Get

For us, your funding is directly locked to our ease. That doesn't mean we're looking for an easy path! After all, we're going to cross the bloody Alps for no particular practical reason. Like any proper adventure, such a bike trip is the weirdest mix of tremendous fun and existential worries. On the last trip Leon and Nelson had been soaked, frozen, bruised, hungover, hit by a car, despairingly homeless, utterly lost in both cities and primeval wilderness, threatened, bikeless, and surrounded by lightning and thunder. We couldn't have been looking forward any more to the next trip after we had finished that one.
And on top of all that one still has to worry about money. While we don't need a lot, we don't have a lot either. Every single euro or franc is fully appreciated!

We're selling you a piece of our trip, so to say. All of our perks will have you receiving a unique bit of a shareworthy story: A postcard, a letter or more.

The Impact

Oh dear, we're really crossing the Alps. One of us … insisted. So none of that merry Côte d'Azur exploring, instead: full frontal Switzerland. Lots of it. Wait, which one was that bloody expensive country – not the ones in Scandi— oh. Whoops!


Risks & Challenges

There's always the possibility that we might get run over by a truck, fall off a mountain or even worse: get a bike stolen. Other than that we're ready to endure anything, not even cheating by taking a train or hitch a ride (though we can only resist so much in case we get abducted). We're dead set to survive and arrive, and what qualifies us to hope for the best is Leon and Nelson's last trip: Westphalia to Kraków with lots of detours, 3300 km by bike during which a great lot of all the possible disasters happened and still didn't stop us. You'll get your perks unless not a single one of us three survives.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, tell your friends, share our project. Help us get known. Any audience that enjoys our meanders makes us happy!

story:
Help us to build Norway's first private city.

In a private city all property is private and all services are performed by private actors. Liberstad will be a city built on the philosophy of anarchism, the non-aggression-principle and private property rights. 

 

We are a small group of voluntaryists who are seeking a change in the way societies are organized. We want to establish the foundations for a new society where people are not subject to a central political power organization that determines how people should live and how the society should develop. We want a society where the people them self can decide the development of the society by respecting natural human rights and moral principles.

The ideas behind the Liberstad project comes from a number of renowned economists and philosophers, and is based on anarcho-capitalism, natural law and natural rights, non-aggression principle, spontaneous order, market economy, voluntaryism and the Austrian School of economics.

We want to demonstrate that voluntary cooperation and free market economy is a better and more moral alternative to organize a society than central planning of political power organizations.

We believe that private actors can deliver both better and more affordable public services without the use of force and coercion, and that politicians and political power is not needed in a society, at least on a local level.

We believe that Liberstad will be an exciting and educational project to see how the challenges and issues in a community, both socially and practically can be solved through voluntary and peaceful cooperation.

To implement the establishment and start the development of Norway's first private town we need all the help we can get, and we aim to presell 150.000 sqm of land in Liberstad to finance the purchase of the main property where Liberstad will be founded. You can read more about the presale here

The presales will only bring in enough capital to cover the purchase of the main property and costs, in addition we need capital for rezoning, tools and machinery for the initial development.

The property we would like to establish Liberstad on is located on Tjelland in Marnardal Municipality and consists of 1,5 mill sqm of scenic countryside land. We have signed a purchase agreement with the seller and we have established a temporary headquarters on the property. You can read more about the property here

We have established a company Liberstad Drift AS, which will be responsible for the establishment and initial development of Liberstad. The firm will act as a city-company and will be providing public services to the citizens. Some of Liberstad Drift's tasks will be to establish road networks and their maintenance, parks, playgrounds, water and sewer systems, security services, garbage collection and much more.

Liberstad is an ambitious project but we are determined to establish Norway's first private town no matter what obstacles and challenges we might face. We believe this is a beneficial project for all societies not only for Liberstad's citizens. It can eventually show other towns and communities that political power is not needed to solve social and societal challenges.

All work related to the project is based on voluntary and unpaid work and we expect it will take 3-4 years before the company has enough income and we can withdraw money for our work. Until then, the development is based on voluntary work, savings from the founders and donations. We are deeply grateful for all contributions and support we can get to develop this project and all contributions will go directly to the establishment and development of Liberstad.

 

ABOUT US

My name is John Holmesland and I've been working in construction and real estate development on a small scale for 20 years. I study Austrian economics and philosophy and I've been a Voluntaryist for the past 8 years . I have now dedicated my life to work for peace and liberty and I want to establish the foundation for a new society that adheres to the natural rights and the moral principles of Voluntaryism.

I want to use my expertise and knowledge from my previous work to make a more civilized society for both my self and my family and others to live, work and prosper in.

My co-partner on this project Sondre Bjellås is also a Volyntaryist and works as an IT- consultant and has more than 15 years of experience with IT-network and security systems. Sondre is a co-editor for the Norwegian Mises institute and has been writing about Austrian economics, voluntaryism and anarcho-capitalism for several years. 

 

WHY?

We want to make an impact on the way society is organized through coercion and aggression from political power organizations. We see the authoritarian power of the political system to be unmoral, destructive and unnecessary for the development and organization of a civilized society. 

We do not want to change the system through the political process as we see this as a waste of time and energy in addition to being unmoral. We believe that by creating a new private town and society from scratch we will have a much bigger impact and a more effective way of changing the society we live in.

 

FINAL WORDS

We hope that you will help us to establish and build this new society and community so that we can grow and spread peace and freedom to other parts of the world. Every penny helps and even if you cant afford to contribute financially we hope that you can share and spread the project and this campaign to help us reach more people. 

 

You can also donate using the following crypto currencies to the Liberstad Development CryptoFund

BITCOIN                                                             LITECOIN

                      

 

 

English website

WWW.LIBERSTAD.COM

 

Norwegian website

WWW.LIBERSTAD.NO
story_txt: Help us to build Norway's first private city.In a private city all property is private and all services are performed by private actors. Liberstad will be a city built on the philosophy of anarchism, the non-aggression-principle and private property rights.  We are a small group of voluntaryists who are seeking a change in the way societies are organized. We want to establish the foundations for a new society where people are not subject to a central political power organization that determines how people should live and how the society should develop. We want a society where the people them self can decide the development of the society by respecting natural human rights and moral principles.The ideas behind the Liberstad project comes from a number of renowned economists and philosophers, and is based on anarcho-capitalism, natural law and natural rights, non-aggression principle, spontaneous order, market economy, voluntaryism and the Austrian School of economics.We want to demonstrate that voluntary cooperation and free market economy is a better and more moral alternative to organize a society than central planning of political power organizations.We believe that private actors can deliver both better and more affordable public services without the use of force and coercion, and that politicians and political power is not needed in a society, at least on a local level.We believe that Liberstad will be an exciting and educational project to see how the challenges and issues in a community, both socially and practically can be solved through voluntary and peaceful cooperation.To implement the establishment and start the development of Norway's first private town we need all the help we can get, and we aim to presell 150.000 sqm of land in Liberstad to finance the purchase of the main property where Liberstad will be founded. You can read more about the presale hereThe presales will only bring in enough capital to cover the purchase of the main property and costs, in addition we need capital for rezoning, tools and machinery for the initial development.The property we would like to establish Liberstad on is located on Tjelland in Marnardal Municipality and consists of 1,5 mill sqm of scenic countryside land. We have signed a purchase agreement with the seller and we have established a temporary headquarters on the property. You can read more about the property hereWe have established a company Liberstad Drift AS, which will be responsible for the establishment and initial development of Liberstad. The firm will act as a city-company and will be providing public services to the citizens. Some of Liberstad Drift's tasks will be to establish road networks and their maintenance, parks, playgrounds, water and sewer systems, security services, garbage collection and much more.Liberstad is an ambitious project but we are determined to establish Norway's first private town no matter what obstacles and challenges we might face. We believe this is a beneficial project for all societies not only for Liberstad's citizens. It can eventually show other towns and communities that political power is not needed to solve social and societal challenges.All work related to the project is based on voluntary and unpaid work and we expect it will take 3-4 years before the company has enough income and we can withdraw money for our work. Until then, the development is based on voluntary work, savings from the founders and donations. We are deeply grateful for all contributions and support we can get to develop this project and all contributions will go directly to the establishment and development of Liberstad. ABOUT USMy name is John Holmesland and I've been working in construction and real estate development on a small scale for 20 years. I study Austrian economics and philosophy and I've been a Voluntaryist for the past 8 years . I have now dedicated my life to work for peace and liberty and I want to establish the foundation for a new society that adheres to the natural rights and the moral principles of Voluntaryism.I want to use my expertise and knowledge from my previous work to make a more civilized society for both my self and my family and others to live, work and prosper in.My co-partner on this project Sondre Bjellås is also a Volyntaryist and works as an IT- consultant and has more than 15 years of experience with IT-network and security systems. Sondre is a co-editor for the Norwegian Mises institute and has been writing about Austrian economics, voluntaryism and anarcho-capitalism for several years.  WHY?We want to make an impact on the way society is organized through coercion and aggression from political power organizations. We see the authoritarian power of the political system to be unmoral, destructive and unnecessary for the development and organization of a civilized society. We do not want to change the system through the political process as we see this as a waste of time and energy in addition to being unmoral. We believe that by creating a new private town and society from scratch we will have a much bigger impact and a more effective way of changing the society we live in. FINAL WORDSWe hope that you will help us to establish and build this new society and community so that we can grow and spread peace and freedom to other parts of the world. Every penny helps and even if you cant afford to contribute financially we hope that you can share and spread the project and this campaign to help us reach more people.  You can also donate using the following crypto currencies to the Liberstad Development CryptoFundBITCOIN                                                             LITECOIN                        English websiteWWW.LIBERSTAD.COM Norwegian websiteWWW.LIBERSTAD.NO

story:
“Abundance is not something we acquire; it is something we tune in to.” (Wayne Dyer)

“Bicycles are everywhere. Why settle for just one?” (Cherry St Bikes)

 

Imagine a place where you can borrow a bike for yourself and a friend, or even your entire family, pick up a few healthy snacks, tune-up your own bike, or even design and build a custom bike to take home. 

Hi, my name is Marco Carmona, I’m one of the founders of Cherry St. Bicycle Co-op. Our mission is to make bikes (and trikes, and surreys, oh my!) accessible for everyone in our immediate community and beyond. Our idea for Cherry St. Bikes began when neighborhood children were using my front yard as a bicycle repair station. We realized they had no idea how to maintain their bikes and there were few local options for our under-served community to repair, purchase, or borrow a bike. Many of their parents weren’t riding with them because they didn’t own an adult bike. For months, we surveyed the community- some folks didn’t have a place to store a bike, others simply didn’t want to ride alone. But bikes are everywhere- and everyone wants to ride a bike- how could we turn plenty of predicaments into a bounty of bike-riding beauties? (Well, we think our neighbors are beautiful!) Eureka! A co-operative providing a library lending system of bikes of all shapes and sizes, along with a repair shop, shone like the sun that rises on the East Side. We soon secured a commercial location within our downtown neighborhood for our clubhouse at 132 Cherry St. and Cherry Street Bicycle Co-op was suddenly more than just an idea! Cherry Street Bikes will soon provide an option for anyone who desires to ride, from parents with children, granny with her bad knees, regular Joes, and even bike-riding beauties with special needs.

 

Your help and contributions will make it possible for us to open our San Antonio downtown clubhouse to the public allowing us to share two wheel bikes, trikes, tandems, large multi-passenger bikes (surrey) and special needs bikes. We’ll also house a commercial kitchen that will be available for special events and will provide healthy snacks and picnics for your bike-riding adventures! Our downtown location affords you access to all of the cool spots and landmarks that make San Antonio a wonderful place to explore.  

Cherry St. Bikes strives to provide neighborhoods with a sense of community. We are proud when we see our neighbors outside, riding together as a family, and we can’t wait to see you on a Cherry Street Bike! A growing member base will allow us to grow our bicycle fleet and eventually expand our co-operative to other neighborhoods and cities. Join us today by investing in a membership. 

Come and ride it!

story:
Short Summary

  • I am 38 years old with 5 children and live with my partner who is a care worker. I have a background which includes completing an owner management course level 3 NVQ work wise I have worked from packing sugar at 16 to becoming a multi drop and same day delivery driver for various international companies, I started Fast Food Heroes due to losing my position due to the company losing a contract with £20.00 and a Facebook page in 2013.
  • Our campaign here is to raise capital to be able to fund expansion in other areas as well as bring much needed employment in the Grimsby area. We would like to obtain lower rates on equipment we hire to operate by being able to pay in advance this could cut our cost by 40% which means will keep our charges low to our customers the business is well establish and we already offer a driver backup service to clients in the Grimsby area unlike our rivals.
  • We already have over 350 active regular customers on a weekly basis
  •  
  • We have already installed a new system into an outlet in Grimsby who also had Hungry House installed on the same day and YES the Fast Food Heroes website has produce 12 sales against the Hungry House website with 2
  • This campaign means everything to myself family staff customers and clients but I have took the business to as far as I can which is limiting our sales opportunities.  

If the funding is achieved

  • It would relieve a lot of pressure on myself and my family 
  • Employment opportunities for young people in the Local area as well as other areas
  • Higher profit margins
  • A faster professional efficient service
  • Vast improvement in sales figures
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are looking to try and raise between £5000 & £10000. 

This will be used to Fund the following:

£2000 will be set aside for a heavy marketing campaign through social media and leaflets drops in targeted areas.

£1000 so we can purchase IT equipment that we can install in the outlets for trials to prove our system works for them which they will purchase after the trial period.

£500 for sign writing our vehicles and producing signs to go in the outlets windows to advertise our service to customers.

£962 to pay a month in advance for our vehicles

£756 for fleet insurance (optional)

£500 improvement on our website build

Any extra will raise will be spent on improvements in all areas

 

The saying goes you scratch my back I will scratch yours well to the people that help we will be offering the following returns:

£4000 (Partnership offer) We are willing to become business partners with someone if they offer the right experience to our business the split of profits will be negotiable on this.

£650 (Takeaway offer) Lifetime membership to our website with only transaction fees to pay

£50 (Customer offer) Fast Food Heroes will give you £10 off an order once a month for 2 years even if we are not in your area yet once we are the 2 years will start from then.

£20 (Customer offer) Fast Food Heroes will give you £10 off an order once a month for 18 Months even if we are not in your area yet once we are the 18 months will start from then.

£10.00 (Customer offer) Fast Food Heroes will give you £10 off an order once a month for 1 year even if we are not in your area yet once we are the 1 years will start from then.

£5.00 (Customer offer) Fast Food Heroes will give you Half Price Delivery on every order for 6 months even if we are not in your area yet once we are the 6 months will start from then.

If we do not reach our target the funding will still be very much appreciated and will be used to cover as much as we can do in our list of what we need.

The Impact

  • The impact will be a huge one if we can achieve funding so we can offer our service to more clients and prospective customers throughout the UK. By doing this it will then give more employment opportunities for the people of Grimsby and further afield. Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.

Risks & Challenges

  • Every business has risks and challenges I have had many to overcome from Social Services, Eviction, but I have done what I have had to do because I know a lot of people in the area value our service and all these problems have been overcome now.

There are risks in this business like hoax orders which we try and combat in many different ways and they seem to work.

Another main risk is that outlets have no faith in our system being a new company but with the funding we can install equipment into outlets on a trial period and prove our system works before the outlets commit to using our service.
