story:
We are looking to raise funds to construct an Eco-lodge, Meditation Centre, Shan Cooking School and Training Centre for Underprivileged Youths in Myanmar.


My name is Eleanor I am running this campaign on behalf of Joy, a local English and Tourism teacher and Tour Guide in Kyaukme, Shan State, Myanmar. It is Joy's ambition to build a center dedicated to assisting local youths gain invaluable vocational skills, to preserving local traditions through the teaching of Shan cooking and providing visitors to Kyaukme with a eco-friendly and peaceful retreat and meditation centre in the beautiful mountains of Shan State, Myanmar.

Joy leading a motorbike tour

Myanmar is ranked as a country with Low Human Development according to the UNDP. It faces a multitude of barriers to development.

 

'Myanmar is rich in resources, including oil, timber, gas and gems, but remains one of the world’s poorest countries... There has been an exodus of young people seeking work in neighbouring Thailand; people trafficking is endemic.' - Gethin Chamberlain, reporting for The Guardian

Furthermore, young  people face significant barriers to education. A recent study has found that 1 in 5 children miss school - http://goo.gl/Tok0uo -as they instead need to work in order to support their families.

Palaung Women Sheltering from the Rain

Myanmar is also benefiting from a boom in tourism in recent years. Joy has over ten years experience in the tourism sector of Kyaukme and has seen that this boom can help to transform the lives of young people in the area. Tour-guiding is the most lucrative form of work in the area. At the moment, young people have limited options when it comes to work; they must leave the town and be separated from their families. Employment opportunities are further limited by lack of access to formal education, which many youths experience. However, through education in foreign languages and in tourism, Joy will be able to assist young people in gaining the qualifications they need in order to become a certified guide in Kyaukme. 

Kyaukme Guides after gaining their certification.

The style of the training centre and guesthouse that will be created.


The Bamboo Project has a number of ambitions - 


- To create a space where unprivileged young people can benefit from learning the skills needed to work within the tourism industry. 

Joy has been working as a teacher and tour guide (http://shanprinces.webs.com/) for over ten years and has a plethora of experience in delivering  this training. Being a guide is the only way for young people in the community to earn a decent  living salary. It is also one of the few roles in the area which is not  dangerous, such as mining or factory work.  It is a role which allows the any young person to not have to face separation from their family, which is endemic in Kyaukme despite being extremely damaging as Myanmar has an extremely family-orientated culture.
The lodge will also be the only guesthouse in the area outside of the main town, providing visitors with the opportunity to experience the serenity and beauty of the natural landscape surrounding Kyaukme.

- To operate a Shan Cooking School, helping to educate people about and preserving the local Shan culture.

- To provide a peaceful place where visitors can benefit from learning the art of meditation in a beautiful natural setting.

- To create the first guesthouse in the area which looks to minimise its environmental impact.

Joy aims to build and maintain his guesthouse in the most environmentally sustainable way he can. The lodge will be mostly made of Bamboo. Bamboo is prized as an environmentally-friendly alternative to hardwood. This is because Bamboo grows extremely quickly, thus reducing the negative impact of deforestation.  Depending on the species, bamboo can be harvested in one to five years. Hardwoods like oak take at least forty years to mature before they can be harvested. Almost 1 million acres of forests are lost each week worldwide to deforestation. Bamboo absorbs carbon dioxide and releases 35% more oxygen into the atmosphere than the equivalent in hardwood trees. Also, when Bamboo is used for building, very little of the plant is wasted. Joy will grow the Bamboo himself on site, thus meaning there will be no petrol used for transportation of materials. Furthermore, where hardwood is needed, he will use wood reclaimed from local house demolitions. He will also source any furniture needed from local house demolitions, again reducing the environmental toll of petrol emissions. The environment will be considered during every step of the hotel build, from the building of the structure, to the selection of furnishings and fittings to the running of the hotel itself . When the hotel is open, Joy will provide free drinking water, reducing the need for buying bottles of water and will aim to use the least environmentally damaging products for maintaining the property, All food cooked at the lodge will be made from locally-grown produce. 


Making Traditional Shan Hats

Shan Women Celebrating New Year


What We Need & What You Get


Joy preparing Bamboo for a build.

Your money will go towards the materials needed in order to build the education centre and guesthouse. Joy has already purchased the land necessary and will be building the school himself. 

  • $5000 will be spent on the Training, Cooking Class Centre, Reception and Breakfast area. This will be split between the materials and cost of labour for Joy to hire someone to assist him with the build.
  • $1500 will cover the the License for the guesthouse.
  • $10,000 will be used to build ten rooms - in order to get a hotel license in Myanmar, your establishment must have at least ten rooms. This money will cover the cost of the materials, labour, furniture, furnishings, plumbing etc, 
  • $1500 will be spent on organising electricity  for the hotel and will be used to pay for the government license, for payment to the village chief to gain permission to install it and the wires, poles, bulbs, sockets and meters
  • $2000 - will be spent on the remaining facilities - furniture, plates, kitchen equipment, washing facilities and soft furnishings.
Joy will cover any remaining costs personally.


Villagers Steaming Tea Leaves

To thank you for your contribution, Joy will help you to explore the amazing history, culture and landscapes of Shan State.
Our Perks aim to thank you for your generosity by providing you with a range of ways to get to know all about the people you will be helping through the project, Whatever you are, be it  a wanderluster, fashionista, nature lover, history buff, adventure junkie, culture vulture, travel-head or the next Jamie Oliver, we have something in mind for you. Please  check out our perks on the right hand of this page for more information.

Furthermore, please note that If our entire goal is not reached, the funds will still be used towards the project. Joy will initially build the Training Centre and Cooking and Meditation Class area, so he will be able to begin training new guides right away. He will then use the money made from running the cooking classes and running tours towards building the guesthouse. If you come before the rooms are built, Joy will still be able to offer tours, cooking and meditation classes and will arrange alternative accommodation for you.

Kyuakme is an incredibly beautiful, yet off the-beaten-track place to visit in Myanmar. It is surrounded by serene green mountains, monasteries and villages. There are still some local ethnic groups such as Shan, Palaung and Lishu living in the mountains around Kyaukme. Most tourists often venture out around Hsipaw and Kalaw which are considered as the best trekking in Myanmar, but Kyaukme offers trekking off the tourist trail and provides good chance to experience something different and unique. 



          "The trekking is usually to Palaung villages. The Palaung which are the main ethnic group in the area, make a living from cultivating and trading tea, cutting wood and trading herbal plants. Originally, Palaung descended from the mountains in the South of China thousands of years ago. There are many types of Palaung but two live in this region. They are Shwe Palaung (Gold Palaung) and Ngwe Palaung (Silver Palaung). You can tell the difference by the colour of their belts, which are made of bamboo and a kind of long grass. They have beautiful traditional costumes weaved of different-coloured fabric. It is interesting how they wear the traditional dress in their daily lives, as normally people in Myanmar only  wear their traditional clothes when a festival is celebrated. You can see Palaung people picking tea leaves on the hillside, steaming tea leaves and scattering them in the sun for drying. They produce three kinds of tea which are green tea, pickled tea and tea powder. Most families still live in the typical houses made of bamboo and thatch and with a small garden in front. It is also extremely interesting to learn about their culture and religion. They consider themselves as Buddhists but they also hold spiritual beliefs. Each village has a beautiful Nat Shrine. They call it Zhao Main which means King of Nat. They believe that the Nat has supernatural power that is able to help people with business and health problems and protect the village from various disasters. They have many interesting stories concerned about spirits. Once you get in the village, you'll encounter everybody welcoming you to have a seat in the house and a cup of tea. The children there think you might be from another planet because they don't see tourists often and some of them even run a way as soon as they see you. People in the mountains are also happy to meet you and curious to know how people live in western world as it's quite a rare opportunity and they don't travel a lot." - Joy. For more information about his tour-guiding company, check out Joy's website at http://shanprinces.webs.com/


Members of the Palaung Ethnic Group in traditional dress


A Palaung Woman Weaving a Traditional Bag

A Palaung Woman Preparing Thread for Weaving

Kyaukme is easily accessible from Mandalay by a famous railroad that takes you over the second highest bridge in the world, with spectacular views of local villages, mountains, gorges, rivers and lush green forests, or by bus or taxi. A natural hot spring, Buddhas made of bamboo, stunning viewpoints and pagodas, interesting paper factories are all close by and worth a visit. It is also close to Hsipaw and Pwin Oo Lwyin, two areas enjoyed by tourists.

Mountains surrounding Kyaukme


My name is Joy. I am a Shan ethnic. I work as a trekking guide and a local English teacher. I have been  working as a guide for over ten years. 


I am looking to develop a guesthouse and trekking business in my town. I want to use the guesthouse as a social enterprise where young people can learn the necessary skills to benefit from the growing tourism opportunities that are developing in Myanmar. This is because there are not enough jobs in my town. A lot of the young people have to leave their homes and go to big cities to find jobs. Some of them even have to go out of Myanmar to Thailand or China, where they often face a multitude of problems. They are vulnerable to  human trafficking, are often underpaid, or not paid at all. It is all too common for individuals to be trafficked on to fishing boats, to be beaten, starved, not paid and to never see their families again. They often have to undertake dangerous work in poor conditions, such as in factories and mines and many are killed or injured. Many are treated unfairly by overseas police, have their visas taken off them or are imprisoned,  It is heartbreaking to live in an area where these risks are often people's only choices to survive, and devastating to see this happen to people in my community. This is why creating an alternative to this is so important to me. Also, it is hard for people to have to leave their families in order to get work. They don't want to leave their families. They would prefer to stay in Kyaukme and get a job if they have job options here. That's why I would like to help them.


The tourism boom in Myanmar, which has begun to have huge positive effects in certain areas, is being stunted in Kyaukme due to the lack of decent hotel options. Currently there is no hotel that Western Tourists are happy to stay in for more than a night or two, due to issues with cleanliness and noise. This is having a huge negative effect on the potentially transformative effect tourism can have in Kyaukme in providing secure jobs and generating income. By building a hotel that meets the needs of tourists, I hope to increase tourism within Kyaukme, thus creating more safe and local jobs for youths.

By kindly donating to this cause, you will have a huge positive impact of the local community. You will give young people the skills to be able to find safe, decent paid jobs, You will ensure that they are able to stay with their families and not face the potential dangers faced by Myanmar workers overseas. You will help the development of an area plagued by poverty, within the third poorest country in the whole of Asia. 


A Local Bamboo Paper Factory

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you feel passionately about this project, but are not able to make a financial contribution? Don't worry, there are other ways you can help!

  • Please let others who may be interested in this project know about it!
  • Share  this via facebook, email, twitter, word of mouth, or by whatever means possible!
Any assistance will be greatly welcomed! 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about our project. If you have any questions, please feel free to get in touch!
story_txt:
We are looking to raise funds to construct an Eco-lodge, Meditation Centre, Shan Cooking School and Training Centre for Underprivileged Youths in Myanmar.

My name is Eleanor I am running this campaign on behalf of Joy, a local English and Tourism teacher and Tour Guide in Kyaukme, Shan State, Myanmar. It is Joy's ambition to build a center dedicated to assisting local youths gain invaluable vocational skills, to preserving local traditions through the teaching of Shan cooking and providing visitors to Kyaukme with a eco-friendly and peaceful retreat and meditation centre in the beautiful mountains of Shan State, Myanmar.



Joy leading a motorbike tour


Myanmar is ranked as a country with Low Human Development according to the UNDP. It faces a multitude of barriers to development.
 


'Myanmar is rich in resources, including oil, timber, gas and gems, but remains one of the world’s poorest countries... There has been an exodus of young people seeking work in neighbouring Thailand; people trafficking is endemic.' - Gethin Chamberlain, reporting for The Guardian


Furthermore, young  people face significant barriers to education. A recent study has found that 1 in 5 children miss school - http://goo.gl/Tok0uo -as they instead need to work in order to support their families.



Palaung Women Sheltering from the Rain



Myanmar is also benefiting from a boom in tourism in recent years. Joy has over ten years experience in the tourism sector of Kyaukme and has seen that this boom can help to transform the lives of young people in the area. Tour-guiding is the most lucrative form of work in the area. At the moment, young people have limited options when it comes to work; they must leave the town and be separated from their families. Employment opportunities are further limited by lack of access to formal education, which many youths experience. However, through education in foreign languages and in tourism, Joy will be able to assist young people in gaining the qualifications they need in order to become a certified guide in Kyaukme. 



Kyaukme Guides after gaining their certification.




The style of the training centre and guesthouse that will be created.



The Bamboo Project has a number of ambitions - 

- To create a space where unprivileged young people can benefit from learning the skills needed to work within the tourism industry. 

Joy has been working as a teacher and tour guide (http://shanprinces.webs.com/) for over ten years and has a plethora of experience in delivering  this training. Being a guide is the only way for young people in the community to earn a decent  living salary. It is also one of the few roles in the area which is not  dangerous, such as mining or factory work.  It is a role which allows the any young person to not have to face separation from their family, which is endemic in Kyaukme despite being extremely damaging as Myanmar has an extremely family-orientated culture.
The lodge will also be the only guesthouse in the area outside of the main town, providing visitors with the opportunity to experience the serenity and beauty of the natural landscape surrounding Kyaukme.


- To operate a Shan Cooking School, helping to educate people about and preserving the local Shan culture.


- To provide a peaceful place where visitors can benefit from learning the art of meditation in a beautiful natural setting.

- To create the first guesthouse in the area which looks to minimise its environmental impact.

Joy aims to build and maintain his guesthouse in the most environmentally sustainable way he can. The lodge will be mostly made of Bamboo. Bamboo is prized as an environmentally-friendly alternative to hardwood. This is because Bamboo grows extremely quickly, thus reducing the negative impact of deforestation.  Depending on the species, bamboo can be harvested in one to five years. Hardwoods like oak take at least forty years to mature before they can be harvested. Almost 1 million acres of forests are lost each week worldwide to deforestation. Bamboo absorbs carbon dioxide and releases 35% more oxygen into the atmosphere than the equivalent in hardwood trees. Also, when Bamboo is used for building, very little of the plant is wasted. Joy will grow the Bamboo himself on site, thus meaning there will be no petrol used for transportation of materials. Furthermore, where hardwood is needed, he will use wood reclaimed from local house demolitions. He will also source any furniture needed from local house demolitions, again reducing the environmental toll of petrol emissions. The environment will be considered during every step of the hotel build, from the building of the structure, to the selection of furnishings and fittings to the running of the hotel itself . When the hotel is open, Joy will provide free drinking water, reducing the need for buying bottles of water and will aim to use the least environmentally damaging products for maintaining the property, All food cooked at the lodge will be made from locally-grown produce. 





Making Traditional Shan Hats




Shan Women Celebrating New Year





What We Need & What You Get



Joy preparing Bamboo for a build.



Your money will go towards the materials needed in order to build the education centre and guesthouse. Joy has already purchased the land necessary and will be building the school himself. 



$5000 will be spent on the Training, Cooking Class Centre, Reception and Breakfast area. This will be split between the materials and cost of labour for Joy to hire someone to assist him with the build.

$1500 will cover the the License for the guesthouse.

$10,000 will be used to build ten rooms - in order to get a hotel license in Myanmar, your establishment must have at least ten rooms. This money will cover the cost of the materials, labour, furniture, furnishings, plumbing etc, 
$1500 will be spent on organising electricity  for the hotel and will be used to pay for the government license, for payment to the village chief to gain permission to install it and the wires, poles, bulbs, sockets and meters

$2000 - will be spent on the remaining facilities - furniture, plates, kitchen equipment, washing facilities and soft furnishings.


Joy will cover any remaining costs personally.





Villagers Steaming Tea Leaves



To thank you for your contribution, Joy will help you to explore the amazing history, culture and landscapes of Shan State.

Our Perks aim to thank you for your generosity by providing you with a range of ways to get to know all about the people you will be helping through the project, Whatever you are, be it  a wanderluster, fashionista, nature lover, history buff, adventure junkie, culture vulture, travel-head or the next Jamie Oliver, we have something in mind for you. Please  check out our perks on the right hand of this page for more information.

Furthermore, please note that If our entire goal is not reached, the funds will still be used towards the project. Joy will initially build the Training Centre and Cooking and Meditation Class area, so he will be able to begin training new guides right away. He will then use the money made from running the cooking classes and running tours towards building the guesthouse. If you come before the rooms are built, Joy will still be able to offer tours, cooking and meditation classes and will arrange alternative accommodation for you.

story:
Verdant Ground

Verdant Ground Organic Garden Co-op is a collection of members that garden together and share in the harvest. For 40 years, Shirley has lived on these 70 acres of land near the Grand Traverse Bay.  Sue joined her in 2001 and together, they founded Verdant Ground Organic Garden Co-op in 2005.

 Shirley Jons (who holds space with the sweat lodges at Fest, Brooklyn, and other places) and her partner Sue (a fabulous shoemaker) have made this beautiful life on this amazing Land where they grow organic food. Your help will allow them to create a seasonal rental that can bring you close to the Land, and make some authentic space for community.

The Vision - from Shirley & Sue

The 45th parallel, where we live here in Northern Michigan, is a vacation destination and we plan to renovate our small cottage, that overlooks the gardens, into a seasonal rental. We are confident that we can generate the income we need to further our goal once the cottage is fully upgraded. We intend to do this with our knowledge, skills, ingenuity and community labor.

Your contributions will buy the materials:

·  1st phase : external renovations - $2,000

o  Complete the cedar siding

o  New skirting around perimeter

·  2nd phase : internal renovations - $3,000

o  Renovate kitchen

o  Replace shower unit

You may be wondering how we are going to pull this off for only $5,000.  We re-use, recycle, and there will be no expenses for labor because we will provide that with our own blood, sweat and tears.

The creation of the cottage business will enable Sue and Shirley to continue to realize their goals. The projects and events that happen on this land both nourish and sustain those who participate.

Will you help? Say yes.

story:
What's it all about?

Hi! This campaign is the very beginning of the story of my dad, who suddenly decided to regain control of his life and chase his ultimate dream: To travel the world... on a motorbike! 

About dad:

Bülent. 60 years old, typical workaholic. 

Has spent most of his life working way too much to support his family, and hasn’t really had the chance to truly enjoy life.

One day he realised he's had enough, retired straight away, and... well... spent all his pension funds on an Africa Twin 2016 to travel the world. (Good call, dad! Not the best example of money management though, is it? :D )

His first trip starts in June 2016 from Turkey, cuts through gorgeous lands of Iran, Pakistan and India, and finally ends in Nepal in approximately 2 months. 

Once he arrives in Nepal, he will announce his next route. (And so on...)

He will share interviews with locals and other wanderers he meets on the road, and all sorts of other videos  via his blog, Ride 2 Liveliness, where you will also find road notes, trip updates, live streams, and various other posts by him.

He's planning to complete his world tour in 2019.

About Me:

I'm Tamer. 32 years old, typical goood laaaad. :))

Audio engineer and voiceover artist.

I've worked in several different fields of the industry in Istanbul, such as music production, post-production-audio, voiceover recording, and education. 

After a few years, I decided to live a simple, relaxed life in a small town, and keep recording my own voiceovers at home, as well as occasionally getting involved in sound design and post-production.

The reason I started this campaign was the very strong desire to help my dad to make his "ultimate dream" come true, as he's always supported me for who I am and whatever it was I wanted to do. (Thanks a lot, and good luck,dad!) 

And the deal?

OK... It's pretty straight forward. Basically, we're trying to fund the kickstart for dad's world tour, Ride 2 Liveliness. We need $5000 to approximately cover:

- Accommodation, food and fuel untill Nepal: $2400 ($40 per day)

- Border passes, technical maintenance, data storage, mobile internet, potential medical expenditures.

- Kickstart money for route #2 (TBA): After Nepal, dad will start collecting and selling tiny souvenirs on the road to finance the rest of the tour himself. So, he will need some startup capital for that too. :)

Well, we certainly want to thank you with our perks! We know it isn't a lot, but really hope you'll like them! Please check 'em out.

To be totally honest, we really believe that campaigns like this one are mostly about sharing the sense of unity by supporting each other's dreams. Plus, we're pretty sure you will absolutely love the content on Ride 2 Liveliness. We promise we'll do our best to make you truly feel part of the adventure! 

Many thanks in advance for your support, even if it's by spreading the word! 

We will keep you updated... a lot! :) Let's Ride 2 Liveliness!

www.ride2liveliness.com

ride2liveliness.wordpress.com

www.facebook.com/Ride2Liveliness

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi, I'm Damien Lee a noodle lover and recent cancer survivor. Because of my health experience, I'm a big believer of "You are what you eat". I have therefore created a healthier guilt free, gourmet, no nasties, gluten-free instant cup noodle soup.  In addition to the noodles, I have also developed for our noodles an innovative noodle kiosk (vending machine) with a 32 inch touch screen that will eventually be rolled out into universities, hospitals, defence force bases, offices and more.
  • Our touch screens as they role out into different demographic locations will play amazing content that our team is creating to inspire people to eat better and to do better with their lives. "LIVE BETTER"
  • Our Noodles have personality and each of our flavours have a name and characteristic which will become part of each inspiring story we will tell on our screens about these personalities. "Warrior Fighting Shrimp" "Shaolin Monk Vegetables" "Tai Chi Chicken" "Hong Kong Street Beef" "Dragon Fire Mushroom" & "Penang Chicken Curry Laksa" more will follow in their footsteps...
  • I care about what people eat and I want to bring the world a much healthier instant noodle to a sector full of junk and with an innovative twist. There is much excitement in what we are doing. We start a pilot program for our noodle kiosks in the summer with the worlds largest contract catering company. This company operates 10's of thousands of corporate sites across more than 80 countries- The sites include universities, hospitals, government offices, defence force bases, sports stadiums & corporate offices etc. We also have the buyers for a number of large international airlines negotiating with us to put our noodles on board their aircraft and it doesn't stop there.
  • Our first 6 flavours will be packed and ready late June this year and our first pilot noodle kiosks will be ready in July- Online sales for the noodles will commence the end of June.
  • The world eats more than 100 billion instant noodles a year and growing- help Mr Lee's Noodles bring a healthier and better offering thats in no way bad for you, so noodle lovers the world over can eat better. I'm therefore appealing to the Indiegogo community to help me launch so that I can bring my noodles to the world wider and faster. 
What We Need & What You Get
  • We need further funding to help us in our R&D to further develop our technology and App for the noodle kiosks as well as develop more flavours and packaging. 
  • Our noodle kiosks we are developing are unique and will have many great features. They are interactive and will engage with consumers as well as being cashless. We need funding to help complete these so we can role them out into the market from this summer.
  • We currently have 6 amazing flavours in our noodle family but we really would like to expand this to 10. So 4 more amazing flavours need to be developed and packed hopefully with your help.
  • In return for helping us, the Indiegogo community will be some of the first people in the world to try an amazing new gluten free healthy instant noodle. On our new website coming in June we are building a wall to thank all those that helped launch this brand and this will stay up forever for everyone to see who made it possible for Mr Lee's.
  • Finally there are opportunities to appear in some of the great videos-infomercials we are making which will appear on our kiosk screens and beyond.
  • Or if you really want something special- Have one of our noodle soups named after you.
  • Or even have a Mr Lee's Noodle kiosk at your event

The Impact

  • I care about what people eat and for years people have been putting rubbish into their bodies through unhealthy eating. Big companies have contributed to this by putting so many of these nasties into our food. The instant noodle sector has been one of the worst. With the millions and millions of people eating these the world over, I felt it was time to start making a change to this.
  • I'm an entrepreneur and I have built many businesses from inception all through my life. Not all have gone on but some I have sold on and are still going strong today. In fact one of them is now the 2nd largest maritime satellite communications company in the world and all have become financially viable.
  • I have always in my small way been able to create jobs in my community where ever that has been in Sydney, Sweden, Singapore, Paris and the UK and now again at Mr Lee's in sunny Bournemouth. We have an amazing little team of passionate individuals who believe in what we are doing and all determined to help bring better eating to the world and hopefully help inspire a generation by it.
  • Please help us bring a better gourmet no nasties noodle to the world.
  • Our tag line at Mr Lee' is simply "LIVE BETTER"

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute financially we understand completely but if you can share our story to help get it out that is all we ask. We humbly thank you in advance.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools or go to our Facebook or Twitter
Visit Mr Lee's Noodles website to find out more!
story_txt:
Short Summary  Hi, I'm Damien Lee a noodle lover and recent cancer survivor. Because of my health experience, I'm a big believer of "You are what you eat". I have therefore created a healthier guilt free, gourmet, no nasties, gluten-free instant cup noodle soup.  In addition to the noodles, I have also developed for our noodles an innovative noodle kiosk (vending machine) with a 32 inch touch screen that will eventually be rolled out into universities, hospitals, defence force bases, offices and more.

Our touch screens as they role out into different demographic locations will play amazing content that our team is creating to inspire people to eat better and to do better with their lives. "LIVE BETTER"
Our Noodles have personality and each of our flavours have a name and characteristic which will become part of each inspiring story we will tell on our screens about these personalities. "Warrior Fighting Shrimp" "Shaolin Monk Vegetables" "Tai Chi Chicken" "Hong Kong Street Beef" "Dragon Fire Mushroom" & "Penang Chicken Curry Laksa" more will follow in their footsteps... I care about what people eat and I want to bring the world a much healthier instant noodle to a sector full of junk and with an innovative twist. There is much excitement in what we are doing. We start a pilot program for our noodle kiosks in the summer with the worlds largest contract catering company. This company operates 10's of thousands of corporate sites across more than 80 countries- The sites include universities, hospitals, government offices, defence force bases, sports stadiums & corporate offices etc. We also have the buyers for a number of large international airlines negotiating with us to put our noodles on board their aircraft and it doesn't stop there.

Our first 6 flavours will be packed and ready late June this year and our first pilot noodle kiosks will be ready in July- Online sales for the noodles will commence the end of June.
The world eats more than 100 billion instant noodles a year and growing- help Mr Lee's Noodles bring a healthier and better offering thats in no way bad for you, so noodle lovers the world over can eat better. I'm therefore appealing to the Indiegogo community to help me launch so that I can bring my noodles to the world wider and faster. 

What We Need & What You Get
  We need further funding to help us in our R&D to further develop our technology and App for the noodle kiosks as well as develop more flavours and packaging. 
Our noodle kiosks we are developing are unique and will have many great features. They are interactive and will engage with consumers as well as being cashless. We need funding to help complete these so we can role them out into the market from this summer.
We currently have 6 amazing flavours in our noodle family but we really would like to expand this to 10. So 4 more amazing flavours need to be developed and packed hopefully with your help. In return for helping us, the Indiegogo community will be some of the first people in the world to try an amazing new gluten free healthy instant noodle. On our new website coming in June we are building a wall to thank all those that helped launch this brand and this will stay up forever for everyone to see who made it possible for Mr Lee's.
Finally there are opportunities to appear in some of the great videos-infomercials we are making which will appear on our kiosk screens and beyond.
Or if you really want something special- Have one of our noodle soups named after you.
Or even have a Mr Lee's Noodle kiosk at your event    The Impact  I care about what people eat and for years people have been putting rubbish into their bodies through unhealthy eating. Big companies have contributed to this by putting so many of these nasties into our food. The instant noodle sector has been one of the worst. With the millions and millions of people eating these the world over, I felt it was time to start making a change to this. I'm an entrepreneur and I have built many businesses from inception all through my life. Not all have gone on but some I have sold on and are still going strong today. In fact one of them is now the 2nd largest maritime satellite communications company in the world and all have become financially viable. I have always in my small way been able to create jobs in my community where ever that has been in Sydney, Sweden, Singapore, Paris and the UK and now again at Mr Lee's in sunny Bournemouth. We have an amazing little team of passionate individuals who believe in what we are doing and all determined to help bring better eating to the world and hopefully help inspire a generation by it.
Please help us bring a better gourmet no nasties noodle to the world.
Our tag line at Mr Lee' is simply "LIVE BETTER"


    Other Ways You Can Help 
If you can't contribute financially we understand completely but if you can share our story to help get it out that is all we ask. We humbly thank you in advance. Please use the Indiegogo share tools or go to our Facebook or Twitter 
Visit Mr Lee's Noodles website to find out more!

story:
SUPPORT - WOMEN’S SMALL BUSINESS INITIATIVE!

Our small business sector is the fastest-growing, most diverse, greatest contributor of new jobs to our local, national and global economy. Did you know that?

ü  There are nearly 11.3 million women owned businesses in the United States; employing nearly 9 million and generating over $1.6 trillion in revenues (Source: NAWBO).

ü  Small businesses make up more than 99.7% of all employers in the country and employ half of all private sector employees.

ü  More than 45% of the private sector payroll is generated by small business.

ü  Over the last decade, small businesses have accounted for 60 to 80% of all new jobs created on an annual basis.

ü  Employees at small businesses produce 13 to 14 times more patents than those employed by larger companies.

ü  Small businesses create more than 50 percent of the non-farm private gross domestic product (GDP).

ü  The 22.9 million small businesses in the United States are located in virtually every neighborhood and small businesses employ about 50 percent of all private sector workers.

About Campaign

It is obvious that small businesses are the growth engine of the economy! Yet this community of entrepreneurs remain highly fragmented, and many business owners struggle to launch, grow and scale their small businesses. Here at Women's Small Business Initiative (WSBI), we have amazing efforts underway to grow our creative economy, yet we have barely scratched the surface of our potential with our substantial small business initiatives for women.

What Women's Small Business Initiative Offers

Women’s Small Business Initiative provides several services or resources for "FREE" to aspiring entrepreneurs and women owned businesses anywhere in the US. 

The Women's Small Business Initiative (WSBI) is a virtual meeting of the minds. Our unique online platform will change the way you network by allowing you to contact, converse and collaborate with other women who own a small business.

The WSBI is designed to assist women who own small businesses in both innovative and practical ways. Our services includes:

v  Free membership.

v  Small business consulting.

v  Podcast program.

v  Keynote speaking engagements.

v  Small Business Self-Study program or Workshop.

Why Fund Us

Kimberly McLemore is an Author and a renowned Management Analyst with over 25 years of working experience in the Project Management, Senior Consultant and Management Analyst fields; with an amazing communication skill. She is an effective leader and a team player with track records of providing management support to the government: overseeing multi-million dollar projects utilizing business acumen and establishing relationships.

Kimberly is the Founder/Owner of the Women’s Small Business Initiative, LLC that provides a unique online platform designed to be a one-stop-shop pool of resources that will showcase businesses, unite, consult, provide mentorship, and networking events for members.

What We Need

To sustain the Women’s Small Business Initiative to continue offering FREE services to aspiring entrepreneurs and women business owners we need your support.

In the meantime, we must count on people like you, almost for the very success of this campaign. Your right attitude, your open-mindedness, your prayer, and most importantly your FINANCIAL SUPPORT can see us through to actualizing this goal. We wonder if you'll help us with $10, $25, $50, $100 or any amount at all; it would be much appreciated and well used.

I know that you don't always have extra cash on hand to support crowdfunding projects, but still want to see them succeed.  Here are some concrete things you can do to support this project:

Ø  Share this campaign with friends and family who might benefit.

Ø  Drop us an email if you have funding ideas, interesting connections or advice (Insert Your Email Here).

Ø  Send your good vibes. We will feel them, and they will give us courage to take this project all the way to the finish line.

Together We Can Make Our Economy Great!

story:
In 2011, Sean Baldwin chose to move to Baltimore on a journey into an unknown city to work on his dreams.  While the city life attracted him, it was the magical warehouse he found that brought him to make the leap into Baltimore knowing no one there.   Wide open space, a loft on top with an apartment, it was perfect for a musician and entrepreneur like himsilf to try to start the next chapter in life.

 

Burgundy Street is home to Be More Productions, Live at the Box, Hard Rock Radio and PimpNBeats Studios.

Be More Productions is a full service live production company focusing on helping clients push their creativity to the next level for events ranging from weddings to concerts to professional corporate functions.

Live at the Box brings live streaming to the DMV, and offers streaming services with flexible pricing options tailored to the independent artist. With the ability to live stream with multiple cameras and real time effects, the content produced is cutting edge and shows it in high production quality.

PimpNBeats Studios is a state of the art hip hop and RnB recording studio. Combining the ability to customize beats or songs with top notch service and equipment, PimpNBeats has risen to be the place where underground artist record and produce the rawest, realest Baltimore Hip Hop.

Hard Rock Radio is a song writing team created by Lee Evan that has been working on perfecting their craft for many years. By lifting the many timeless elements of hard rock and putting them in one place, Hard Rock Radio is ready to take a prominent role in the Baltimore music rock scene.


Fast forward to 2017.

Be More Productions is a fully operational, expanding business, providing the best quality services possible to local and regional events, shows and business.  Live at the Box is born, opening up even more possibilities for achieving success. I went from knowing no one in Baltimore to knowing thousands, and not just knowing people, but genuinely helping anyone I could with what I had.

Then the current issues surfaced: someone made an offer to buy the  building.  Everything was going so well and then suddenly all three tenants are forced with the decision to either exercise our right of first refusal as tenants and buy the building or get out.

So Burgundy Ally LLC was created with the goal to purchase the warehouse and protect the interests of all parties involved. This consists of myself and my partner Lee Evan, as well as  Neil Cramblett who is helping manage the two of us.

The property is a 4,268 square foot warehouse in the Carroll/Camden district in Baltimore, Maryland. It is being offered for $210,000 while having a market value estimated at $280,000.

We have set up financing through the property owner and a private lender but need help with the down payment and closing cost. So far, between myself and my partner Burgundy Ally LLC has $25,000.00 for the down payment and closing cost. The property owner has agreed to finance $45,000.00. We are looking for anything and everything to help out. The smaller we can get the private lender loan, the better.

Our goal is to raise over $25,000.00 through our friends, family and network of colleagues to help us secure our future here at Burgundy Street. With your help, this building will allow us to take everything we are doing to the next level while creating equity for our businesses and giving the community a place where the can broadcast their culture, art and music to the internet.

Our pledge to you is we will work hard to make this warehouse a driving force in the Baltimore community. With plans of expanding and creating jobs and opportunities, to finding more ways to offer services to artist and musicians who can not afford them, we want you to know Baltimore is home. By helping us buy the warehouse, your helping us expose and grow the underground culture we are so happy to be a part of.

With you, we can continue to grow and help expose the underground culture Baltimore has to offer through Live at the Box. We will be able to focus on the future while shrinking our overhead in the long run and creating equity. We’ll be able to continue our plans, potentially opening up endless opportunities for the community.

Please like and share our campaign and help spread the word!

story:
Hello Everyone!
    Before I get into specifics, let me introduce our team and give you information into the company. Stan Nesbitt: 17 years gaming experience, his first game was Warcraft 2: Tides of Darkness. His background includes: Networking, minor programming and graphic design. Then there is Meaghan Wakefield: 13 years gaming experience her first game was basically everything Sega Dreamcast released. Her background is in creative design and creature/character design. After that is Spencer Chamberlain: 19 years gaming experience, his first game was Dungeons & Dragons. His background includes programming and networking. Finally there is me, Angelo Mirabito: 23 years gaming experience, my first games were Dungeons & Dragons and Super Mario on NES. My background includes, management, graphic design and minor programming.
  
One more second before we get into this campaign, our Company. Our company is called Illusion Games LLC, we formed in June of this year, 2016. The sole purpose of our company is to make games by gamers for gamers. As you read before, we play and love games, in all their forms. We’ve played card games, console games, pc games and various tabletop games, and we plan to use all of our combined experience to create them as well. You heard me right, we plan to get into all areas of gaming, from creating brand new twists on loved-genres to mechanic breaking games in the digital world. We have a huge love for games and you will see that in all of our creations.
  
On to the campaign, as you can see games are important to us and our family and friends. We are wanting to build our business and raise the funds so that all of our ideas will eventually come to fruitition, we understand that not all of our ideas are gold and we have realized which of them isn’t great. We strongly believe in all the games and concepts, good or bad we have come up with, we have a process of keeping even the worst ideas available because maybe a small change or adjustment can make them amazing! We have started making prototype games and testing multiples of our games so that we can release our games quickly. Currently we have 3 games designed and in testing, 2 more ready for design and development and countless waiting in our many, many notebooks.
  Now this is where you all come in, with your help, and potential funding you will help us take this from starting to started. These funds, while they seem like a lot, will give the opportunity to move our business to a new location and give my wife her dining room back, as well as hire more personnel, better equipment, extra licensing and most importantly time. Time is what we need, and by sharing this campaign which could give someone the opportunity to fund or by funding this campaign yourself, YOU all are helping us save time getting our dreams to come to life.

What your contributions will specifically be helping us achieve will be:
1.) A place for the business, we plan on using a portion to lease or purchase a place for the business to run out of, like I said earlier, that isn’t    a dining room.
2.) The ability to focus a lot more time on the company and our products, we have families, full-time jobs and various other responsibilities. This money will gives us the peace of mind to have the ability to focus on our company like it’s our lives, but if you read earlier it’s a big part of all our lives.
3.) Better equipment, we have various skill sets to be able to produce and create an amazing end-game product, but lack the funding to have the equipment to match that.
4.) Personnel, we have busy lives, like I mentioned two points ago, so being able to hire extra people lets us produce games faster, since we will have the time (mentioned earlier) and the people to get things moving fast.
5.) Finally finishing up our license and formation requirements that we can’t fully complete on our own.

    Again with your help and with the perks that are in place, our amazing mold-breaking games will be available for everyone to enjoy. We know many of you have played games and had ideas, but never submitted them to the company because you know they won’t read your suggestions or possibly didn’t know how to. We want to change that, feedback, opinions, questions and comments are ALWAYS welcome. Not only that but we want to give opportunity to all, employment wise. Now have you ever read through job ads and see something similar to “Want 5-8 years of experience in this field.”? Well we want experience but are willing to give new artists and programmers the chance to prove they are as capable as others in the same field. So essentially, you are helping us not only create molding-breaking new games, but change the face of business as well.

    Now we know that running a business isn’t always pleasant, we will have obstacles and hurdles even after we have the funding to proceed. Some of them being, programming/bugs, manufacturer’s schedules, print errors, or slow development. All of these can be big problems, but we plan to handle these as quickly and efficiently as possible. If we can create, develop and manufacture on an early schedule, all of these errors will not be felt by anyone. Our biggest hurdle and obstacle in this market will be Big Name Competition. Most if not all of you are familiar with creators like Activision, Hasbro, Bethesda, Mattel and Blizzard. Well we might not have the big name behind us yet, but our fresh, creative and innovative games will be able to compete in the market with them. We have confidence that we will overcome any and all obstacles in our way.

   All that being said we appreciate any comments, feedback and questions, feel free to email us @ illusiongamesllc@gmail.com , we will try to answer you within 24 hours, but please bear with us if it’s later than that. Also if you can’t, are unable or just don’t want to fund our endeavor, please just share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tool. Post us to your Facebook page, twitter feed or even snapchat/Instagram your excitement! We thank you for taking the time to read this and be involved and for being part of our community and family.

Thank you Everyone,
Illusion Games LLC Family.

All of these can be big problems, but we plan to handle these as quickly and efficiently as possible. If we can create, develop and manufacture on an early schedule, all of these errors will not be felt by anyone. Our biggest hurdle and obstacle in this market will be Big Name Competition. Most if not all of you are familiar with creators like Activision, Hasbro, Bethesda, Mattel and Blizzard. Well we might not have the big name behind us yet, but our fresh, creative and innovative games will be able to compete in the market with them. We have confidence that we will overcome any and all obstacles in our way.   All that being said we appreciate any comments, feedback and questions, feel free to email us @ illusiongamesllc@gmail.com , we will try to answer you within 24 hours, but please bear with us if it’s later than that. Also if you can’t, are unable or just don’t want to fund our endeavor, please just share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tool. Post us to your Facebook page, twitter feed or even snapchat/Instagram your excitement! We thank you for taking the time to read this and be involved and for being part of our community and family.Thank you Everyone,Illusion Games LLC Family.

story:
The Fasty Rascals (Dave Dampier and Muneer Hassan) have entered this years Dakar Challenge. We will be leaving Peterborough in the UK on 26th December and driving our 1985 Volvo 340 to Banjul in Gambia over a three week period. We will be raising money for both local Charities in Gambia and for Cancer Research UK as our chosen charity.

We are offering you the chance to donate to our chosen charities with 50% going to each charity. Or we also have Corporate Sponsorship Packages where we are inviting businesses to advertise on our vehicle and be involved in the Social Media campaign. The funds from the Sponsorship deals will be split evenly between the Charities and helping out with running costs. We are aiming to raise £1000 for charity and will be donating our car for auction in Gambia upon arrival.

Please give as little or as much as you feel appropriate. All sponsors and donations will be credited and published after the rally with a certificate of appreciation. Your support is very much needed and appreciated.

If you have any further questions please do not hesitate to contact me.

Kind regards

The Fasty Rascals (Dave & Moony)

story:
ROYAL: of a quality or size suitable for a king or queen; synonyms:excellent, fine, magnificent, splendid, superb, wonderful, first-rate, first-class.

 

A SNO CONE BUS WITH A VERY BIG MISSION

Hi, I’m Melita Carter, owner of Royal Sno Young Entrepreneurs Program. Thanks for visiting and for considering a contribution to help obtain our bus and begin to cultivate young entrepreneurs. 

Royal Sno's  sno cone bus will be shaved ice deliciousness on wheels, taking the finest of snow cone syrup with the option of all-natural syrup for hot sizzling summer days. Royal Sno will be out on Indianapolis roads to cities and towns, markets and music festivals, wherever people crave the taste of a sweet ice shaven sno cone on blazing hot Indy days.

This project isn't just about sno cones. It’s about helping cultivate young entrepreneurs for them to be able to take care of themselves and their families by exposing them to the idea of entrepreneurship. By teaching them how to fish- coupling their education with a hands-on sweat equity experience, they will break the cycles of generational poverty, create generational wealth, reduce crime that is systemically created by the lack of proper financial education  and develop a robust commerce community.   The young inspiring entrepreneurs will spread their knowledge of financial literacy from the window of the sno cone bus in hopes of inspiring others to learn more about how money works and plant the seed needed to inspire future  entrepreneurs.  I want to help my students and their families develop a new money mindset by showing how it plays into their everyday lives and  eradicating the mentality that they are only consumers. I want to inspire them to consider being an owner of a product or service that others can purchase or use.  I’m talking about young entrepreneurs and sno cones rolling around our city creating MAGNIFICENT magic when you walk up to the window of Royal Sno.

OUR GOAL IS TO GET THE SNO CONE BUS OPERATIONAL AND ON THE ROAD BY LATE SPRING 2017. You can track via our Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/royalsno/?fref=hovercard

This is a rendering of the Royal Sno cone bus will look like.  

WHAT'S THE BACK STORY?

If you know me, you know that I am madly and passionately in love with children, community, self-development, self-efficacy, and self-sufficiency. I am currently serving young people and I have been serving young people in many capacities for the past 16 years from youth advocate, informal foster parenting, mentor, and youth development facilitator.  Over the past few years, I have been self-teaching about financial literacy of the stock market and the importance of ownership to your overall quality of life. After careful strategic studying and understanding, I have realized many people who surround me do not know how money works and how their lack of proper financial education is tied to their familial cycles of generational poverty. One day I asked my classroom full of students between the ages of 14-16 years old, "Who makes more money, the owner or the worker?"  They all replied in a loud unison "The worker." My heart immediately shattered because I knew from their response they had no idea about entrepreneurship and how money works. Because of my passion for self-sufficiency, I went on a journey to create an innovative program that will not only teach young people the power of entrepreneurship but will also give them a kinesthetic experience to tangibly lock-in the education.  In addition, I will teach them how to maintain a business with a servant leader's heart. During the second year of the program, the young entrepreneurs will be paired with a mentor  who owns a successful business in the area of their interest. They will shadow this successful entrepreneur to gain more behind the scenes knowledge and advice about their desired industry. Through this experience, it is my hope they will learn the pros and cons to provide them with a more solid foundation for their business to ultimately create a more sustainable business in the future.  As a lifelong learner, I live in the constant state of learning to ensure I am able to teach and help others break down barriers and overcome insurmountable obstacles.  All I require to those I teach is for them to help others.  My dream is to cultivate young people whom the world has deemed ineligible to rise from their ashes like a Phoenix and ferociously move forward into highly sophisticated and intellectually superior entrepreneurs. Royal's Sno philosophy is the ancient proverb that states "Feed a man/woman a fish and they will eat for a day, but TEACH a woman/man and they EAT for a LIFETIME." 

 

What Does Royal Sno Need? Hey! Thanks for Asking!  

The Royal Sno social enterprise  needs a total of $70,000!  

How will the funds be spent?

  • To cut the initial startup cost for the program we have located a used sno cone bus. The seller has been pleasant, patient, and helpful and have given us a huge discount on the bus. The owner is selling all start-up equipment including the bus and an extra generator for the total amount of  $50,000. 
  • The remainder of the funds will be used to relocate the bus from 1,000 miles away to its new home in Indianapolis. A couple of months ago I made the trip to where the bus is located and did a scheduled event with the current owner and afterwards checked over the bus with a fine tooth comb. Also, the funds will be used to cover initial maintenance expenses (new brakes, fixing the sun faded decals on the bus, tune-up, oil change, detailed inspection, registration fees, and initial program material) and initial stationary material for each individual student for the entrepreneur education department of the program which includes 3 program laptops, carrying bags, computer insurance, and computer security. 

 The IMPACT of 1 SNO cone bus?

Your contribution to the Royal Sno Young Entrepreneurs program is vitally important to the world because it will ultimately reduce or eradicate crime in our communities, It will create a community of young people who will lead others to the world of entrepreneurship and build a robust commerce community. Royal Sno will be partnered with other businesses throughout the city to enhance the education experience. I know this will work because we are surrounded by the thought of money and its infinite use. But one thing that is always intriguing to young people is when I tell them that the owner makes more money than the worker. This is a new concept for most who have not been exposed to the idea of entrepreneurship. After breaking it down to them using simple mathematics they are amazed and want to learn more. The youth are pleading for direction, true education about how to navigate the world we live in successfully. Working with youth and entrepreneurship are two things I am deeply passionate about. I have worked with youth in the past who have gone on to do extraordinary things through different paths of their lives. I am relentless and driven by the success of every youth that I encounter.  Also, having the added advantage of being apart one of the top youth serving organizations in my city. I am connected to thousands of opportunities to partner, engage, promote, and fund raise for these worthy causes.  Besides, who doesn't like a delicious sno cone on a hot summer day at the park with their children, at a non-traditional office meeting, during a celebration at a summer daycare or during youth summer programming? 

Can't Donate But Want To Help?...Yes, you can help!

ARE THERE OTHER WAYS TO HELP?

If you would like to help in other ways, here are some things you can do:

  • Come out and support the owner of Royal Sno Melita Carter on February 24 @ 7pm & 25th @ 12pm (Youth Time), 3pm, and 7pm at The Theater at the Fort (8920 Otis Ave, Indlps, IN 46216).  Melita Carter will render a beautiful benefit one woman monologue titled-Shipwrecked But Not Lost.  "In Shipwrecked But Not Lost, Melita Carter navigates her audience through the tumultuous journey of fatherless, suicidal thoughts, and the loss of her childhood innocence. Through poetry and prose, Melita breaks away each layer of shame, depression, and self-loathing as she reveals her naked truth. This one-woman show will certainly be the lighthouse of inspiration her audience may need to confront some raging storms of their pasts. Begin to set sail, and finally dock at their sea shore of liberation and healing."
    For more information please visit artsforlawerence.org and to purchase tickets online please visit http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2821963
  • All you have to do is help spread  the word out about the Royal Sno campaign by sharing this to your facebook, twitter, instagram or other social media platforms. 
  • If you are an Indiana based-entrepreneur and would like to be a volunteer mentor to help give background knowledge and experience of your industry to Royal Sno's future entrepreneurs, that would be a great way for you to help!  If you're interested and excited to work with youth! Please send an email with a small introduction of you and your company to royalsnocones@gmail.com and someone will be in touch with you to schedule a follow-up meeting. 

#RoyallySnowed
