story:
What do we need funding for

We are currently applying for a grant from the South African government under the  Land Redistribution for Agricultural Development (LRAD) programme. In this LRAD programme the government undertakes to support initiatives aimed at developing previously disadvantaged rural areas to help them access land specifically for agricultural purposes, or to make better use of land already accessed. But one of the criteria that need to be satisfied in order to qualify for the grant, is that you must be in a position to make your own contribution (monetary or otherwise) before they can give you the 60%  or more of the rest of the required funding for the project.  We have already accessed land from a few local people who are currently farming the land and they have pledged land to us which straddles the Tugela river and amounts to 10 hectares and more. We have also secured 106 hectares from the local King who has expressed great enthusiasm and excitement about the project.  Once we get a valuator to give us a price for how much the land is worth, the amount will be added towards our contribution. So the money we raise with this campaign will be used to fund the start-up of the project but more importantly it will serve as a bridge to a bigger grant from the government once they see that we have also raised our own capital to contribute towards the project. Below you’ll find a little bit of information about our project, the area which we wish to start in as well as a brief introduction into the team behind this initiative.

A summary of our project

Industrialisation has been a key vehicle for success in present day major economies, ranging from the old powers rooted in colonialism (Great Britain) and looking at the new emerging powers (China) and everything in between (America). These economies all had one common thread leading to their success and this was industrialisation. If one considers South Africa, we have more rural, open land than we know what to do with. Indeed most people are moving away from the rural areas and going into urban areas as they are under the impression that their success lies in those areas. This is a sorely misplaced idea and is one which we as South Africa will pay for dearly as townships will increase, resources with which to help the people moving into townships will still be at a minimum and crime will increase as people become desperate.

Aim of the project

We as Spes Legacies wish to create an alternative narrative in rural area development, urbanisation, poverty alleviation, job creation and indeed education in rural areas. 

Spes legacies will do is to create an environment in the area of uMsinga where the people unite under one cause and one goal; poverty alleviation, job creation and education. We will do this by bringing together all the small farmers into a single entity where they will continue farming their lands but under the supervision of the company which will bring experts in the field of farming. This will help the small holder farmers to maximise the use of their agricultural land. Spes Legacies is set on creating 600 new jobs through this venture, which will create professional jobs in marketing and sales, bookkeeping and farm labourer jobs, tractor drivers, truck drivers and work in a warehouse where there will be washing, packaging and storage of the produce. The success of this business lies in the endorsement of our project by the king and the community. Our end goal is to industrialise uMsinga through farming and to eventually also introduce solar farms so that the local people can get discounted electricity and that the entire area goes green by using solar electricity. The solar power initiative is bound to work because of the layout of the area and the fact that there is sun all year round which can get to 45 degrees celcius. This abundance in solar exposure can be used for the further advancement of the people in Tugela Ferry. But for now we are focusing on agricultural farming.

The problems with the current farming system

Tugela ferry has a sizeable portion of arable land which lies along the Tugela ferry river bed. This land is owned by numerous individuals who each own on average 5 beds. These beds are farmed and have been farmed for generations. But the problem is that the produce produced by a single farmer using their beds is too small to make an impact on the wider economy and to sustain the farmer and their family in the long run. Another problem is that the produce which grows well on the land is always farmed the same way and the same produce is seen on the markets. There is essentially no system of competition law and there is an inadequate amount of business education for these farmers to be more successful and have a greater impact on the local and provincial economy.

Our team’s strengths

The founder of the company and project is armed with a working knowledge of the people and the culture. She is flanked by mature savvy local business owners, who are born in the area and have built their success in the area and from working the soil, as well as a team of enthusiastic and passionate young people. This coupled with the fact that the managing director is a local person, with an outstanding University education and a keen sensitivity to the social disposition of the people, Hope Legacies is confident that it will succeed in industrialising the uMsinga area through farming. 

The grand plan

Hope Legacies will collect the individual beds of the small farmers and turn them into one huge farm hereby transforming the farming culture of the area from single farmer subsistence farming, to a team of farmers joined as one under our company to become one huge commercial entity. 

The Msinga area has been known for many bad things such as tribal wars, faction fights, taxi wars and as the second poorest if not the poorest area in South Africa. It is also the area with the most HIV/AIDS infected people per square meter in the whole world. On top of that, the area has had to deal with fatal viral epidemics such as multi-drug resistant TB which claimed a large number of young people in the area. These sorts of statistics certainly do not inspire investor confidence, but a different way of looking at these statistics, is that by investing in this area, through our company, there is guaranteed success because of our above mentioned strengths. The success in industrialising the Msinga region will give hope to all the other rural areas of South Africa which Hope Legacies hopes to target once we complete the Msinga area. Once we succeed in our pilot area, we will be guaranteed success in the other rural areas of South Africa by implementing the same idea of industrialisation but tweaking the idea to personalise the project to suit the rural area in questions culture, social disposition and values. 

Our produce

Our team has elected to launch the project with planting vegetables that we already know grow well in the area such as but not limited to corn, potatoes and tomatoes. Our niche is that we will plant a variety of these vegetables for example in the form of baby vegetables.

The ultimate end goal

It is evident from the above that our initial target group is small and only focusing on the Msinga area, but when the Msinga area rural industrialisation project works, the produce we harvest will be enough to supply the whole Msinga area and indeed eventually the whole province, hereby making a bigger economic impact, which will ultimately have a ripple effect to the economy of the country. Hope Legacies seeks to identify and enhance the strengths of the Msinga area’s farming methods and exploit that to the people’s advantage. 

The success of this project in Msinga will mean that rural areas will be able to be self-sustaining, economically stable and be able to secure better education.

The benefits of the project

More job opportunities, education and industrialisation of rural areas will mean that less people will feel the need to move to urban areas for work, as they will have plenty of work in their joined farm project. The farming project will give everyone a sense of collective ownership and pride which we hope translates to collective responsibility. This assumption is premised on the customary law system which the Msinga area lives by. The idea is essentially that collective ownership and responsibility is the way of our forefathers and is a way for us as a community to succeed together. This kind of project is not tried and tested in farming but it is tried and tested in other ways such as the concept of stokvel and African artists coming together to exchange ideas and to sell their designs. Stokvel and art projects have enjoyed a huge degree of success and have been expanded to other rural areas and urban areas due to their success. The idea of stokvel is that people create a group which contributes a certain amount of money every month into the collective purse for an agreed upon period, after which they split the proceeds equally between all the group members in the form of either food packages, meat parcels or even money. By uniting people under a common cause and encouraging them to work together in the achievement of a single goal, you automatically encourage them to put away any small differences they might have between each other and to work for a bigger purpose which is for the betterment of their and their children's future.

A little about our amazing team

The people who are involved in the project are young people of all races, nationalities (South Africans, German, Dutch, Belgian) and backgrounds. But more importantly they are young, energetic, creative and passionate individuals who wish to assist in the ushering in of the new era of economic empowerment for all South Africans, the primary focus being on rural areas.

A little about the managing director

As stated above I (Nokulunga aka Lungie), founder and managing director of Spes legacies (also known as  Hope Legacies was born and raised in Tugela Ferry. I was orphaned at the age of 2 and my mother was sent to prison. I was taken in by my aunt, a domestic worker and a local doctor whom I came to know as my father. She fostered me and put me through school with the help of the doctor and when I finished school I went to the University of Cape Town where I went on to complete two degrees. The first degree is a social sciences degree, majoring in sociology, politics and social anthropology and the second was a Bachelor of law degree (LLB). I'm currently enrolled in a Masters in Public Law degree at the University of Cape Town.  I have just finished my University undergraduate education in 2015, through the help of University of Cape Town bursaries and government funding and I have now started on my Masters degree.

Our weaknesses and how we addressing them

It goes without saying that we do not all have practical experience of farming and industrialisation. I have an excellent theoretical knowledge of industrialisation and the law as well as how to run a business, as I have been successfully running a small property development business while I was studying, in order to help me fund my studies. To compensate for the lack of experience in the area of farming, I have surrounded myself with individuals who have invaluable proven experience in the area of farming as well as people who share a common vision and goal with me for poverty alleviation and economic empowerment. In a world where it is undeniable that as a black person I am a victim of extreme inequality and of our current society, I recognise my victimhood, but I also recognise that I am an empowered victim, because not only did I survive the bad hand dealt to me by life and society but I learnt a lot from my experiences and I have thrived in the midst of many pitfalls. I have experienced the hardships of life but through optimism, endless tears and finally hope, I emerged a stronger individual. Knowing the difficulties I faced and the inequality I have suffered, I refuse to be pitied by others as a victim because this disempowers me. Instead I use my acknowledgement of victimhood as an empowering tool, and with that in mind I plot my own way, carve my own destiny, knowing however difficult life was or  is right now, I have all I could ever want in order to be successful; optimism, faith in our people and country, hope for a better future for all of us and most of all I have confidence in myself, my team and in this project and the positive impact that it will make in our target area and eventually nationally.

I am working with ten incredible young individuals (Thembelihle Mntungwa, Sfundo Jali, Benedict Strohhaecker, Brooks Hugbo, Jacobus Coetzee, David Keyser, Celine Merle, Christine Moody,  Abhijit Kumar Nath and Lotte van Heesewijk). Their education and skills range from land negotiation, space engineering, farming abroad and locally, marketing and sales to farming degrees, accounting degrees, chartered accountants, arts degrees, business management and economics and legal knowledge. We are also blessed to have two amazing mentors and project advisors (Mr Mabaso, a local born businessman and a person who knows the culture and the people,and a seasoned farmer and rural development enthusiast; Mr Errol Keyser) who together have over 50 years of experience in farming, entrepreneurship and business management. Their knowledge and their experience is invaluable in this entire process and indeed in the successful implementation and execution of the project.

So in conclusion, please help us to raise as much as possible, not only in money, but other resources too, such as farming equipment, human resource capital in the form of ideas from experienced individuals in relevant areas of our project (irrigation specialists, farmers, marketers, sales people, investors, buyers of vegetables produce, volunteers, market researchers, industrial engineers, builders etc) who want to help out. So spread the word, excite as many people as possible about our project and make some noise, lets bring industrialisation through farming home so the unification of small farmers can make a bigger economic impact for the advancement of all.
story_txt: What do we need funding forWe are currently applying for a grant from the South African government under the  Land Redistribution for Agricultural Development (LRAD) programme. In this LRAD programme the government undertakes to support initiatives aimed at developing previously disadvantaged rural areas to help them access land specifically for agricultural purposes, or to make better use of land already accessed. But one of the criteria that need to be satisfied in order to qualify for the grant, is that you must be in a position to make your own contribution (monetary or otherwise) before they can give you the 60%  or more of the rest of the required funding for the project.  We have already accessed land from a few local people who are currently farming the land and they have pledged land to us which straddles the Tugela river and amounts to 10 hectares and more. We have also secured 106 hectares from the local King who has expressed great enthusiasm and excitement about the project.  Once we get a valuator to give us a price for how much the land is worth, the amount will be added towards our contribution. So the money we raise with this campaign will be used to fund the start-up of the project but more importantly it will serve as a bridge to a bigger grant from the government once they see that we have also raised our own capital to contribute towards the project. Below you’ll find a little bit of information about our project, the area which we wish to start in as well as a brief introduction into the team behind this initiative.A summary of our projectIndustrialisation has been a key vehicle for success in present day major economies, ranging from the old powers rooted in colonialism (Great Britain) and looking at the new emerging powers (China) and everything in between (America). These economies all had one common thread leading to their success and this was industrialisation. If one considers South Africa, we have more rural, open land than we know what to do with. Indeed most people are moving away from the rural areas and going into urban areas as they are under the impression that their success lies in those areas. This is a sorely misplaced idea and is one which we as South Africa will pay for dearly as townships will increase, resources with which to help the people moving into townships will still be at a minimum and crime will increase as people become desperate.Aim of the projectWe as Spes Legacies wish to create an alternative narrative in rural area development, urbanisation, poverty alleviation, job creation and indeed education in rural areas. Spes legacies will do is to create an environment in the area of uMsinga where the people unite under one cause and one goal; poverty alleviation, job creation and education. We will do this by bringing together all the small farmers into a single entity where they will continue farming their lands but under the supervision of the company which will bring experts in the field of farming. This will help the small holder farmers to maximise the use of their agricultural land. Spes Legacies is set on creating 600 new jobs through this venture, which will create professional jobs in marketing and sales, bookkeeping and farm labourer jobs, tractor drivers, truck drivers and work in a warehouse where there will be washing, packaging and storage of the produce. The success of this business lies in the endorsement of our project by the king and the community. Our end goal is to industrialise uMsinga through farming and to eventually also introduce solar farms so that the local people can get discounted electricity and that the entire area goes green by using solar electricity. The solar power initiative is bound to work because of the layout of the area and the fact that there is sun all year round which can get to 45 degrees celcius. This abundance in solar exposure can be used for the further advancement of the people in Tugela Ferry. But for now we are focusing on agricultural farming.The problems with the current farming systemTugela ferry has a sizeable portion of arable land which lies along the Tugela ferry river bed. This land is owned by numerous individuals who each own on average 5 beds. These beds are farmed and have been farmed for generations. But the problem is that the produce produced by a single farmer using their beds is too small to make an impact on the wider economy and to sustain the farmer and their family in the long run. Another problem is that the produce which grows well on the land is always farmed the same way and the same produce is seen on the markets. There is essentially no system of competition law and there is an inadequate amount of business education for these farmers to be more successful and have a greater impact on the local and provincial economy.Our team’s strengths The founder of the company and project is armed with a working knowledge of the people and the culture. She is flanked by mature savvy local business owners, who are born in the area and have built their success in the area and from working the soil, as well as a team of enthusiastic and passionate young people. This coupled with the fact that the managing director is a local person, with an outstanding University education and a keen sensitivity to the social disposition of the people, Hope Legacies is confident that it will succeed in industrialising the uMsinga area through farming. The grand planHope Legacies will collect the individual beds of the small farmers and turn them into one huge farm hereby transforming the farming culture of the area from single farmer subsistence farming, to a team of farmers joined as one under our company to become one huge commercial entity. The Msinga area has been known for many bad things such as tribal wars, faction fights, taxi wars and as the second poorest if not the poorest area in South Africa. It is also the area with the most HIV/AIDS infected people per square meter in the whole world. On top of that, the area has had to deal with fatal viral epidemics such as multi-drug resistant TB which claimed a large number of young people in the area. These sorts of statistics certainly do not inspire investor confidence, but a different way of looking at these statistics, is that by investing in this area, through our company, there is guaranteed success because of our above mentioned strengths. The success in industrialising the Msinga region will give hope to all the other rural areas of South Africa which Hope Legacies hopes to target once we complete the Msinga area. Once we succeed in our pilot area, we will be guaranteed success in the other rural areas of South Africa by implementing the same idea of industrialisation but tweaking the idea to personalise the project to suit the rural area in questions culture, social disposition and values. Our produceOur team has elected to launch the project with planting vegetables that we already know grow well in the area such as but not limited to corn, potatoes and tomatoes. Our niche is that we will plant a variety of these vegetables for example in the form of baby vegetables.The ultimate end goalIt is evident from the above that our initial target group is small and only focusing on the Msinga area, but when the Msinga area rural industrialisation project works, the produce we harvest will be enough to supply the whole Msinga area and indeed eventually the whole province, hereby making a bigger economic impact, which will ultimately have a ripple effect to the economy of the country. Hope Legacies seeks to identify and enhance the strengths of the Msinga area’s farming methods and exploit that to the people’s advantage. The success of this project in Msinga will mean that rural areas will be able to be self-sustaining, economically stable and be able to secure better education.The benefits of the projectMore job opportunities, education and industrialisation of rural areas will mean that less people will feel the need to move to urban areas for work, as they will have plenty of work in their joined farm project. The farming project will give everyone a sense of collective ownership and pride which we hope translates to collective responsibility. This assumption is premised on the customary law system which the Msinga area lives by. The idea is essentially that collective ownership and responsibility is the way of our forefathers and is a way for us as a community to succeed together. This kind of project is not tried and tested in farming but it is tried and tested in other ways such as the concept of stokvel and African artists coming together to exchange ideas and to sell their designs. Stokvel and art projects have enjoyed a huge degree of success and have been expanded to other rural areas and urban areas due to their success. The idea of stokvel is that people create a group which contributes a certain amount of money every month into the collective purse for an agreed upon period, after which they split the proceeds equally between all the group members in the form of either food packages, meat parcels or even money. By uniting people under a common cause and encouraging them to work together in the achievement of a single goal, you automatically encourage them to put away any small differences they might have between each other and to work for a bigger purpose which is for the betterment of their and their children's future.A little about our amazing teamThe people who are involved in the project are young people of all races, nationalities (South Africans, German, Dutch, Belgian) and backgrounds. But more importantly they are young, energetic, creative and passionate individuals who wish to assist in the ushering in of the new era of economic empowerment for all South Africans, the primary focus being on rural areas.A little about the managing directorAs stated above I (Nokulunga aka Lungie), founder and managing director of Spes legacies (also known as  Hope Legacies was born and raised in Tugela Ferry. I was orphaned at the age of 2 and my mother was sent to prison. I was taken in by my aunt, a domestic worker and a local doctor whom I came to know as my father. She fostered me and put me through school with the help of the doctor and when I finished school I went to the University of Cape Town where I went on to complete two degrees. The first degree is a social sciences degree, majoring in sociology, politics and social anthropology and the second was a Bachelor of law degree (LLB). I'm currently enrolled in a Masters in Public Law degree at the University of Cape Town.  I have just finished my University undergraduate education in 2015, through the help of University of Cape Town bursaries and government funding and I have now started on my Masters degree.Our weaknesses and how we addressing themIt goes without saying that we do not all have practical experience of farming and industrialisation. I have an excellent theoretical knowledge of industrialisation and the law as well as how to run a business, as I have been successfully running a small property development business while I was studying, in order to help me fund my studies. To compensate for the lack of experience in the area of farming, I have surrounded myself with individuals who have invaluable proven experience in the area of farming as well as people who share a common vision and goal with me for poverty alleviation and economic empowerment. In a world where it is undeniable that as a black person I am a victim of extreme inequality and of our current society, I recognise my victimhood, but I also recognise that I am an empowered victim, because not only did I survive the bad hand dealt to me by life and society but I learnt a lot from my experiences and I have thrived in the midst of many pitfalls. I have experienced the hardships of life but through optimism, endless tears and finally hope, I emerged a stronger individual. Knowing the difficulties I faced and the inequality I have suffered, I refuse to be pitied by others as a victim because this disempowers me. Instead I use my acknowledgement of victimhood as an empowering tool, and with that in mind I plot my own way, carve my own destiny, knowing however difficult life was or  is right now, I have all I could ever want in order to be successful; optimism, faith in our people and country, hope for a better future for all of us and most of all I have confidence in myself, my team and in this project and the positive impact that it will make in our target area and eventually nationally.I am working with ten incredible young individuals (Thembelihle Mntungwa, Sfundo Jali, Benedict Strohhaecker, Brooks Hugbo, Jacobus Coetzee, David Keyser, Celine Merle, Christine Moody,  Abhijit Kumar Nath and Lotte van Heesewijk). Their education and skills range from land negotiation, space engineering, farming abroad and locally, marketing and sales to farming degrees, accounting degrees, chartered accountants, arts degrees, business management and economics and legal knowledge. We are also blessed to have two amazing mentors and project advisors (Mr Mabaso, a local born businessman and a person who knows the culture and the people,and a seasoned farmer and rural development enthusiast; Mr Errol Keyser) who together have over 50 years of experience in farming, entrepreneurship and business management. Their knowledge and their experience is invaluable in this entire process and indeed in the successful implementation and execution of the project.So in conclusion, please help us to raise as much as possible, not only in money, but other resources too, such as farming equipment, human resource capital in the form of ideas from experienced individuals in relevant areas of our project (irrigation specialists, farmers, marketers, sales people, investors, buyers of vegetables produce, volunteers, market researchers, industrial engineers, builders etc) who want to help out. So spread the word, excite as many people as possible about our project and make some noise, lets bring industrialisation through farming home so the unification of small farmers can make a bigger economic impact for the advancement of all.

story:
Short Summary

Sewing and crafting are two of my great passions.  I love creating new things, especially clothing.  For years I have wanted to monetize my talent for sewing and turn it into a source of income, but have been unable to do so.  After conducting some research into new sources for materials such as fabric and tools, as well as practicing some new, more efficient techniques, I've determined that it would be feasible for me to finally take a crack at my dream of selling my crafts for a living.

Let me be clear, this isn't intended as a hobby business or anything like that. My goal is to use my skills to generate enough income so that I can afford my own groceries, medications, clothes, rent, and other living expenses.  My goal is for this business to be my livelihood.

The problem now is start-up capital.  So I thought hey, why not reach out to my amazingly supportive friends and family members and the world at large and see if they would be interested in some cool stuff in exchange for helping me start this business.

What I Need & What You Get

I need start-up capital to acquire materials, tools, and other resources that are necessary to create the products that my business will sell.  I'm doing absolutely everything I can think of to keep the goal for this campaign from getting TOO high, including raiding my personal fabric supply, thrifting, and offering up parts of my personal stash to other craftspeople for materials trades.  But I still need help.

And I want to make sure that I adequately thank those who are able to help.  The backer rewards for this campaign include everything from stickers featuring the logo artwork by amazing artist Celiedh Chance, handmade skirts, beaded necklaces, and tie dye bandanas using up to two colors of your choosing created by yours truly, and even hand-crochet platyfly plushies created in collusion with local crochet goddess Anjala Dick.

A Rough Breakdown of the Costs

Here is a breakdown of as many things that I could think of that I would need to get this business started.  It's everything from materials for making my stock to getting my sewing machines serviced to storage for both my supplies and my finished pieces.  I've put a lot of effort into digging through the internet to find the best deals that I could on the items I picked out.  Here's what your contribution to this campaign would enable me to acquire and accomplish:

  • $343.12 (plus shipping fees) – Fabrics and other materials for a base stock of almost 60 items
  • $235.82 (plus shipping fees) – Packaging materials to present a professional, polished impression to my customers
  • $220.69 (plus shipping fees) – Tools and servicing for my sewing machines
  • $182.95 – A photo table to take photos of my smaller stock items, such as jewelry
  • $200.00 – The adorable logo artwork created by artist Celiedh Chance
  • $95.97 (plus shipping fees) – Storage for completed stock
  • $413.30 (plus shipping fees) – Storage for fabric, tools, and other items associated with this business

Additional funds raised by this campaign that are not listed here will go to things like paying a photographer so that I can have quality product photos of my larger stock items and the backer reward creation and shipping.

Stretch Goals

$2,800.00

If I can raise an extra $300.00, I can purchase a new serger.  My current serger is good for basic work, but I would like to have a more advanced machine to enable me to use more advanced techniques.  My current serger also came to me second-hand and underwent heavy use prior to coming into my possession.  Thus, if I'm able to purchase a more modern, more advanced serger, that would be very useful to my business endeavors.

If I reach my stretch goal, backers of ALL levels will receive a handmade drawstring pouch—some color customization is possible, and they make GREAT dice bags—with a miniature platypus pewter figurine lovingly tucked inside.

Your Impact

Your contribution to this campaign gives me a shot at financial independence.  Income is something that all of us need in order to buy groceries, pay for medications, purchase clothing and shoes, and fulfill other less basic needs like going to the movies or buying birthday gifts for our loved ones.  To be candid, there are a lot of factors that make it difficult for me to pursue non-entrepreneurial employment, not the least of which is a diagnosed anxiety disorder.  Opening my own Etsy store will enable me to earn a living while working in an environment that is less wearing on that anxiety disorder.  But I can't do it without you.

Here's How It Works

In case you haven't crowdfunded anything before, or in case you're not familiar with Indiegogo, here's how this works:

  • Peruse the reward levels to the right and choose the one that best suits you
  • Click the "Back It" button at the top of the page
  • You can either use PayPal or your own credit card to back my campaign—the benefit of using your credit card is that a smaller fee is incurred than if you use PayPal, but if you're not comfortable entering your credit card info online, then go for PayPal!

IMPORTANT

Please give me a reliable way to get in contact with you so that I can get your input on material choices if necessary and so that I can get your goodies to you! I have no way to get your backer rewards to you if I have no way to contact you.

  • The campaign will either be fully funded, or it will be partially funded.  Either way, I'll still receive some funds to start my business.  Still, I am REALLY hoping that this campaign will be fully funded, otherwise I'll have to figure out how to juggle some things unless and until the business makes enough money for me to afford the things that I wasn't able to acquire through this campaign.
  • The funds raised by this campaign are transferred to my personal bank account
  • I use the funds for the aforementioned supplies and services
  • I begin crafting like a madwoman, working on store stock and backer rewards alike
  • I get to launch my Etsy store and you get your swag

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this campaign financially but you still want to help out, there are lots of ways that you can do so!

  • Share the link to this campaign on your social media outlet or outlets of choice
  • Like the Platyfly Studios Facebook page - facebook.com/platyflystudios
  • Follow Platyfly Studios on Instagram - instagram.com/platyflystudios
  • Follow Platyfly Studios on Twitter - twitter.com/PlatyflyStudios
  • Love the Platyfly Studios store on Etsy once it gets up and running

Thanks for taking the time to look at my campaign! I'm really excited about this venture and I hope that if you're reading, you're able to help out in one way or another.  With your help, Platyfly Studios has a chance at becoming something really meaningful for me—that being my livelihood.

We now return you to your regularly scheduled internetting.  The rest of this is "fine print" regarding some of the backer reward options.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Regarding Bandana Color Choices

Right, well, the dye kit I'm looking at doesn't have the colors listed online, and Google is being no help.  However, you can probably safely count on at least black, and the standard rainbow—red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple, and violet.  I'll send out a message to the recipients of this reward item once I have the kit in hand to let everyone know the full spectrum of the available colors and folks can let me know which two they want.

Regarding Necklace Material Choices

The following options are available for the semiprecious gemstone component of your custom necklace.  Please choose ONE of the following:

  • Rounds – Give pieces a smoother and more uniform look
    • Garnet
    • Rose Quartz
    • Onyx
    • Green Freshwater Pearls
    • Ivory Freshwater Pearls
    • Amethyst
    • Rainbow Moonstone
    • Iolite
  • Chips – Give pieces a rougher and more randomized look
    • Garnet
    • Peridot
    • Emerald
    • Blue Topaz
    • Amethyst
    • Iolite
    • Rose Quartz
    • Hematite
    • Citrine
    • Labradorite
    • Rainbow Moonstone
    • Blue Goldstone
    • Red Goldstone
    • Red Tiger Eye
    • Malachite
  • Flat Ovals
    • Pyrite

Regarding Skater Skirt Material Choices

There are three different material choices for the Skater Skirts.  They are listed below with their available colors.  Please choose ONE fabric type and indicate which color you want.

Iridescent Crush

  • White
  • Ivory

Regarding Pixie Skirt Material Choices

Pixie Skirts are three-layered skirts.  I like to mix and match colors and textures when I make them, so when choosing the colors for yours, feel free to play around and see what you like! Please choose ONE color from each of the following types of fabric:

Iridescent Crush

Any of the colors listed above.  Please visit http://www.firesongproductions.com/platyfly/iridescentCrush.png for full color reference.

Regarding Corset Material Choices

Corsets are available in a strapless overbust style and a stappy underbust style.  All of my corsets are made with STEEL boning, so they are suitable for tightlacing.  If you're interested in this reward but are afraid I won't be able to fit you because you have an unusual body type, allow me to set your mind at ease--I have experience making corsets for those with unusual body types! Regardless, if you have any questions, feel free to contact me.

Please choose ONE color from each of the following types of fabric:

Taffeta

IMPORTANT
Please give me a reliable way to get in contact with you so that I can get your input on material choices if necessary and so that I can get your goodies to you! I have no way to get your backer rewards to you if I have no way to contact you.

The campaign will either be fully funded, or it will be partially funded.  Either way, I'll still receive some funds to start my business.  Still, I am REALLY hoping that this campaign will be fully funded, otherwise I'll have to figure out how to juggle some things unless and until the business makes enough money for me to afford the things that I wasn't able to acquire through this campaign.
The funds raised by this campaign are transferred to my personal bank account
I use the funds for the aforementioned supplies and services
I begin crafting like a madwoman, working on store stock and backer rewards alike

I get to launch my Etsy store and you get your swag

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute to this campaign financially but you still want to help out, there are lots of ways that you can do so!

Share the link to this campaign on your social media outlet or outlets of choice
Like the Platyfly Studios Facebook page - facebook.com/platyflystudios

Follow Platyfly Studios on Instagram - instagram.com/platyflystudios

Follow Platyfly Studios on Twitter - twitter.com/PlatyflyStudios

Love the Platyfly Studios store on Etsy once it gets up and running

Thanks for taking the time to look at my campaign! I'm really excited about this venture and I hope that if you're reading, you're able to help out in one way or another.  With your help, Platyfly Studios has a chance at becoming something really meaningful for me—that being my livelihood.
We now return you to your regularly scheduled internetting.  The rest of this is "fine print" regarding some of the backer reward options.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Regarding Bandana Color Choices
Right, well, the dye kit I'm looking at doesn't have the colors listed online, and Google is being no help.  However, you can probably safely count on at least black, and the standard rainbow—red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple, and violet.  I'll send out a message to the recipients of this reward item once I have the kit in hand to let everyone know the full spectrum of the available colors and folks can let me know which two they want.
Regarding Necklace Material Choices

story:
Reviews

Enroute Car Wash paid it forward!! What a beautiful thing to do. I came out of the store and my car was clean!! Thanks again. Kimberly B. Facebook.

So my car hasn't been washed in about 2 months and it's showed ! Enroute Car Wash  took my car and actually did a way better job than the normal car wash I go to .Stephany T. Google

  If you are to lazy to drive to a car wash, I strongly recommend this service. Mark A Yelp

The car looked great, like new, and i didn't expect to last, but almost 1 month later, it was STILL amazing, during the summer heat and rain. I am a believer and a repeat customer. Jeff P. Yelp

Thank you Enroute Car Wash! I wish more businesses gave such great service! I will definitely use Enroute services again.​ Gardner R. Google

The Enroute Car Wash Difference

We use just a single cup of water along with an Eco-friendly specialized solution to give your car a nearly waterless wash that you will have to see to believe. Best of all, we are a completely mobile car wash service, and our prices are as competitive as it gets.

The Next Stage

Our goal is to raise $25,000 to help us market our services to 10,000 customers. We need to lease 10 smart cars and expand inventory.That is why we are asking for your help. However, whether you can financially help or not, please, share our campaign with your circle of influence. The more people aware of our campaign, the closer we will get to our goal.

Thank you and we look forward to changing the world, one car at a time!

Thank you and we look forward to changing the world, one car at a time!

story:
PROJECT COMMUNITY LEADERSHIP TRAINING
Help us to train Community Leaders to train others

Leaders will train people how to create their own business using minimal cost methods.

THE PROBLEM

The problem is simple - Funding and Training are the most needed resources to help a local community create jobs and change the future for this generation and the generations to come. The local communities have the leaders who are willing to dedicate their lives to helping their community but they do not have the resources in the form of funding and training to deliver the much needed solutions.

THE SOLUTION

We want to offer 10 fully funded Location Independent Micro Enterprise (L.I.M.E.) training scholarships to local leaders committed to empowering their communities. We will teach leaders how to create an e-commerce product site that is designed to produce a minimum yearly income of $30,000.

We will help the leaders pass this knowledge on to their students to enable them to be self-sufficient and not reliant on benefits and other funding sources. The Scholarship will include all the resources required to develop the e-commerce site plus the necessary training and mentoring to make the site successful.

This is where we and you come together to make the change possible because together we can make available the much needed resources.


HOW IT WORKS
We will provide 10 Location Independent Micro Enterprise ( L.I.M.E.) training scholarships which will provide a 10 month intensive training program where the community leader is trained in every aspect of building and running a micro enterprise.

Unlike so many of the micro enterprise models operating today which are subsistence living models the LIME scholarship will use the latest internet technology enabling the local community leader to access opportunities to benefit their local community which normally they would not have access to.
The scholarship will take care of and provide all of the resources needed to deliver the training and the individual micro enterprise development including:


• Business research
• Marketing research
• Product development
• Website Development
• Marketing and sales
• Complete self-paced learning platform
• Mentorship.


Each of the community leaders will be required to mentor others to empower them to transform their own personal situation. The people being mentored will have the same heart attitude to help and assist others to develop a better community 

Nothing brings a higher sense of self-worth than being a fully productive and employed member of a team that has the goal to empower all around them to a better life. A Location Independent Micro Enterprise (L.I.M.E.) training scholarship will link communities and help bring sustainable job creation and commerce opportunities to areas with a long history of poverty and unemployment.

When families gain this new, sustainable income, it brings new opportunities for development within the local community; building value and a new sense of pride whilst reaching out to their local communities.


Passing on the Gift
The core of our model is Passing on the Gift. This means that the trained local community leaders share the training and knowledge they receive, and pass on this training through mentoring to others in their local community. This extends the impact of the original gift, allowing a local community to duplicate many times over what we have provided for the local community leader being trained. Each of those being trained and mentored will become donors and full participants in improving their communities.


The goal of this project is to help the local community leaders achieve self-reliance. We do this by providing them the tools they need to sustain themselves, and it's thanks to the generosity of donors like you.

 


HOW YOU CAN GET INVOLVED
We have taken some of the first steps to getting the Location Independent Micro Enterprise ( L.I.M.E.) training scholarship started, but we need your support to take the next ones. We plan to open local community leader applications in January 2017 and will enroll our first scholarship students in February 2017. This campaign will raise the funds we need to prepare for those students to arrive we need your help to launch.


WHAT WILL THE FUNDS BE USED FOR?
Our goal of $30,000 will enable us to provide 10 fully funded Location Independent Micro Enterprise ( L.I.M.E.) training scholarships. It will enable for the complete and finished development of the learning platform and systems which means that we will be able to provide scholarships for future community leaders as all of the systems will be built now.

WHAT YOU WILL GET FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION
When you contribute to the Location Independent Micro Enterprise (L.I.M.E.)  training scholarship you will become part of the transformation of 10 local community leaders and their communities. Put in simple terms you will become a HERO to these local community leaders ! And you can also select some perks that will help you tell others about what we are doing so they can join us too.

HOW CAN YOU CONTRIBUTE

We’ve put together an exciting set of perks around our mission and LIME Scholarships.

$5 Thanks for Helping Us Launch
Thanks for supporting the LIME Scholarship for local community leaders! Your gift helps us create a different kind of Micro Enterprise training. We will put your name on our website supporters wall.

$10: SUPPORTER Package

Show your support of the LIME Scholarships and get the following:

Website Credit - your name will be added to http://thelimeproject.com to demonstrate your support for the LIME Scholarships.

Digital Certificate - we will send you a digital certificate that you can use to show your support for the campaign.

$20: Supporter Photography Package

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

Website Credit

Digital Certificate

In addition to this as a huge thank you get all of the above perks PLUS your choice of 1 of 50 professional photography photos (generously donated by the photographers) which normally sell @ $150 each. Sent to you digitally to enable you to have them printed and framed or just kept as a thank you reminder.

Just 1 of the 50 Professional Photographs available as your thank you perk, go to our Facebook Page and check out the albums under photos https://www.facebook.com/The-Lime-Project-691773787644441/

 

$30: Supporter Upgrade Photography Package

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

Website Credit

Digital Certificate

1 of 50 Photos (valued at $150)

In addition to this as a huge thank you get your choice of an additional 3 of 50 professional photography photos (generously donated by the photographers) which normally sell @ $150 each. Sent to you digitally to enable you to have them printed and framed or just kept as a thank you reminder.

$50: Supporter Ultimate Photography Package

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

Website Credit

Digital Certificate

1 of 50 Photos (valued at $150)

3 of 50 Photos (valued at $450)

In addition to this as a huge thank you get your choice of an additional 5 of 50 professional photography photos (generously donated by the photographers) which normally sell @ $150 each. Sent to you digitally to enable you to have them printed and framed or just kept as a thank you reminder.

$100: FUTURIST EARLY ACCESS Package

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

Website Credit

1 of 50 Photos (valued at $150)

5 of 50 Photos (valued at $750)

 

As a huge thank you get all of the above perks PLUS a Designer limited edition T-shirt that reads “Fame lasts but a moment but class lasts forever" (shipping extra)

Example Of Personalized Shirt

$150: INNOVATOR Package

story:
A Passion For Community and Craft Beer

After nearly five years of careful research and planning, we have secured the perfect building in scenic downtown Cannon Falls, MN, purchased all of our brewing equipment, and are getting ready to fulfill our dream of opening a community gathering place where people can enjoy locally made craft beer.  We believe that beer used to be at the center of community, bringing people together to laugh, love, share conversation, and maybe even solve a problem or two, and we want to be a part of that process.  We want to share both our passion and our beer with you!

 

We brew fresh, handcrafted, artisanal beers made with locally sourced ingredients whenever possible.  We take the idea of craft beer so seriously at Tilion Brewing Company, that our name is taken from the Icelandic word “Til iðn” (pronounced Til-lee-thon), which literally translates into “To Craft".  We celebrate those who share a passion for making things with their own hands.  We will support the local maker community by hosting events and inviting local artisans and craftsmen (artists, sculptors, cheese makers, etc) to our brewery to share their passions as well.

 

While we are not a military themed brewery, we feel strongly that the men and women who have served our country matter!  We come from military families who have had grandfathers, fathers, brothers, and sister-in-laws who have served during war, including one of Tilion’s own co-founders, Sgt. Scott Larson, who served in Afghanistan.  To honor our veterans, we will be donating a portion of sales from our "Roger, Roger" pale ale (named after one of our fathers who served in Vietnam) to the families of Minnesota veterans that have served overseas.

 

 

Why Crowdfunding?

As you can probably tell, building community is very important to us and we would like to invite you to join our founding family.  Select a perk (or three) and be with us from day one, possibly getting your name on the "Founder's Wall" in our taproom.

 

Our goal of $30,000 will allow us to put the finishing touches on an amazing taproom.  These funds will be used to build our bar and furnish the taproom with tables, chairs, stools, and fixtures.  Opening Cannon Falls' first brewery and taproom is no small feat, but we will make it happen with your help!

 

Please consider contributing to our campaign.  No contribution is too small.  Every ounce counts and gets us that much closer to filling your glasses with delicious beer!

 

 

Tilion Perks

*All of the perk details are listed to the right. >>>>>>>>

Founder Hoodie:

 

Founder T-Shirts:

 

 

Tilion Pint Glass:

 

Tilion Hat:

 

 

Name a Fermenter:

 

Also, every perk comes with our undying gratitude (and that's something that money can't buy)!

 

If you would like to make a monetary donation without receiving a perk, please click on the "BACK IT" button near the top of this page.  Besides our gratitude, you will also earn a heartfelt "Thanks a Tilion!" from the three of us.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We get that not everybody can contribute for any number of reasons,  but there are other ways that you can help us out.  Please SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN (email, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram) with your friends and family.  This is easy to do with the tools at the top of this page.

 

Cheers!

 

 

And Thanks a Tilion!

 

Scott, Chris, and Ryan
story_txt:
A Passion For Community and Craft Beer
After nearly five years of careful research and planning, we have secured the perfect building in scenic downtown Cannon Falls, MN, purchased all of our brewing equipment, and are getting ready to fulfill our dream of opening a community gathering place where people can enjoy locally made craft beer.  We believe that beer used to be at the center of community, bringing people together to laugh, love, share conversation, and maybe even solve a problem or two, and we want to be a part of that process.  We want to share both our passion and our beer with you!
 
We brew fresh, handcrafted, artisanal beers made with locally sourced ingredients whenever possible.  We take the idea of craft beer so seriously at Tilion Brewing Company, that our name is taken from the Icelandic word “Til iðn” (pronounced Til-lee-thon), which literally translates into “To Craft".  We celebrate those who share a passion for making things with their own hands.  We will support the local maker community by hosting events and inviting local artisans and craftsmen (artists, sculptors, cheese makers, etc) to our brewery to share their passions as well.
 
While we are not a military themed brewery, we feel strongly that the men and women who have served our country matter!  We come from military families who have had grandfathers, fathers, brothers, and sister-in-laws who have served during war, including one of Tilion’s own co-founders, Sgt. Scott Larson, who served in Afghanistan.  To honor our veterans, we will be donating a portion of sales from our "Roger, Roger" pale ale (named after one of our fathers who served in Vietnam) to the families of Minnesota veterans that have served overseas.
 

 
Why Crowdfunding?
As you can probably tell, building community is very important to us and we would like to invite you to join our founding family.  Select a perk (or three) and be with us from day one, possibly getting your name on the "Founder's Wall" in our taproom.
 
Our goal of $30,000 will allow us to put the finishing touches on an amazing taproom.  These funds will be used to build our bar and furnish the taproom with tables, chairs, stools, and fixtures.  Opening Cannon Falls' first brewery and taproom is no small feat, but we will make it happen with your help!
 
Please consider contributing to our campaign.  No contribution is too small.  Every ounce counts and gets us that much closer to filling your glasses with delicious beer!
 

 
Tilion Perks
*All of the perk details are listed to the right. >>>>>>>>
Founder Hoodie:



 
Founder T-Shirts:

 

 
Tilion Pint Glass:

 
Tilion Hat:
 

 
Name a Fermenter:

 
Also, every perk comes with our undying gratitude (and that's something that money can't buy)!
 
If you would like to make a monetary donation without receiving a perk, please click on the "BACK IT" button near the top of this page.  Besides our gratitude, you will also earn a heartfelt "Thanks a Tilion!" from the three of us.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
We get that not everybody can contribute for any number of reasons,  but there are other ways that you can help us out.  Please SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN (email, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram) with your friends and family.  This is easy to do with the tools at the top of this page.
 
Cheers!
 

 
And Thanks a Tilion!
 
Scott, Chris, and Ryan

story:
Rose City Yoga is more than just your neighborhood yoga studio, we believe that your practice has purpose.  Imagine a studio space that gives back to the local community.  A space where you can practice mindfulness, foster creative energy and connect with your tribe.  Our studio memberships and packages help us to expand our community outreach -- so when you practice with RCY, you are giving back to local non-profits and organizations in Pasadena.  Not only will your practice benefit you, it will reach beyond your mat.  

Rose City Yoga started as an idea to cultivate community in Pasadena through the practice of yoga.  In 2014 -- Kimi, being the big-hearted yogi that she is, wanted to share her love of yoga with...well, everyone!  So she hit up Mel to join her on this journey of spreading yogic love (because let's be real, Kimi and Mel are a package deal) -- and RCY was born.  We then began a collaboration with several non-profits and organizations in Pasadena that were dear to our hearts (check out Club 21 and The Foundation for Living Beauty, they are pretty amazing) -- providing free yoga classes to their members and staff.  We also hosted a summer solstice festival to raise some funds for our friends at The Foundation for Living Beauty.  And we started teaching weekly donation classes at a local church.  But our vision has grown, and in order to expand our community outreach,  we need a studio space.  

By creating a public studio with a full schedule of inspiring and awesome yoga classes, we will have the financial foundation to expand our community outreach and work with more organizations to design yoga programs and events tailored to their needs.  So, we've got to create a studio worthy of tribe!  Our goal is to raise $30,000.  What for, you ask?  We will need to build out the studio space and make it yoga worthy -- wood floors, paint, fixtures, wood cubbies to store the yoga props (blocks, straps, bolsters) that we also need to purchase, install a filtered water system, custom reception desk for our furry front desk staff (see video) and of course hire teachers and staff that will inspire and motivate you to enlightenment ;)

Every dollar raised is more than just a dollar.  It's an investment in your community and a belief in us!  And you are get sumthin' for your investment!  We are pre-selling "Practice With Purpose" Packages. You can pre-purchase a single class, a month unlimited, 3 months or 6 months of classes, or if you're a super yogi and ready to asana, a full year membership.  And!  By pre-purchasing, you will be guaranteed the Founding Tribe Member Rate at our studio once we open our doors -- plus other awesome perks like workshops, discounts on retail and membership only deals. 

Thank you so much for stopping by! We are grateful for your support! 

Namaste,

Kimi & Mel 

 

*please note:  all perks are our way of extending gratitude for your donation. We are so grateful for your generosity, but donations should not be considered as a  legal sales transaction for the exchange of goods and services. We thank you in advance for your support!

story:
Hello, I'm Elly! You know me as @Eilis, the founder and main barista of Let's Grab Coffee on Imzy! I'm a creative writer and a barista who has always dreamed of travel writing. Whenever I travel, I always feel creatively refreshed: I gain so many new perspectives and ideas, I have new things to share with others, and I have so many interesting new stories! I love adventure, exploration, meeting new people, and trying new things. I hope to travel as many places as I can, and then bring the joy and adventure back to Let's Grab Coffee and Moonbeam Cafe.


By contributing to this fundraiser, you will help to support this dream, and an awesome adventure! And more concretely, you will be helping to provide Let's Grab Coffee, and other communities that I lead, with a wealth of original, fresh, fun, exciting new content: including podcasts, interviews, photographs, stories, and more. This campaign's fundraising is flexible, so even if it doesn't meet the entire goal, I will still be able to do some traveling!

 

Below, I'll outline the trips that I've come up with. Remember, they don't all need to be achieved. Even a couple trips will still provide great content and lots of fun! At the top of the list are smaller, regional trips, which will be easier to achieve on a tighter budget. At the end of the list, I outline harder to reach trips that would be ideal to take if the entire goal is met.

 

Lower budget trip possibilities:

 

The Windy City!- A road trip to Chicago. It'd be wonderful to explore Navy Pier, the Bean, and take a tour of the city. I could also sample some great Chicago coffee shops, meet any Imzynauts in the area, and perhaps check out a theater show! With a friend in the area I can stay with, the cost for this trip is fairly low. Estimated cost: $200. 


New Year's in New York City! - Earlier in the year, some Imzynauts and I discussed how it'd be wonderful to share the New Year celebration together. It'd be even more awesome if I could report on the ball drop and celebration live from Times Square, NYC! I would also love to meet Imzynauts in the NYC area, see some iconic sights, and try some tasty coffee shops! With a family member in the area to stay with, I can keep the cost for this trip fairly low. Estimated cost: $300.


Cape May, New Jersey, in the winter! - In the off season, this Victorian Beach Resort is starkly beautiful. There is snow on the beach, and you can stand alone and watch the vast ocean. I love being on the beach in the winter! Cape May is a gorgeous town with tons of history. I've been here before, but I'd love to go back specifically for creating Imzy content! Each old Victorian mansion has its own quirky story. There are even some haunted houses! Being near the ocean always puts me in the mood for poetry, so I'm looking forward to some perfect creative writing time and some lovely poems to share with my communities when I return! I'll have to get an Air B and B for this trip, but in the off season, they can be relatively inexpensive. Estimated cost: $500.


Disney World for Thanksgiving- I'm already going to Disney World, Florida, in November! My park ticket and hotel have already been covered for this trip, but I still need to pay for my plane ticket. I would love to create some fun content for Imzy while I'm here! I hope to make some wonderful videos to capture the magic and excitement of Disney. I'm really looking forward to this trip, and all the stories I can bring back. I'd love to share the fun by sending postcards from Disney! Estimated cost: $300.


Houston, Texas - There are a lot of interesting things to see in Houston, and if I go in the fall, I can dress up and attend one of the largest Renaissance Fairs in the country! There are also some wonderful restaurants, coffee shops, bars, and museums. I'm sure there are some Imzynauts to meet here, too! With a family member in the area, I won't have to pay for a hotel. Estimated cost: $350.


Medium budget trip possibilities:


Road trip to New Orleans! - I've always wanted to see this city. I could road trip to New Orleans, perhaps sometime in the spring, to check out its amazing food, coffee, architecture, history, and more! This trip could be perfect for Moonbeam Cafe! New Orleans seems like such a fun and interesting place. Estimated cost: $500

 

Higher budget trip possibilities, if entire goal is met:

 

Imzy Headquarters! - I will travel to Salt Lake City, Utah, to tour Imzy Headquarters and meet all the awesome people who make Imzy possible! We can do live interviews, an office tour, live-stream a very silly game, and hear more about how Imzy came to be and how it has evolved. Outside of Imzy, I would explore local coffee shops and roasters for Let's Grab Coffee, and local breweries for Moonbeam Cafe! We've also heard that there are dinosaur bones in Utah! A fun activity for this trip could be checking out a dinosaur museum or other dinosaur attractions! (We call this section of the trip "The Hunt for the Original Imzysaurus".) Estimated cost: $1,000

 

The Ultimate Podcast Meetup! - I will fly to meet Lizzie in Canada, and spend quality time recording our BaristaBitches Podcast in real life. I have never been out of the United States, so it will also be fun to check out this part of Canada and share some hilarious adventures. The most exciting part, however, will be the ability to have great conversations with Lizzie in the real world, come up with awesome new podcast content, and record podcast conversations, adventures, and more together! We also plan to record some of our adventures on video, for even more fun (and probably absurd) Let's Grab Coffee, Moonbeam Cafe and BaristaBitches content! I'm super thrilled about this trip. I believe it will speed the BaristaBitches Podcast on its way to becoming even more entertaining and creative! Estimated cost: $1,500

 

Coffee Paradise! I will visit Portland, Oregon - the coffee capitol of the USA! I know there are some Imzynauts in this area. I'll spend time grabbing coffee in the real world. But mostly, this trip will be a caffeinated extravaganza. I'll explore as many coffeehouses as possible, taking photos, doing interviews, trying roasts, and gathering all sorts of good stories to share with Let's Grab Coffee on Imzy! Estimated cost: $1,000.

 

Bonus Equipment Upgrade: Better Podcast Microphones! Lizzie and I have had some difficulties in recording the podcast on unprofessional microphones. If we exceed our fundraising goal, we would love to be able to invest in a good microphone for both of us, in order to increase the quality of our podcast. We've been so thrilled that you have enjoyed the podcast so far, and we'd love to make it even better! We've researched microphones extensively and have found the Yeti to be an ideal candidate! Total cost: $300

 

Funds donated to this campaign will be used to pay for airfare, gas fare, any lodging needed, and food needed during the trips, as outlined above. If we exceed our goal, we will plan more fun content, and maybe even an additional trip!

 

As mentioned previously, this campaign has a flexible fundraising goal - this means that I can still go on the Have Coffee, Will Travel adventure if we don't reach the entirety of the $5,000: it will just be less destinations overall, but still a ton of fun!

 

Be sure to check out our unique perks, created just for this fundraising campaign. They range from shout-outs, to being featured on the podcast, to artwork, postcards, stickers, t-shirts, and more! We're really excited to be able to send awesome, fun perks to everyone who wants to contribute to our campaign. Just choose the donation level that is right for you, and the perk for that level that looks fun to you!

 

Reaching the goal for the Have Coffee, Will Travel Podcast Adventure would be life-changing for me. Traveling to awesome places and meeting great people, and being able to share adventures with them, is a dream of mine. And bringing that sense of joy and adventure back to the wonderful members of Imzy will make it even more fulfilling and meaningful. I'm so excited to get this project started and see where it can take me.

 

Thank you so very much for being interested in this project. I sincerely hope to one day stop by your hometown and share coffee, laughs, and adventures with you!

story:
Summary

I personally vested in phase I (www.squirrelpitch.com).  The problem is complex but the solution is simple. On average, Veterans are hired 8 months after they separate from the military.  Current systems are unable to translate military skills into civilian skills; therefore, HR processes make it difficult to match skills with requirements. There is a way to avoid the pain of matching Veteran skills and talent—Squirrelpitch.

SQUIRRELPITCH® is a Next-Gen Talent Recruitment Service that Finds, Analyzes and Matches Professionals with Jobs:

➢ Talent Scout

➢ Audition Platform

➢ Qualification Analysis

➢ Global Veteran Job | Career Match

➢ Ambassadors | Mentor Protégé

• There are plenty of talented professionals and satisfying jobs, but it takes way too long to match them—until now! I realized that using the latest matchmaking algorithms, professionals and companies could find each other almost instantly. With the right algorithm, the perfect employee can can be matched instantly, without the tedious search!

• Employers no longer need to spend hours and hours sifting through piles of resumes to find a viable candidate. Candidates no longer need to search hundreds of job sites to find an appealing position. Squirrelpitch will remove the guesswork by only offering matches that meet your criteria.

• Help us change how the business world finds talent!

What We Need & What You Get

• We need to generate $25,000 USD to continue development of an Enterprise API | Mobile APP to deploy squirrelpitch's technology.  While 85% of funding will go towards software development, 15% of funds raised will be used in marketing.

• Phase I Prototype development is complete and can be viewed at www.squirrelpitch.com.  Current feedback has been extremely positive and it is time to move to Phase II development of an Enterprise API / Mobile App.  To date, the Squirrelpitch project has no debt, and we are completely self-funded, but we need your support to advance this project to the next stage of development and bring our incredible product to market.

• We are the only Career and Job matchmaking software that is Veteran-designed and Veteran-built.  We firmly believe that Squirrelpitch will revolutionize the job market and get companies the talent they need. When you back this project, you can take pride in knowing that you are helping deserving Americans find jobs.  

• Review our many perks to decide which is right for you.  The perks offer long term savings for companies and individual donors. These minimal fees will ultimately save you hundreds of man-hours and enormous frustration over job or talent search.

Risks & Challenges

• The competitive risks are low and opt-in potential is extremely high because almost every current organization still uses decades-old search systems and antiquated recruiting practices. 

• Any additional funding received will go directly towards marketing and advertisement costs.  We already have a growing social media presence in the United States.

Other Ways You Can Help

• Any and all contributions are important and immensely appreciated.  If you unable to contribute, please spread the word by sharing our campaign with your friends and family, in person or through social media.

~ Team Squirrelpitch

spread the word by sharing our campaign with your friends and family, in person or through social media.~ Team Squirrelpitch

story:
Thanks for stopping by!

We're so happy you dropped by our fundraising page and wanted to take a moment to share who we are and what we're trying to accomplish. 

We here at EXCEL Therapy & Conditioning are doing our best to bring to the town of Wilbraham and surrounding communities a one stop shop for health and wellness. We've incorporated Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Massage, a collegiate level weight room, one on one and small group/team training, strength and conditioning group exercise classes, and so much more! In our efforts to continue to provide everything you could want under one roof, we're endeavoring to bring Spin Classes to you. 

It's been brought to our attention that there's a real desire to have locally accessible Spin classes with a phenomenal coach. Well, we have the coach, and now we need your help to get the equipment. But don't worry- we're not expecting something for nothing. You're helping us, so let us help you! After all, helping YOU is what EXCEL is all about.

Help Us to Help YOU

Here's the deal folks, Spin bikes are EXPENSIVE, they require some capital that unfortunately this pandemic has all but eliminated for us. So that's where you come in, if we can reach or exceed our goal then we can purchase as many bikes as that will get us, and the best part is- all you've done is pay for your classes in advance! If we don't reach our goal, then we'll purchase whatever we can so we can still bring you quality classes, and we'll build as the popularity for the classes grows. But don't worry! Even as that happens and our popularity climbs, we will simply add in additional class times. We are committed to remaining a boutique style location for you, that means smaller classes allowing for real attention to growth and gains from our coaches. 

You'll see that each Tier of Donating comes with a correlating number of classes and fun EXCEL swag, no matter which tier you choose to donate to, you are guaranteed to get your money's worth. We are committed to helping you achieve your goals, and are always happy to reward your loyalty to us!

The Bigger Picture

The fact of the matter is that people need to release some steam and they're looking for fun and effective ways to improve their mental, emotional, and physical well-being. AND WE'RE ALL ABOUT IT! But we're tired of having to pop around to dozens of different locations to find what we're looking for. Which is why we want to bring it to you under one roof. You guys have asked for Spin classes and told us that you're tired of traveling 30+ minutes away to other bigger box gyms, you want it local and personal, and we want to deliver that to you. By donating today you are not only investing in yourself by purchasing classes to move toward your own personal goals, but you're helping a local business stay afloat in a very scary economic time frame. We want to be there for you, and we are honored to have you be there for us.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know money is tight right now, and even if you want to help us out and invest in yourself- sometimes that's just not possible. We get it, trust us. But there's more you can do. You can share this page, write us a review, follow us on social media, give us a shout out or humble brag if you've benefitted from our services or awesome staff. Get the word out there for us so that more people can recognize what we're all about and come to aid as well. Every little bit helps!
