story:
Overview

We're excited to share information on The Lab Alliance with you, our uniquely designed commitment to economic acceleration for businesses, entrepreneurs, and under served/underrepresented communities powered by Qualified Opportunity Zones. 

We have officially launched our flagship location, The Lab Orlando, in the historic Parramore District of the city with expansion plans for 200 "Lab" locations in opportunity zones throughout the US.

As we were preparing for the opening of The Lab Orlando, we came across something in our research so significant that we adjusted our model to ensure that we could make meaningful and long lasting contributions to the communities we serve, which we'll share later.

 

Our Need & Our Perks

Funding Need: $25,000

The $25,000 raise amount will allow us to accelerate the delivery of key resources, namely:

  • Business and financial education resources to entrepreneurs and businesses, including mentorship in preparation for creating jobs, building ownership, and sound business practices facilitating generational wealth;
  • Operating our "community hub" components for training, education, and resources to improve the socioeconomic status and empower the Parramore community to improve quality of life and control of activity by the community;
  • Creating an environment where sponsors, trustees, and other supporters are empowered to make a meaning difference in the places that it matter most;
  • Helping to create a future entity that empowers members of the community to invest in their future success.

Our perks include:

  1. The "iEmpower" Lab Alliance t-shirts, showing your support for people powered communities that make meaningful change;
  2. Recognition on our "founding supporters" window collage, which faces our heavily trafficked main street;
  3. Our "Under-served Communities Action Plan" challenge coins; 
  4. Recognition at Lab events;
  5. Sponsorship of our media & podcast studio;

In the event we do not reach our goal, we will put the funds we raise to work and continue to move forward.

 

The Impact

(a look at The Lab Orlando from the street. We have over 20 picture windows facing West Church Street in Orlando, between The Amway Arena, Orlando City Soccer, and Camping World Stadium. The Lab is located at 1016 West Church St. Suite B in Orlando, FL.)

The Lab Alliance is a 501c6 membership association designed to empower the economic acceleration of businesses, entrepreneurs, non-profits, vision, and ideas via specially designed Federally Qualified Opportunity Zone ecosystems throughout the United States, by helping people to move their life mission forward with fellowship, opportunity, and community.

Qualified Opportunity Zones were originally created by the US Government in 2017, focused on economically under served communities and designed to assist with economic growth. Investors are incentivized to make investments into qualified opportunity zones with eligibility for preferential tax treatment and tax free capital gains. For entrepreneurs and businesses, the barriers to attracting investment resources are lowered as investors are able to take advantage of the tax benefits of investing in a qualified opportunity zone fund.

(a view of The Lab Orlando, with the media studio entrance in the back left corner)

The Lab Alliance also has a profound and direct impact on businesses, professionals, public servants, and under-represented communities within qualified opportunity zones through its commitment to socioeconomic progress for residents, empowering them to control the destiny and success of their lives, their families, and their communities.

The Lab Orlando is the flagship economic accelerator for The Lab Alliance, with a total of 200 locations planned in qualified opportunity zones throughout the United States.

(a panoramic view of The Inside of The Lab Orlando)

In 2019, Julianna Ormond and RC Williams, entrepreneurial ecosystem builders and  co-founders of LiAison Labs heard the call  for a space where like-minded organizations and individuals could come together to connect, create, problem solve, and help the community as a whole, with their relationships and expertise.  

This location became a reality in March 2020 when space at 1016 W. Church Street in Orlando, FL was secured and The Lab Orlando was born.

As the Lab Alliance team prepared to ramp up operations, the Coronavirus pandemic took center stage. This event created a high level of uncertainty – and was 100% proof that we need each other and that the Lab Alliance is necessary now. 

As we come out of this phase and into our new normal, we asked really tough questions:

How do we find balance as a community?

How do we find balance for our children? 

How can we help with the intense economic and socio-economic challenges that are coming from this?

The Lab Alliance is the answer.

 

A Life Changing Discovery

Our background research on the impact of socioeconomic status on under represented communities told us we needed to do more for the community where the lab is based. We commit time and resources to make space, education, and other resources available to members of the Parramore community to improve socioeconomic status.

 

Our Leadership & Expert Advisors

We've assembled a mix of community leadership, business leadership, and industry experts to assist us in growing the Lab Alliance model.

 

 

Future Plans

Our Under-Served Communities Action Plan ("UCAP") represents an extension of our commitment, designed to accelerate meaningful, multi-generational socioeconomic progress.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Please get the word out! The more people who are aware of the great work we're doing, the more we can do!
  • If you're in the Orlando area, please share the word about the space! We're booking for small group meetings, seminars, masterminds, book clubs, and other events.
  • Please use the Indiegogo sharing tools!

We've assembled a mix of community leadership, business leadership, and industry experts to assist us in growing the Lab Alliance model.

If you're in the Orlando area, please share the word about the space! We're booking for small group meetings, seminars, masterminds, book clubs, and other events.
Please use the Indiegogo sharing tools!

story:
SSB Respite Care is a soon to be respite care facility and school for children and young adults in Durham County, North Carolina.

The Company’s founder, Theresa Bass, personally recognized the need for a respite care facility in the county after struggling to find the appropriate help for her granddaughter who has autism and found close to none. It took years for Theresa to get her granddaughter properly diagnosed and in front of the right health care professionals. After years of struggling to help her, the positive result of the right care made an immediate impact in both of their lives.

Currently, when children with developmental disabilities in Durham County experience severe episodes that are beyond the guardian's ability to manage, there is nowhere to take them for help. These episodes can place the caretaker and other family members at risk of injury and the child facing developmental difficulties can harm themselves. Since there are no other options for help, the guardian is currently forced to take the child to the emergency room and have them admitted to the hospital. Now, caregivers can utilize the services at SSB Respite Care and trust that their children will receive topnotch care from trained professionals that truly understand how to administer the right care for their unique needs. This level of care helps to avoid misdiagnosis and leads to a quicker, more constructive recovery. By educating and involving caregivers every step of the way, we help them minimize future episodes by recognizing triggers and learning new ways to approach care.

SSB Respite Care’s mission is to help children with developmental disabilities throughout Durham County with a better approach to care, providing peace of mind to caregivers and a better quality of life for children struggling with developmental delays. The Company will help children with all types of developmental disorders including ASD, PTSD, ADHD, Anger Management, Bipolar Disorder, and more. Often, these children suffer with a combination of disorders which complicates treatment and requires specialized services and ongoing behavioral support.

What We Need 

The company will have the capacity to treat 20 clients in 20 private rooms. Each room will be homey and upscale helping each child truly feel at home. Unlike other facilities, the Company plans to incorporate aspects of each child’s day to day life to better implement healthy habits for when the child does return home. This means that the families and caretakers of the child will have an active role in the recovery and recuperation of the child. From delivering homework to the facility to taking the child to doctor’s appointments themselves the facility will focus on providing integration with the child’s regular day to day as much as possible.

To open its respite center, SSB is seeking $100,000 in start-up funding to be allocated towards the build-out of the location, initial marketing, key hires, and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! Share our social media links and websites with your friends and family. Together we can create better futures for differently-abled children!

Please learn more about us and our mission here: https://ssbrespitecare.com/

story:
The Accidental Cat Lady

At least, that’s what I’ve been calling myself for the last few years.  Since 2014 I’ve been neck deep in cat shenanigans in one way, shape, or form; fostering litters of kittens, diving into the world of Trap-Neuter-Return (TNR), and along the way I realized the best way to help is by educating people and advocating for all cats. I wanted to start by building a place where people can come together and start to build a community centered around healthy pet ownership, Trap-Neuter-Return, and Foster-Adoption.

 

And what better place to bring people and cats together, than a party?

 

Garden Party Meets Studio Ghibli

I like to call the inspiration for the café “Garden party meets Studio Ghibli”, a whimsical place for patrons to visit cats and a comfortable place for cats to wait for their forever homes. Studio Ghibli is a Japanese animation studio best known for movies like Spirited Away, Howl’s Moving Castle, and My Neighbor Totoro. Studio Ghibli’s warmth and vibrant colors lend themselves to this idea that everyday spaces can become the backdrop of fantastical adventures, and that simple idea has become the essence of the café. 

Stepping foot into the Lounge should feel as though you are stepping into another world. A large oak tree will sprawl one of the walls of the Lounge, and while it won’t provide much shade, it will provide a fun climbing area of cat shelves and scratch posts for our feline residents while they wait for their forever homes. A flower box hideaway topped with all the cat grass imaginable will look out to the café through a window, so everyone who enters the café can enjoy the cats even while waiting in line.

The Cat Lounge and Café are designed to be very relaxing for both feline and human guests alike; with plush couches and floor cushions in the Lounge, but also some booth style tables and ottomans to really kick back and enjoy some food and drink with friends (feline or otherwise).
A big thank you to Akaminyan Art for the café concept designs!

 

Let's Get This Party Started

Biggest question I have gotten is "When will you be open". Right now I am aiming for mid-to-late-2021, but there are potential roadblocks in each step that may delay opening. It also probably goes without saying, but the current situation surrounding the Coronavirus pandemic may provide further delays. 

The current timeline is looking a little something like this:

  • Finding a space - Finding the right space takes time, and though I have a few leads, I need to make sure all requirements are met for the municipality, county, and state. Local ordinances, permits, and bylaws come heavily into play when it comes to an establishment housing food and animals together. 
  • Renovations - Once the space is found, major renovations will be needed. On top of constructing a separate room for the Cat Lounge two HVAC systems will be necessary in order to be in compliance with sanitation. One system will be exclusive to the Cat Lounge, and the other for the café and food preparation areas, ensuring no cross contamination is possible through ventilation systems.  This is just one example of following regulations during the build to ensure that everything is up to code before moving on.
  • Equipment and Furnishings - Once renovations are completed, its all about the things we need. Equipment like brewers for coffee, plates for cakes, and ingredients like tea leaves will all need to be bought and stored. Tables and chairs will need to be bought and set up for the Café section, and then the Cat Lounge will need extra attention to make the space comfortable for both visitors and feline guests. The human patrons are not the only ones that will need items for their stay. The Cats will need food, bowls for food and water, litter pans and litter, toys, catnip, treats, and furniture to play, sleep, and hide in. 
  • Inspections - Inspections must take place before the lounge will be able to accept cats and open doors. Following regulations through the build will help mitigate any potential issues here, but with Cat Cafe's being an uncommon new business type, there may be changes that have to be made at final inspection.

 

Updates will be posted regularly as progress is made through this Indiegogo and through all The Earl Grey Stray's social medias.

 

Building a Community

The Earl Grey Stray is just the beginning of what is to come in 2021. $5,000 would be a great start to this journey. Donations are a mixture of physical swag for our supporters, and items that will go into the foundation of the café as it is being constructed. The goal was to involve the community from the start to craft and shape this space together. Your donations will help every step of the way, from allowing us to continue our rescue efforts before doors open to purchasing necessary items for the Café and Cat Lounge.

  • TNR Start-Up: Gets us traps, trap accessories like trays, divider forks, and carriers to make efforts easy not only on the cats, but the people out there trapping. 
  • Microchip Scanners and Microchips: This will allow us to not only scan stray cats for microchips, giving them a better chance at being reunited with their families, but it will also allow us to chip our community cats and our adoptable cats to ensure everyone can make it home safe in the event they are lost.  
  • ​Vet Bills:  The biggest chunk of this funding will likely be going to this right here. An average cat needs to have shots, tests, and of course spay/neuter before going home, and that is without any form of needed medical expenses like dentals, wound care, or pre-existing conditions. A vet visit can quickly reach over $300 per cat, so this is the biggest help in all of this! 
  • The Swag: A small percent of this funding goes to the Tees and Totes, and the mailing to get those items to you. In comparison to vet bills, shipping and packing is nothing! Backerkit will be able to assist in consolidating the shipping costs and items picked.  

 

I want to thank Lucia Li for bringing my "All Cats Are Good Cats" design to fruition. I wanted to showcase cats of all kinds, from pretty purebreds like the Sphynx to the common ear-tipped alley cat, and every cat in between.

 

Once Doors open, plans include a trap library for Trap-Neuter-Return projects, aiding local working cats programs for those cats who just are not meant to be house cats, and of course bringing people and adoptable cats together with special events throughout the year. 

 

So please donate if you can, and if you can't; give us a share, tell your friends and family, and most importantly spay and neuter your feline friends!

 

Any questions please contact info@theearlgreystray.com

Inspections - Inspections must take place before the lounge will be able to accept cats and open doors. Following regulations through the build will help mitigate any potential issues here, but with Cat Cafe's being an uncommon new business type, there may be changes that have to be made at final inspection.
 Updates will be posted regularly as progress is made through this Indiegogo and through all The Earl Grey Stray's social medias. Building a CommunityThe Earl Grey Stray is just the beginning of what is to come in 2021. $5,000 would be a great start to this journey. Donations are a mixture of physical swag for our supporters, and items that will go into the foundation of the café as it is being constructed. The goal was to involve the community from the start to craft and shape this space together. Your donations will help every step of the way, from allowing us to continue our rescue efforts before doors open to purchasing necessary items for the Café and Cat Lounge.

TNR Start-Up: Gets us traps, trap accessories like trays, divider forks, and carriers to make efforts easy not only on the cats, but the people out there trapping. 

Microchip Scanners and Microchips: This will allow us to not only scan stray cats for microchips, giving them a better chance at being reunited with their families, but it will also allow us to chip our community cats and our adoptable cats to ensure everyone can make it home safe in the event they are lost.  
​Vet Bills:  The biggest chunk of this funding will likely be going to this right here. An average cat needs to have shots, tests, and of course spay/neuter before going home, and that is without any form of needed medical expenses like dentals, wound care, or pre-existing conditions. A vet visit can quickly reach over $300 per cat, so this is the biggest help in all of this! 

The Swag: A small percent of this funding goes to the Tees and Totes, and the mailing to get those items to you. In comparison to vet bills, shipping and packing is nothing! Backerkit will be able to assist in consolidating the shipping costs and items picked.  
 I want to thank Lucia Li for bringing my "All Cats Are Good Cats" design to fruition. I wanted to showcase cats of all kinds, from pretty purebreds like the Sphynx to the common ear-tipped alley cat, and every cat in between. Once Doors open, plans include a trap library for Trap-Neuter-Return projects, aiding local working cats programs for those cats who just are not meant to be house cats, and of course bringing people and adoptable cats together with special events throughout the year.  So please donate if you can, and if you can't; give us a share, tell your friends and family, and most importantly spay and neuter your feline friends! Any questions please contact info@theearlgreystray.com

story: Annie's Pizzeria started with just a small kitchen and a window in Edinburg, Texas, and has quickly outgrown it. through yall's support, we have quickly become a very busy restaurant. Now, we have been offered a fantastic location, but need a little boost to get there. If you'd like to see us in Mission, Texas, support this campaign, and we'll make it happen

story:
Short Summary

Hello!  This is Dalton & Patrice and we are a dynamic duo, husband and wife team dedicated to serving up quality specialty coffee to coffee lovers in our community and beyond.  Our coffee is locally roasted by Carrboro Coffee Roasters and our manual brewing methods ensure consistent quality in each cup.  

Both of us are Army Veterans and in particular, Dalton served in Iraq where he picked up the name "Hollywood" from a Command Sergeant Major that saw him all geared up from the sandstorms and wearing sunglasses.  Years later, Dalton became a filmmaker and we knew that would be the name for our coffee business.  

We picked the coffee business because we not only love coffee but as filmmakers, we're always looking for the next film gig and we all know that "Films Equals Jobs".  So between film jobs, we make coffee and build community!  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for this campaign is to raise $3000.  Two years ago we ran a similar campaign to raise money for our coffee trailer.  With your help, we were able to purchase it last year and hit the road.  Because we didn't reach our goal last year we were only able to buy the trailer and not the equipment to go with it.  This is where we're calling on your help once again to help us purchase an Espresso Machine.  We've decided to make this campaign short and sweet so that we can get espresso in your hands as quickly as possible.  Meeting our $3000 goal will help us with the down payment of the machine and once we surpass our goal it will help us pay it off completely and add additional equipment needed to expand our business.  

We have so many more great ideas to expand Hollywood Java and give our community the greatest experience.  Stay tuned for more!

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to your contribution, other ways you can help us is by spreading the word about our campaign and about Hollywood Java.  Please share this link with all of the coffee lovers that you know around the world.  Follow our social media pages in Instagram, Twitter and Facebook at HollywoodJavaNC.  Lastly, whenever you see us setting up at an event come see us and grab a Cup of Hollywood!  God Bless you all and thank you for your continued support!

story:
As the world economy continues to grow at a rapid rate, parts of Africa are still behind other continents in terms of infrastructural growth. Although select regions are progressing, there are still a number of places that are having a rough time catching up. 

According to the World Health Organization, approximately 3,400 deaths occur worldwide each day from road traffic accidents. With 24.1 deaths per 100,000 residents in 2010, Africa has the highest mortality rate from road traffic accidents. After looking at these statistics our question was: How could a continent with a low number of automobiles have such a high rate of road traffic fatalities? As you can see in the pictures and video; our research revealed some very shocking results.

Due to poor transportation systems, people in rural areas of Africa have no choice but to use whatever attainable means of transportation they can afford. As a result, this leads to vehicle misuse as shown in the pictures. I’m sure we all know that every vehicle designed has limitations in terms of maximum allowable weight, speed and other factors to ensure safe operation. When these are overlooked or pushed to the limit, the vehicle either breaks down or becomes extremely dangerous to operate. This puts all of the passenger’s lives at stake.

The next question we asked ourselves was: Why would anyone willingly put their life in danger by using these risky methods of transportation?  We found that a high number of people using these forms of transportation are either farmers, students or those who have jobs in the city. Farmers have to travel to larger cities to sell their produce in order for them to support their families.  Students have to travel to be in school and workers have to be at their places of employment. This leaves people with very few options. They can either hop on that ride to provide for their basic human needs and pursue their dreams or stay back and have no prospects today and no chances of having a better life tomorrow.

With the fact that it has taken humanity thousands of years to get to where we are today, we would all agree that there are definitely problems which cannot be instantly solved. We can strive to reach our goal of drastically improving this situation by taking the first step. Our aim is towards progress. As one of our favorite quotes say, “Sometimes time is the only best cure.”

This brings us to our goal; raising enough money for one safe, affordable and reliable bus that will move people in places like this from one location to another. We plan to start our pilot bus route in the southern province of Zambia, specifically in a town called Choma. We have already made all necessary connections here that would allow for start-up to be more feasible than in another location. With the fact that there is a high demand for transportation options in general, travelers are more likely to use this bus as their main form due to the increased safety, convenience and affordability when compared to existing options.  We plan to start with a 40 passenger bus; this will bring in the most savings after calculating expenses like insurance, maintenance and bus employee fees. The remaining income will be put in the business’ savings account to purchase more buses and create a network.

Due to the significantly low fare for each seat on this bus, it is only going to take approximately 12 months in order to save enough funds for a second bus. After the second bus is purchased, this will cut the savings period to 6 months for obtaining the third bus. Once we have the third bus, it will then only take 3 months to save for a fourth. This pattern will continue, allowing rapid expansion. As time goes on, we plan to continually expand the network of newly acquired buses all around rural African regions in need of this service.

One of the main objectives of this business is to provide safe, convenient and affordable transportation to people.  In order to ensure that our plan works, the local employees hired to operate and maintain these resources will be on-board with our vision for safety. This means they will seriously enforce the rules that will be put in place. For instance, there will be no exceptions for misusing the buses in terms of exceeding what they are designed for. By providing 25% higher living wages to our employees than they could earn with comparable positions elsewhere, we feel extremely confident that the purpose of this project will be carried out the way we intend. Disabled people, senior citizens, children and people traveling for medical reasons will always be of the highest priority. The welfare and safety of passengers on our buses is of the utmost importance, since it is one of the main inspirations for this project. There will be strict consequences for employees who do not enforce the safety guidelines.

We are really passionate about this project and with your help we believe that we can truly make a difference in the lives of many by providing safe transportation options that are easy to access and financially viable.

Thank you and please feel free to contact us!

“If our hopes of building a better and safer world are to become more than wishful thinking, we will need the engagement of volunteers more than ever.”  - Kofi Annan

story:
REAL Beginnings

The Need.

In our quest to have, accomplish and achieve ALL, we busy modern-day women can oftentimes feel uninspired, isolated, and disconnected from our true selves and others.  

We KNOW that we have to take care of our own well-being however, we tend to put ourselves last – always.  No matter what we try we resist looking for or saying “YES” to help.  

Why do we do this to ourselves?

I knew there were many ways to seek help and support in the therapy/personal-development and I tried them all. 

But sometimes we can't afford it...it feels too much a time-suck, or too big of a commitment....or doesn't create real or sustainable transformation. Oftentimes there wasn't enough personalized support....

Like myself, we continue to feel like there is always something missing.  

It can be super difficult to get REAL with ourselves so that real growth can happen. Then, if we do get real, who is there to truly support us when the Truth isn't so pretty? Not to mention, some of the help that is out there just doesn't seem like we can easily create the real change and progress that we want to see in our lives.

So the question is this…

How do we STAY inspired, empowered, and connected in our busy lives?

REAL Life Book Club was created.

As a busy mom of 2 and an entrepreneur, I needed something that was ALL IN ONE: more personal, accessible, effective, affordable,....easy to say YES to. 

Something easy to integrate into my everyday life and that would allow me to SEE the progress and to make the change in the areas I needed most.


Created with intention.

Created out of need – my need and the need of so many other busy women with the desire for MORE, I created Real Life Book Club.  

Using my skills and experience as a trained coach, and tools I received from my own personal experience, personal and professional development,  I intentionally created the book club to be a one-of-a-kind experience. An experience where busy modern-day women could receive huge inspiration through the books we read, the discussions we have, PLUS create life-changing change through personalized, everyday growth. 

The result is...

What is Real Life Book Club?

Real Life Book Club is a nationally expanding company that makes personal development and supportive community more accessible, affordable, effective, personal and attractive for the busy, modern-day woman.

How does it work?

There are several book club groups throughout Denver and online, each led by a trained Real Life Book Club leader, up to 8 women. The leader chooses the personal development book and the group reads it over 6 weeks, meeting once a week for 1.5-2 hours. 

There truly is nothing out there like it, and the participants are calling it "a healthy addiction". 

Here is what some participants have to say...

It been such an inspiration to me in so many ways, from my own growth to unblocking my own blocks from what I feel is my passion to follow through with it. <<<Paulette P.

This is not just a "book club" this is an invitation to treat yourself to a weekly date with yourself. It allows you the space to grow and the tools to do it with. You are surrounded by women who "get" you, support you and raise you up. It's inspiring, life-changing and it's the perfect gift to give yourself when you want something more from your life...a space that is safe and nurturing while real and challenging. It's beautiful! <<Sarah C.

I am inspired to be more conscious of my thoughts and actions on a day to day basis. The women in the group are hugely inspiring me to dig deeper! <<Sara w.

The meetings started making me feel awesome –empowered, reassured. Empowered to see these women.... reaching out to one another.... After the meetings...I'm happier and that spills over into everything." <<Jacalyn G.

The book club experience has inspired me to look at what I can do differently, to take small steps in my life and to change who I want to become....<<Nicole H.

Here groups are a fun way to carve out time for you and connect with other growth-minded people.<< Hind L.

And the Real Life community doesn't stop there!!!.....

Now there are Real Life Socials! There is one every 2 months of about 50, open to ALL women, 

>>to connect with a panel of women-leaders who have "been there-done that", 

>>experience deeper connection and discussion about real life issues with other women,

>> and enjoy other real-life highlights we may find we are missing in our real lives, like movement, art, music, fashion, business, health, etc. 

We learn at Socials how to embrace more and express more of our untapped, true, authentic selves. 

Check out what women are saying about our Real Life Socials>>>

Our Mission with Real Life Book Club.

To provide an in-person and online community that fosters personal growth and inspires women to be empowered, and to take REAL action and make deeper connections in our real everyday lives.

Where are we now?

Over the past year, we have reached and changed the lives of over 100 women (and counting) in over 7 physical locations, into other states and with 10 newly trained leaders -  inspiring change, fostering connections and making REAL impact in our lives and in the lives of others. 

Some call it a "healthy addiction" and more women are hungry for it.  

They are tired of feeling burnt out, heavy, alone, uninspired....they want to carve out the right amount of time, energy, and money to their self-care.

We’ve tried and tested various platforms and delivery formats, surveyed and listened to our audience and from them - through them, we know that this works and that what they want, and what they need – is MORE.  

More book club locations, more teaching formats, more community experience, more opportunities to become leaders and more REAL Life.  

This is all very exciting, but…

This is where you come in.

We really need some help.  Your help.  

Our hope is to take this model and apply it not only to women but also to men and to college age kids as well.  We are raising funds so that we can continue to grow and reach even more people and to create a safe and easy to navigate space through a new community-based website, to streamline our process so that it is also easy to get involved and to make the change that people want to see in their lives and in others around them.

We have framework ready to train new leaders, to reach women who need it, to spread the life-changing experience and cultivate new communities, but the foundation of the right website is required to make this happen on a larger scale and for REAL Life Book Club to be sustainable into the future.

We have hired a team of talented and good-hearted experts to head the project. From the videographer, to the website designer and programmer, to the software to keep all the parts moving smoothly, your contributions will support this team of enthusiastic creators who believe in the vision as well! All funds will go to supporting this project.

The Impact

Behind every great woman are other great women. We need each other. We need each other on a real, deep level to support each other to become better women, full of life, love and happiness.

What the world needs are more ALIVE people who are ready to help others in their own way. 

With the creation of the website, we can reach thousands of women and give them the safe space, community and growth that will put a smile on their face again, a lightness in their step, and more love in their hearts for themselves so that they can give with more joy to others in their lives. 

More mentorships will be formed, more leaders will be developed, and more women will choose to become better women. The ripple effect to create sustainable change will be unsurmountable and impactful.

We truly cannot do this without you.  Please help to support me, our leaders, REAL Life Book Club, our cause and our mission to create sustainable, inspiring change now and into the future.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you won’t be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Here are a few ways you can:

  • Tell your friends!  Help us get the word out and make some noise about our mission and our campaign by telling others about us, sharing the link to our campaign and sharing on your social sites.

  • Indiegogo has special share tools that make it super easy for you to click and share!

  • Join us at our next club or social events – we’d love to see your support there as well!

Thank you.

Thank you SO MUCH from the bottom of my heart.  We love you, and we love REAL Life Book Club, and together, we can keep it going.  

Thank you!

Susannah and the RLBC team

Join us at our next club or social events – we’d love to see your support there as well!
Thank you.Thank you SO MUCH from the bottom of my heart.  We love you, and we love REAL Life Book Club, and together, we can keep it going.  Thank you!Susannah and the RLBC team

story:
What is ArrancaPR ?

ArrancaPR is a nonprofit started by Puerto Ricans living in the United States to help transfer technical skills to those living in the island.
What is a hackerspace?
Is a place where people with interest in technology and in the creation of products or "hacks" can gather.
This is aligned with our goals in Arranca PR, since it would be ideal to have a center in the island for people to congregate and attend our lessons.
Below are some images of what we expect the place to look and some of the basic interactions we expect.

Above we can see a group working on their project together with their tools on the table. The guy in the brown shirt has a breadboard where he is testing his circuit.

On this second image we have a team working on the soldering station why they wait for a 3d print for their case to complete.
Who is working on this project?
Right now I'm leading the organization. My name is Alfredo Alvarez I'm a software developer by day and a 3d printer enthusiast in my free time. I lived in Seattle for the past 5 years while working for Microsoft and currently work for georiot.com.
Edward Betancourt is the right hand in the role of Vice president of the Organization. He worked at MIT Lincoln Labs and now is the CTO of Shelfie.
Widalys Ramos the director of operation is working on the day to day activities of keeping the organization running.
We have currently about 48 registered members that are in US and help us organize the activities that are being planned.

Why does this matter?

Puerto Rico right now is going through an economic crisis, because of it, the average individual has limited access to high tech prototyping machinery. This represents a disadvantage to take part in the Innovation Economy trends. Together, we can provide the opportunity to thousands of people in the island to learn about 3d printing, CNC, arduinos, among other technologies and methods.

What Do We Need & What Do You Get

This campaign will help us with the startup costs for the center. We plan on selling memberships and ask for donations to support day to day operations.  

Below is a detailed account of what we will acquire and what it will let us do.

  • 3d printing equipment - Will allow us to teach physical classes of plastic object designs and product cad.
    -USD $1,300 for 2 printerbot metal


    -USD $2,200 dollars for an ultimaker 2 printer
    -USD $400 dollars for initial filament
  • Laser Engraving - Cut parts in wood and metal, plus we can do etched designs into a bunch of materials.
    -USD $4,000 for an epilog laser
  • Cnc Mill - Create metal/wood parts to complement our plastic components.
    -USD $2,500 for a nomad CNC
  • Arduino electronic kits -This is where the fun really starts. We can do electronic projects and robotics and make parts using the other tools.
    -USD $420 for 6 sets
  • Projector - Very important since it will allow us to do our online lessons in a community setting.
    -USD $500 for a reasonable one
  • Laptops
    -USD $1400 dollars for 3
  • Tables And Chairs
    -USD $500 for 4 work desks and one for the soldering station 
  • Soldering stations
    -USD $200 
  • Safety Equipment & tools
    -USD $400 We will buy normal hardware to have available
  • Running costs for about 2 months
    -USD $1,800 would let us cover the building cost light and water
We went thru what we need. Now let's discuss the rewards for your generous donations. Besides our eternal gratitude we plan to provide the following to those who donate to us.
  • $1 - Our thanks and your name will be on the website http://arrancapr.org has a sponsor.
  • $5 - You will receive our custom made card to celebrate the opening of the center via email.
  • $10 - Same card has above but via mail.
  • $15 - A coqui keychain made in the 3d printers.


  • $25 - A t-shirt that will get designed to commemorate the start of the center.
  • $35 - 3d printed night light that displays taino symbols
  • $50 - All the previous rewards - nightlight + an additional keychain made in the cnc or laser cutter.
  • $100 - Same as previous + 2 hours of help designing a product of your own. Only 10 available
  • $150 All the previous rewards + the night light
  • $250 A version of the night light that plays the sound of the ocean or the coqui. Only 10 available.
  • $500  All rewards before and Exclusive first look at the center before it opens
  • $1000 All rewards + 1 custom designed 3d object + Vip treatment at the center's opening

The Impact

The center will be in Isabela, Puerto Rico a town has 45k inhabitants, and is next to some of the largest engineering companies in the island (Infotech, Honeywell, Axxon and Hewlett Packard). By placing it in this location, we expect the following outcomes:

  • Help people in Puerto Rico figure out what is possible to do with current technology.
  • Create a focal point for technology near the engineering center that is the west coast of Puerto Rico.
  • Inspire others to build similar centers around the island.
  • Show options for teenagers that are interested in product creation.
  • Promote technological products that can be sold in the global market.
The organization is right now providing courses online that can be seen in our you tube page. This is the curriculum that we currently have planned.


Risks & Challenges

This project's visions is “if you build it they will come”. While we have identified the need for these skills and for the machinery in order to improve the opportunity of the people living in the area there are a few major factors that could impact the project in the long run.

  • Ability to recruit volunteers and get people to join in the association.
  • Rules and government codes that we might not be aware of.
  • Our ability to contact technological professionals in the US to provide the online lessons at low cost.
  • Receiving our 501c3 status. We are still in the queue and are hoping to get an answer before the campaign is over.

Schedule

There is ample time in the schedule, since we need to organize the center to make sure that the operation runs smoothly and that we have all the equipment.
  • January 15 - February 28 - We will be promoting the campaign and hopefully signing the contract for the space.
  • March 1st - If we reach the funding goal, we will place the orders for the items that need to be ordered.
  • March 15th - Cleanup the local and prepare for the arrival of the equipment. Recruitment of volunteers.
  • 1st week of April - Training of volunteers on the new machinery.
  • Till april 20th - Creation of rewards
  • 2nd of May - Opening of the center.

Can't donate but want to help us out

  • Share the page, send it to local newspapers and radio stations
  • Use the share tools
  • Sign up in http://arrancapr.org

Last but not least, if we raise more money than we need, we will use it to run the center for one year (about $25k). Any additional funds will be used to buy similar equipment for similar spaces around the island.

story:
Short Summary

We believe that one of the core responsibilities of the church is to give an abundance of mercy to the poor. And that's exactly what we do every first Saturday of the month for the people who live in the city of Northridge by giving away free groceries to the community.

There are a lot of struggling families in Northridge who need help making ends meet, and sometimes, just a little boost is all they need.

What We Need

Basically, what we already have a network of partnerships that provide the groceries. Now we just need just a tiny bit of resources ($500) to get the word out. There are two major ways we will use this capital to get the word out:

1. Flyers for when we go door to door

2. Facebook promotion

The Impact

The challenges of everyday life will be eased for those who are facing a hard time right now. You could be helping single moms, a family where there's been a job loss, a family that just doesn't quite make enough and others.

Simply put: Your gift will help make a difference in people's lives.

story:
About Bailey's Café

Bailey’s Café (not an actual café) is a literary reference from a novel of the same name by Gloria Naylor, based on the stories of people who find themselves at the edge of the world and seek a place to heal and ground themselves.

Bailey’s Café is a Brooklyn-based, 501(c)(3) charitable organization dedicated to providing creative and collaborative environments to communities across New York City.  We create these types of environments through partnerships with local leaders and inter-generational volunteers, all focused on community-building through service and the arts.

We believe in nurturing and guiding individuals in their pursuit of self-knowledge through acting, video making, writing, service, cooking, music, dance, and fine arts.  We aim to create an atmosphere of collective awareness, respect and responsibility, built on the talents and resources of the community.

Visit our website for additional information on our Core Values, Mission Statement, community programs, and more.

What We Need

As a community organization, we create physical and virtual spaces in partnership with local leaders, artists, and inter-generational volunteers, through a focus on community building, service, and the arts.

But in the 11 years that we have been running programs, Bailey’s Café has never had a place to call home!

In a few short weeks, we will take up residence in Bedford-Stuyvesant Brooklyn, thus transforming the future of Bailey’s Café and the lives of those it touches.  With our new home, we can create opportunities for economic development, social entrepreneurship, community engagement, and artistic expression.

While it has everything that we need (reasonable rent,  1800 sq. ft., and a central location), our new home (formerly a barber shop) still needs lots of renovations (interior and exterior) and equipment (laptops, a printer, basic furniture for inter-generational gatherings and story-sharing).

Here are our costs:

MATERIALS (electrical and structural)   $ 8,000
EQUIPMENT (laptops, etc.) $ 2,000
OCCUPANCY (taxes, etc.) $ 5,000
FURNITURE $ 5,000
LABOR $10,000
TOTAL $30,000

Your Impact

Through our School-Based and Summer Programming, we impact the lives of 600 youth on a yearly basis; while currently enrolling 100 youth per year.

Your donation, whether it’s $1 or $100, will directly impact each and every one of those youths, their families, and their futures.

How many lives did your dollar change today?

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk is if you don’t support Bailey’s Café (donate, share with your friends, or volunteer).

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember that even as little as $1 will benefit Bailey’s program participants (and you’ll be invited to the Grand Opening Celebration)!  If you can’t contribute now, there are other ways to get involved: you can easily spread the word to your friends by using Indiegogo Share Tools or volunteer your time!

We thank you for your support and time and hope that you believe in Bailey’s Café as much as we do! Thank You!

What We Do

Since its founding in 2003, Bailey’s Café has focused in primarily two areas:

  1. Community Building and Service
  2. Arts Education and Production.

Across our programs, Bailey’s Café builds inter-generational connections and story sharing, expose our participants to new experiences, honor the stories of those whose voices are seldom heard and help develop a sense of possibility, healing and renewal through community-based organizing and artistic expression.

How We Serve

  1. School-Based and Summer Programs
  2. Community-Based Arts Programs
  3. Artist-in-Resident Program

Bailey’s Café has long-term partnerships with eight schools, over twenty youth/community-based organizations, and over twenty-five teaching artists in the Bedford-Stuyvesant and Crown Heights area.

Visit our website for additional information on our community programs.

story:
Last night (February 9, 2015) my high school had a fire in the one building of the King's Academy campus in Morhsville, PA. Thank God that it was in the middle of the night and only the small high school building was damaged. 

I had a lot of great memories at this high school as I am sure  my peers have as well and I would like to do whatever I can to help support them at this time. 

This campaign is simple. The purpose of this campaign is to raise funds to help in whatever way is needed at King's Academy. 

The Goal 

Currently, the goal is to raise $5,000, but that is not a set amount. I hope and pray we can raise far more than that.  Any amount is good enough to donate. 
Let's show King's how much we care about them!

Other Ways You Can Help

If financially you cannot help, your prayers are always welcome.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Constellation Collective

We are three women filled to the brim with dreams, ideas, and motivation. We were brought together by our love of all things food and community, and by the deep desire to not just feed but nourish our neighborhood. 

The Constellation Collective is the joining of two existing endeavors: Valentina Fortuna's Shop Cafe (delightful baked goods) and Maura Rosato and Lindsey Ferguson's FareWell Foods (thoughtfully preserved produce). Our mission is this:

"We are a collective focused on culinary pursuits, comprised primarily of bakers, preservers, growers, and designers. We intend to occupy the kitchen space that currently exists at 13 Fern Avenue, Collingswood, NJ (The Factory). Our intention is to utilize that space to produce food product that will be sold at farmers markets, festivals, and in retail locations. We are strongly committed to investing in our surrounding community in return for the investment it has made in us."

What We Need & What You Get

We've worked hard to do the heavy lifting of getting this kitchen running - we have secured the space, purchased the large equipment and appliances (ovens, refrigerators, plumbing work, electric work, etc.) and are prepared to do whatever it takes to fulfill this dream of having our own commercial kitchen space to work out of. 

So why do we need your help? 

The little things add up - what we need is a nest egg of sorts, some help to defray the costs of initial produce, dry goods, and paper goods orders. To help outfit our space with the necessary tools of our trade. To help us start doing what we do best: cooking and creating. 

What do you get? 

There will be perks for each level of donation, and the sooner we can make this space a working kitchen, the sooner our creations will be filling your bellies! 

The Impact

We have had some successes with our individual businesses, helped in no small part by our community and its support. It is important for us to expand our business in our own backyard and make that same supportive community our home base, hopefully strengthening the neighborhood in the process. 

We strive to source our ingredients from local farmers and growers, so by supporting The Constellation Collective you are supporting the local economy as a whole. We are the product of a community that has invested in us, and in turn we are driven to invest in our community. We hope you are too!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate, but please take the time to share our campaign! Your support, in whatever form it takes, means the world to us and we thank you!

story:
"...giving all people in DC a sense of joy and ownership in their incredible rivers and placing citizenship ahead of profit!"  The picture above is of the officers of  the Sea Scout Ship that I started and sponsored, AND we need your help reviving this great project for young men and women as a part of the new business.

My name is Eric and I have been captaining boats on Washington DC's rivers for over 20 years. A group of friends and I are starting a community boat company in Southwest DC to serve the extraordinary place we call home. Our first company, Capital Yacht Charters, was purchased from us in 2011 and then closed by the new owners after an accidental fire last year.  We feel obligated to our community, our old employees, and our old customers to rebuild and start anew.  Our vision is to bring all people in Washington down to the river to explore the place they live, meet new friends and neighbors, and create special memories. The new DC Yacht Charter and Tour Company will offer tours and unique one-of-a-kind charters from weddings and bar/bat mitzvahs to cruises for churches, wounded veterans, special needs children, and those who care for our precious waterways, and teas for women old and young and the people who love them.  We believe that small, locally-owned businesses are the best way to create jobs, strong relationships, and a sustainable economy in our community. Please join us!


We are starting this company with two lovely old boats (Click Gallery above) that are certified to carry passengers and need some work. Finished Business is a classic all-wood "Grande Dame" yacht built in 1947 originally as a rescue PT Boat.  Celebrity is our strong workhorse boat: a converted oil platform supply boat built of a unique alloy known as CORTEN. 


Why Support Us?

To be ready for the  National Cherry Blossom Festival (the biggest waterfront event in DC) and the 2015 season, our team has already contributed most of our savings and hundreds of hours of sweat equity. We have also volunteered both boats for several spring fundraisers for homeless people in our community.

We are raising funds to pay our start up costs including commercial insurance, slip fees, to upgrade our marketing, build a website, and lots of reconstruction and maintenance materials. If you've ever had a boat, you know they need a lot of TLC! We need you on our team to help make these boats shipshape.
The company will donate at least one event a month for charitable events such as outreach programs for military families, homeless families, and kids in our neighborhood.
Contributors can get choices of one-of-a-kind Perks.
If we don't reach our entire goal, we will seek traditional lending and investment,  We prefer not to do this because it will encumber us with debt that will limit our ability to succeed in our mission. Besides, we'd rather pay you with perks than pay interest to a bank!  

The Impact

Historically, our waterways in DC were dirty and dangerous and no place to relax or enjoy; today they are cleaner and more inviting than ever before. Over half the people in the world live in coastal regions, and most of those people would like to spend more time on and near the water. We know river-based business can be successful.

We also know that the poorest and sickest among us seldom get the chance to enjoy the spiritual and economic benefits of the beautiful rivers in our midst.  Our personal mission is simple: create jobs, strong relationships, and a sustainable economy for ALL people in our community.  This means spending a larger portion of our time and efforts supporting community organizations with a view toward protecting water resources for all people and ending some of the suffering in the neighborhoods.  Yes, we believe that we can and must use our unique business in this way.

Our old Captains and crew - who are also the owners and operators - have an incredible 35-year track record in the southwest DC community.  We're not talking about a cruise here or there.  We are talking about major campaigns, events and festivals for our community such as our first Tall Ships Festival hosting historic vessels like the Amistad, the Southwest Arts Festival, the Kidney Foundation Festivals, the annual Blessing of the Fleet, the annual Easter Seals Cruise for Kids, the new National Cherry Blossom Festival, the founding of the Anacostia Watershed Society, wounded vets and veteran couples fellowship events, teas for the Washington Tea Society for African American Young Girls, Samaritan Ministry of Greater Washington fundraising, a lecture series on History of Black Mariners on the Potomac, the founding of a new Sea Scout Ship, and countless philanthropic events with churches in the neighborhood.

Please join Captains and crew Eric, Walt, Kevin, Gunner, Dennis, Debbie, Bill, and Al in the next decade of giving all people in DC a sense of joy and ownership in their incredible rivers and placing citizenship ahead of profit!


Risks & Challenges

We have two big challenges. The first is getting these two old boats ready for the 2015 season. We are running out of time! The second is that we have spent so much time on the boats we are behind on marketing and getting the word out. In addition, all the traditional risks of the boat business apply (safety, navigation, machinery, and weather). 

While these risks may appear large, they are manageable if we can avoid the high debt that comes with traditional boat financing options. We have an incredibly gifted team, including two master shipwrights, a master engineer, highly experienced Captains, and a yacht steward. Two members of the team have successfully started and run businesses for a combined total of over 50 years. 

We have the expertise and experience; we need your help to make the final push so that 2015 will be a strong inaugural year for this business and the idea of a community boat company.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help us but don't have money to give, please consider sharing this with other people you know. Also, we would love to hear about your local community business and what you have learned!
story_txt:
"...giving all people in DC a sense of 
joy and ownership in their incredible rivers and placing citizenship 
ahead of profit!"  The picture above is of the officers of  the Sea Scout Ship that I started and sponsored, AND we need your help reviving this great project for young men and women as a part of the new business.My name is Eric and I have been captaining boats on Washington DC's rivers for over 20 years. A group of friends and I are starting a community boat company in Southwest DC to serve the extraordinary place we call home. Our first company, Capital Yacht Charters, was purchased from us in 2011 and then closed by the new owners after an accidental fire last year.  We feel obligated to our community, our old employees, and our old customers to rebuild and start anew.  Our vision is to bring all people in Washington down to the river to explore the place they live, meet new friends and neighbors, and create special memories. The new DC Yacht Charter and Tour Company will offer tours and unique one-of-a-kind charters from weddings and bar/bat mitzvahs to cruises for churches, wounded veterans, special needs children, and those who care for our precious waterways, and teas for women old and young and the people who love them.  We believe that small, locally-owned businesses are the best way to create jobs, strong relationships, and a sustainable economy in our community. Please join us! 
We are starting this company with two lovely old boats (Click Gallery above) that are 
certified to carry passengers and need some work. Finished Business is a
 classic all-wood "Grande Dame" yacht built in 1947 originally as a 
rescue PT Boat.  Celebrity is our strong workhorse boat: a converted oil
 platform supply boat built of a unique alloy known as CORTEN.  
  

Why Support Us?
 
To be ready for the  National Cherry Blossom Festival (the biggest 
waterfront event in DC) and the 2015 season, our team has already contributed most of our 
savings and hundreds of hours of sweat equity. We have also volunteered both boats for several spring fundraisers for homeless 
people in our community. story:
An innovative community is forming right here in Dallas/Fort Worth. It's called 'Oasis', and it's a neutral place where we can connect, inspire, and empower one another. A place where life is celebrated, family is valued, and all people matter.


We all have different backgrounds and beliefs. Many of us simply don't fit in faith-based communities. Some of us have backgrounds in the church, while others have been congregating at skeptics conferences for years. If you have been labeled or you label yourself as unaffiliated, freethinker, agnostic, secular humanist, atheist, secular, or anywhere in between, then this is the community for you!

It's time to come together - to build a community and to celebrate the human experience.

Our weekly gatherings will feature live performances by local musicians, speakers to inspire and educate, and children's programming to entertain and stimulate young minds.

It's time for Oasis - a well of compassion and reason where we can celebrate life and, together, make a difference.


Are you curious as to what this kind of community will look like?  We are affiliating with The Oasis Network, a successful community grounded in reason, celebrating the human experience and launching based on their successful model that has created a vibrant, warm, and happy community.


What does your contribution pay for?We've projected the following for a six-month budget:

  1. Event space for 6 months every week - $7,200
  2. Equip event space- $1600
  3. Coffee, tea, and everything that comes with it- $1200
  4. Community engagement materials- $2500
  5. Indiegogo's piece of the pie- $360

Total: $12,860

The Impact

Vibrant, tightly knit communities are central to human happiness and well-being; we are social creatures by nature. For this reason, we need communities like Oasis to provide a place to connect, be inspired and feel empowered. 

Furthermore, we need to provide a place where children can explore their developing world-views, ask questions and make friends in an environment that is supportive of critical thinking.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share what we are doing and our campaign link on your social media outlets!  
Add us on Facebook and Twitter 

Want to volunteer?  Visit our website and let us know you would like to help!
www.dfwoasis.org

story:
CAR 4 help - which helps families with children in a difficult life situation

The Diaconia in Vsetin helps in socially deprived families.  Acquisition of a new car would make the hard work much easier. Will you help too? Join the campaign CAR 4 help.


Help us to acquire a new car!

We are presently travelling to 55 families  in the town Vsetin and in its outskirts. Many families live in so called excluded Roma locality on Vsetin outskirts, the others in the range of 20 kilometers.

Seven workers of the Diaconia have at disposal three vehicles now; one of them is very old and faulty. We cannot choose but to walk to these families even sometimes a long distances.  The lack of cars means that our workers cannot provide their services to all in need. Therefore, we need a new car - CAR 4 help.


The story about  one of „our“ families…

will tell you more. Let us call them for instance family Novak’s. They have got three children: the oldest boy John, daughter Ann and the youngest boy George. Ann used to go to the special school where the „uneasily educated children“ are placed in the Czech Republic. But Mrs. Novak wanted Anna to visit the regular primary school. It has been made possible with our assistance.

We were helping to George since he was only three years old.

His parents has been striving too and so when he was six he has been enrolled to the regular school. Our worker regularly co-operates with the parents to prepare George for classes, to have all utilities etc. Our worker also pushes the parents to solve all eventual problems with the school in time. We are happy that George already visits the fourth grade and there was no need to repeat any grade. Also the oldest son John is successful as he was enrolled to the practical vocational school.

The Novak’s used to live in socially excluded locality in destitute conditions. They wanted to leave. Our worker was helping also with this matter. The Novak’s have learned to economize better, to service the debts and therefore they have saved money to pay a new rent. Although they had to face refusing because of their Roma origin, at the end they found with our help a new flat out of the excluded locality. The family still needs our help. But we are well aware that they are trying to stand on their own feet. And we believe that they will soon not need our help any more.


For each donor we have a great reward

- do not miss the unique resonant “Thank you!” from children of Vsetín!



About us:

Diaconia Vsetin  (2004 – 2015)  serves in the eastern part of the Czech Republic. It helps to children, to the young and to families with children; it also provides services to the seniors. More at: http://www.diakonievsetin.cz/en/

story:
Helene Elizabeth Wellness Center 

Wellness is much more than merely physical health, exercise or nutrition. It is the full integration of states of physical, mental, and spiritual well-being. Helene Elizabeth Wellness Center is an idea that has been years in the making. I want it to be a place where people can re-energize, re-focus, find balance and learn how enjoyable life can be and strive to be their best self and reach their true potential.  It is the mission of the Helene Elizabeth Wellness Center to provide customers with workshops and events targeted at the promotion of physical, emotional, intellectual and spiritual wellness. 


Some of the workshops & events that will be held at the wellness center include:

Physical Wellness workshops:

• Yoga
• Pilates
• Zumba
• Latin/Ballroom Dancing
• Belly Dancing
• African Dancing
• Dance movement
• Healing Meditation
• Self Defense

Emotional Wellness workshops:
• Weight Management
• Diabetes Wellness
• PCOS Awareness
• Depression
• Building Self-esteem
• Painting class
• Seniors citizen dedicated classes

Intellectual Wellness workshops:
• Job readiness
• Computer Courses
• Book of the month club
• Creating Apps

Spiritual Wellness workshops:
• Meditation
• Reiki
• Chakra Clearing

Support Groups & Events:
• Breast Center Survivor day of honor
• Veteran support group
• Kidney Disease support group


All contributions will be invested in all start-up costs that include:

                

** If the goal of $50,000 is not met the funds collected will still be used as contribution for the start-up cost. I am presently in the Brooklyn Library Power-Up 2015 Competition. The money that I receive from the Power-Up Competition will be combined with all proceeds & funding in addition to my personal savings for the launch of my wellness center.


In an effort to thank everyone for contributing to this campaign the following perks are included in our packages:




Our T-shirts (Small to 2XL)


Yoga stress ball (size 3-1/4" X 4" X 2-1/4")



BPA free Blender Bottle sports mixer 28oz with blender ball included

Breast Cancer Survivor series 



Collapsible Water Bottle

  color options (left to right: black,blue, camouflage, clear,green, orange,purple, red,grey,white,yellow)




Wellness Bag (items inside not included)


Bluetooth Keyboard (tablet not included)

11" Plush singing bears in the Military (each bear sold separately)





Other ways you can help: I completely understand if you're unable to donate money, but there are other ways that you can help. Visit our website and let others know about the Helene Elizabeth Wellness Center. We encourage you to spread the word about the center and share the link to our indiegogo page.  Above all, please join our mailing list so that you can still become a part of our wellness family and receive exclusive offer about our upcoming events.


Information for other small business owners

As I previously stated I am one of the contestants in the Brooklyn New York Power-Up competition that allows small business owners to win money for their businesses. To be eligible for the Brooklyn competition one of the requirements is that you reside in Brooklyn. I am passionate about what this organization is striving to do and I encourage other business owners and start-ups to check out their website.

For more info on the Brooklyn competition Brooklyn Power-up

For more info on the Manhattan competition Power-up competition

The idea behind Helene Elizabeth Wellness Center

At 21, I was diagnosed with PCOS (Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome). I was diagnosed at a time when information about PCOS was scarce.  He discovered multiple cysts on both of my overly enlarged ovaries. His exact words to this discovery was “you have PCOS and you won’t be able to have any kids!” the words casually spewed out of his mouth as if he was scheduling me for my next doctor’s appointment. I sat there heartbroken as if I lost a part of me that day. For the days that followed I cried sporadically. I always dreamed of one-day birthing a child of my own and it felt as if that part of my life was over. Not being able to have children left me with a feeling of being less than a woman. Being an optimist, I knew that I would have to eventually view the world as a place filled with endless possibilities again.  I began meditating, taking yoga classes and coming to terms with the idea of not having children. I decided to place my energy in creating a center that would cater to providing support groups for people who have various disabilities &  illnesses and the individuals support them.

I decided to return to school and focus on obtaining my Masters degree in Rehabilitation Counseling to help individuals living with disabilities and disabled soldiers and veterans while incorporating my Higher Education expertise. One of my pilot programs that mean the most to me is my program for the disabled. In July 2013, my brother's leg was amputated due to complications of diabetes. The amputation of his leg introduced us to a new world that required a lot of faith and a new way of viewing the world. My experience with PCOS birth my idea of my Center. However, my brother's amputation experience forced me to put my plan into action, and I began tirelessly dedicating any free time I have to turn the Helene Elizabeth Wellness Center into fruition. One of my favorite quotes that I live by is  Hillel the Elder "if not me who, if not now when!


To join my mailing list visit my website and join our mailing list. 

For more info about the Helene Elizabeth Wellness Center please click on the link below and visit our website:

www.HeleneElizabethWellnesscenter.com

story:
During the gap year before I enter SVA as a fine arts major in the fall I want to start an online business selling my art. The money I raise will go towards equipment such as printers and camera accessories, art supplies, and some initial start up money for the first few orders of shipping and handling. I will mainly be doing darkroom photography so I will also have to buy the necessary chemicals, and paper. I also experiment in mixed media including adding my poetry to photos and acrylic painting. For my digital photography work I will need Photoshop, and a new laptop to organize photos, to use Photoshop more effectively and manage business. All of the items I hope to purchase will be not only helpful to my business but also my future education and overall artistic growth.

  Art has always been a huge part of my life. I am currently interning at an art gallery where they have displayed my photography in the past. I also have another internship with a company as a concert photographer. I have won several art awards in high school, including a scholarship for college. Last year I won first place inThe Stamford Art Association 41st High School Art Show & Portfolio Competition in mixed media and also the CT Pioneer Branch of the National League of American Pen Women junior art award winner where 5 of my works were displayed. Additionally last year I had my very first one man show which went over really well, and I made many sales. I’ve included several examples of my work for you to see my range. Any donation would be greatly appreciated and I thank you for taking time to consider my fundraiser.  


Pssstttt Follow me on Twitter!       :)


@Lizziesweethart  - Where I will be promoting this fundraiser and putting up new works shortly

Printer Equipment - 750
Macbook - 1,500
Photoshop - 1,500
Camera Equipment - 750
Shipping and Handling (before im able to pay for it with proceeds, and also for equipment and supplies im buying) - 300
Ect. Supplies (darkroom Chemicals, darkroom misc tools, Different sizes of paper both darkroom and digital, film - different sizes, ink) - 1,000

Etsy Shop Front

time to consider my fundraiser.

story:
UUCH Service trip to the CDCA

The Center for Development in Central America is a non-profit organization which works with the poor in Nicaragua, focusing on the all important task of empowering the poor to improve their own lives for the better.  They work in the areas of sustainable agriculture, sustainable economic development, appropriate technology, education, and health care.  For more on the CDCA please visit their website at http://jhc-cdca.org.

We are members of the Universalist Unitarian Church of Haverhill, and we are undertaking our first service trip to Nicaragua.  The money that we raise here will go directly to the CDCA, and help in funding their third clinic building.  This third building will allow them space to perform minor surgeries, take x-rays, continue health training, and expand their women's health programs.  We are proud to be fundraising for such a worthy cause, and we hope you will support us!


What We Need and What You Get

Each member of our delegation is responsible for a portion of the money being given to the CDCA.  The center then uses the money we raise to:

Pay for building materials

Pay the Nicaraguans who work alongside the delegations

Cover the cost of the delegation's stay in Nicaragua

Our eleven member delegation is jointly trying to raise $6000, although should we manage to raise more than that we would be thrilled to be able to donate more to the CDCA to fund their vital work.

Every dollar raised here will go to the CDCA, regardless of whether or not we make our goal.  Those of you that contribute to our service trip will receive access to an online photo journal of our trip, complete with details of how we spent our days and pictures of the things we did.


The Impact

It is hard to quantify the impact that a venture such as this can have in the world, so instead of trying to predict the future, we'd like to share a bit about the past.

Almost twenty years ago Nueva Vida was a refugee community.  Twelve thousand people fleeing the rising waters of Lake Managua were relocated "temporarily" to a large cattle field at the end of a dirt road outside one of Managua's poorest suburbs, and left there.  They had black plastic sheets, a few sticks to turn those sheets into tents, and whatever belongings they had managed to carry away from their homes in the midst of the hurricane that was destroying their lives.


Today Nueva Vida is a neatly organized barrio, with small concrete homes built on individual plots of land.  There are shade trees and fruit trees--planted to provide relief and sustenance--and the families that live there have access to clean, running water.  There is a health clinic located in Nueva Vida, one that not only treats the inhabitants of Nueva Vida, but also provides health organization to teach them better methods of sanitation, personal care, and family health. 

The transformation from desolate camp to thriving community is due almost entirely to the hard work of the CDCA and the groups that have gone to volunteer with them.  They have dug ditches for pipes, holes for latrines, planted trees, built clinics, and always, always, always worked *with* the people in the community, ensuring that their help was offered in the spirit of respect and friendship.



We want to be part of this.  We want to contribute what we can, how we can, in the hopes that the impact will continue.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you, no matter how much you might wish otherwise, simply aren't in a position to contribute.  That's okay!  If you'd like to support us, please share our campaign with your friends and family.  Send emails, link to us on facebook, or tweet about it.  We appreciate your help!
