story:
James was framed for murder, tried and convicted as murderer, and is currently in the worst prison in Georgia, despite the fact that there is no evidence against him except for two statements that should have been thrown out, as they are proven to be lies. In his dealings with the justice system, he found nothing but injustice. His only chance to receive justice is to appeal his case. 

This is a costly expense, however, when murder is involved. We need your help obtaining an appellate attorney so that James can get the trial he deserves. He is innocent of the crime for which he has been charged. The attorneys we have spoken with are asking for $25K up front and potentially additional charges.

Whatever you can spare, we will be more than grateful for. Please donate and share even if you can't donate. Everything counts. 


This is James's account of the incident and the proceedings thereafter:

"This is a detailed recap of the events which place on April 14, 2012 (ultimately resulting in my arrest) to date in reference to the criminal case. I certify and attest all statements are true and acurate to the best of my knowledge.

On the evening of April 14, 2012, I was invited by Victor Scott to his apartment for a barbeque. Vick, at this time, resided with a guy named Mike. I only know Vick because he recently dated my roommate, Veronica. Vick was often at my apartment, so frequently that he basically lived with us. A week prior to the events mentioned here, Vick and Veronica ended their relationship. As a result, Vick moved in with Mike.

Upon arriving at Mike and Vick's apartment, I encountered a total of five individuals: Mike, his wife, Vick and two guys I did not know (I found later to be named Gene and Jeremy). I asked Vick about the barbeque and he stated that he never told me about a barbeque. Gene and the other guy laughed as if an inside joke existed. Realizing the barbeque was not going to take place, I asked Vick if I could borrow his phone to call Phalecia, since mine was off. He said yes and I called her, asking her to order pizza because Victor was not having a barbeque. She was upset because I should have gone to the store, rather than being lazy, and now we had to waste money on pizza.

She told me to make sure I was back at the apartment when the pizza arrived because she was on her way home from work (via public transportation) and didn't know if she would be there in time. After hanging up and giving Victor his phone back he asked me if I knew anyone with some weed. I told him 'not really, only Will.'

Will is a mutual friend of mine and Victor and is actually the person that introduced Victor to Veronica. Will was my roommate in college. That's how we met and we have been friends ever since. Victor called him and asked him if he had some weed and Will told him yes, but he didn't know if he could get a ride to bring it to Victor, so he would have to call him back and let him know. 

While Victor waited, he was calling other people because Will is known for standing people up. While victor was calling other people, Phalecia called back to tell me she ordered the pizza and to head home. I gave Victor his phone back and told him I was leaving. I still needed to walk to the store and make it home to get the pizza. Victor asked me if I would wait for him. He wanted to walk with me but wanted to let his phone charge up a bit. I agreed.

While we were waiting, he started asking me about Veronica and if she was talking about him since he had been gone. I told him I hadn't really talked to her. He asked if I thought she would talk to him and I said yes. So he started calling her while his phone was plugged in. A few minutes went by and another guy came over that I've never seen before. He asked Victor if he had some weed. Victor told him no, but that he was about to get some. He told the guy to give him his money and he would bring it to him when he got it. At this point, I could see what was going on, but I don't smoke or sell weed, so I wasn't concerned with what he was doing. I was just ready to go. 

Since Victor was still using his phone and there was no way it was charging, I told him again I had to go. He said okay and then he came with me, along with Gene and Jeremy. Everything looked normal. Gene and Jeremy had Nike sports bags on their backs with what I thought was clothes in them because I heard them say they had stayed over the night before. 

As we were walking to the store, Victor was still calling people trying to get weed. He either called Will back or Will called him and Victor asked if Will knew someone else that he could get some weed from Will texted him someone's number, but when this happened I didn't know it. 

Victor told me Will found a ride and would meet him in front of my apartment complex. He didn't really say anything else about weed after that. Victor was on the phone with some female I didn't know. We made it to the store and on the way back Victor told me that the female was going to come pick them up. Gene was on the phone as well on the way back but I don't know him, so I wasn't walking close enough to know what he was talking about, nor do I remember him saying anything about weed. 

I remember Gene talking about going to some girl's house and Jeremy saying he had to get home because his dad was mean and he didn't want to get in trouble. Victor told me after Will met him in front of my apartment that the girl was going to pick them up from there, too. 

As we were walking into the entrance of the complex, Willy pulled up. I know Willy from school six years before. We lived in the same apartment complex -- the same place that I lied with Will in student housing. Will knew Willy as well. 

Originally when Willy pulled up, I thought he saw me walking and was stopping to say hello. I walked up to the car where Willy was sitting in the passenger seat. I didn't know the driver. Willy and I talked for a minute, just catching up, because it had been a while since we had seen each other. After or quick catch up, Willy asked me if I called him for some weed. I told him no, that I don't smoke anymore. I stopped about a year and a half ago for a better job. 

He then told me someone had called him from the complex and I told him it wasn't me. I didn't even have his number anymore. He said okay and I told him I had to get home to get the pizza. I walked back to the sidewalk and told Victor I would see him later and I walked in the gate and went to my apartment. As I was walking away I saw Victor walk up to Willy's car, but I don't know what was said. Then I saw Gene and Jeremy get in the backseat.

Victor ran up to me after I was in the gate. He was still on the phone. When we reached the first building and parking lot, Victor stopped and I kept walking home. I didn't introduce Willy and Victor or anyone else. I didn't tell Willy that Victor was looking for weed because Victor said Will was coming. And that's the same reason I didn't tell Victor that Willy sold. I wasn't thinking about it. I was just trying to get home to get the pizza because I didn't know if Phalecia had made it home yet.

I walked past my neighbor, Karl, on the way to the apartment and I told him I needed to talk to him. At the the time, he was on the way to the dumpster. I told him I would come by his apartment after I ate.

When I got home, Phalecia was there and she had the pizza already. I went to the bathroom and then I went to get a plate of pizza. We ate together in the living room while watching TV. The show was Criminal Minds and I know this because at that time of night, we watched this show almost every night. When a commercial came on I went to take the plate in the kitchen and she went to the bathroom.

Victor, Gene, and Jeremy were knocking on the door. I opened it and Victor asked me if I could let his friend use the bathroom. I led Jeremy to Veronica's bathroom and I stayed in Veronica's room while he was in there. While I was in the room waiting for Jeremy, I heard Victor in the kitchen and I saw Gene standing in the middle of the room, changing his shoes and his shirt. 

Gene put on some new shoes and a nice shirt. I was thinking he was getting ready to go to the girls house he had been talking about earlier. I also heard Victor and Gene talking, but it was hard to make out what was being said over the TV. But I remember feeling funny because it was like they were whispering or something. I figured it had nothing to do with me, so I ignored it. 

When Jeremy came out of the bathroom, Victor asked me if I had some sandwich bags and I told him where they were. He grabbed a few bags. On the table there were three phones, two black phones and one red. Gene put all of them in his back pack. Victor had his phone plugged in the wall and it rang as they were standing there. He answered it and told the girl that was coming to get them to meet them at the mail box. 

I sat back own on the couch and got back into the show. Victor told me they were about to go. I said okay and that I was about to head out, too. I was going to go upstairs to talk to Karl. I went to grab Phalecia's phone and they left. I told her I would call her when I got to the grocery store.

Victor, Gene, and Jeremy were at my apartment for ten minutes or less. They didn't give me anything, nor did I take anything from them and they didn't tell me what they had done, nor did they act funny other than Victor and Gene whispering. I didn't see how much weed they had, nor did I see a gun. I did not become aware that they had a gun until later.

When I walked outside, they were gone. Karl was standing in the parking lot. I asked him if he could give me a ride to the grocery store and he said yes. As we were standing there a lot of cops came driving fast past us and drove back out of the parking lot the way they came in. Karl and I were wondering what was going on, so we walked the way the cops went to see. The street was roped off, making everyone come park in our building's parking lot.

As we were standing there, other neighbors were talking about what happened. They were saying someone was shot and car jacked by some black dudes. Others were saying it was a drug deal gone bad. Karl and I spoke to a cop and he told us it looked like a drug deal gone bad, so we said okay.

Phalecia called her cell phone that I had from an unsaved number. The first time she called, I didn't answer, but when she called back, I picked it up. She told me Victor, Gene, and Jeremy were back at the apartment and she wasn't letting them in. I walked home to find Victor, Gene and Jeremy outside the door. I asked Victor what happened, as I was opening the door and his phone rang. It was his ride. She was waiting for him, so I locked the door back without opening it and walked with them to the car. 

I walked back over to Karl and that's when I heard all the different stories from the neighbors. When Victor left, I knew he had to drive through the area that was roped off, so out of concern I called him to make sure they didn't have any problems leaving. I don't remember how the phone call went, but I know called him on his phone and he didn't pick up, so I called the number Phalecia called me from when they were at the apartment. Victor picked up.

I asked if everything was okay. He said yes. I asked if he saw what happened when he went outside coming to the apartment. He said no and that he had to go and then he hung up. I told Karl that I thought I knew who did this. He told me not to say anything for a number of reasons. 

This was the story I told the police at our first encounter, but the truth is, when Gene and Victor were whispering in my apartment while I was in Veronica's bedroom, I did hear them. I heard Victor ask Gene why he shot them and took their stuff and Gene said because they didn't need it. At that point I was scared for my life and Phalecia's life. I didn't know how bad it was, but I knew something happened and I didn't want to let them know that I knew because, like I said, they were whispering so that I couldn't hear them and I knew I was the only one that knew they were with Willy. 

When I told Karl what I heard and what I thought happened, he asked me if I knew their names. At the time, I didn't. The only person's name I knew was Victor and I only knew his first name. I didn't even know Willy's full name at that point. All I could think of was that they knew were I lived and I knew nothing about them. I figured if I said anything to the police, they would know it was me, since I was the only one who knew they were with Willy, and they would come to kill me and Phalecia, or send someone else to do it.

I really called Victor when they left, not out of concern, but to make him think I didn't know what they did, so he wouldn't come after me. I called Will to ask him if me and Phalecia could come stay with him for a little while. I told Will what happened, thinking that he gave Victor Willy's number, but I found out later that he didn't. It was someone else's number. 

I wanted to leave that night, but Karl told me not panic and that they wouldn't be back. Mentally, though, I was still panicking. I had never been around something like that to know what would happen next or what to do. I wanted to do whatever I could to help Willy, but at the same time, I was thinking about the lives of Veronica, Phalecia, and me. I called my best friend, Donald, but he told me to call him back, so I called my brother in Texas, Bernard, and told him what happened.

I let him know if something were to happen to me or Phalecia, that Veronica's boyfriend Victor would be behind it. And he also told me to stay out of it. Two days later I walked to the store and on the way back I stopped by Mike's apartment to make sure Victor thought I didn't know anything. 

I asked him if he heard about what happened that night. He said no and asked me what happened. I told him the neighbors said someone was shot. He then changed the subject and asked me if his probation officer called me. I asked why they would be calling me. I didn't even know he was on probation. Then he said if they didn't call, not to worry about it. I said okay and then I left because I was meeting up with Phalecia at the bus stop to walk home with her. 

I was trying to be as safe as I could because I didn't know what Victor and his friends were thinking, but I tried to stay friendly so he wouldn't think I was acting suspicious. In my first encounters with the police, I told the cops that I went over there to get some weed from him for a friend, so I wouldn't have to tell them I knew what he did up until that point. Then I told the cops I knew Victor had something to do with it when he asked me about his probation officer.

When I got to the bus stop, I told Phalecia we needed to stay away from him. We thought about reaching out to Willy to assure him that I had nothing to do with it and let him know that I was just walking from the store with them, but we also didn't want to make him think I had something to do with it. Willy had known me for six or seven years and we never had a problem with each other. He knows that I'm not the type of person to be in anything like this. I don't live my life like that at all and I don't hang with people that do, knowingly. That was Monday.

Two days later, Phalecia and I were sitting on the bed and saw about four cops with dogs in the woods outside our bedroom window. They were so close we could hear what they were saying. At first we were thinking they were just checking because of what happened over the weekend, but as we sat there we saw them pull the cell phones out of the woods that Victor and Gene had on the table when they came over, two black, one red. Then we heard the cops say my name and that's when we started panicking. 

Phalecia told me to go to check the bathroom Jeremy had been in. The trash and everything just to make sure nothing was in the house where they had been. She told me right then that Victor had to be framing me because he is the only person that knew my name and he had those phones when he came over that Saturday. Why else would the cops search there when the incident took place two buildings before ours?

I listened to what she was saying and it made good sense, so I got mad and called Victor and asked him why the cops were outside my window with the phones I saw them with and saying my name like I was a suspect. Victor told me it was okay, that I wasn't in trouble. He just told the police that they came to my apartment after they got the weed. I asked him why he would say anything about me at all. He came there because it was his girlfriend's apartment and his friend needed to use the bathroom. I hung up on him.

At that point I was scared and going crazy. I didn't know what to do. I wanted to go outside and tell the cops, but I knew if I did Victor would come shoot the apartment up. Then, on the other hand, I didn't know what the cops were going to do. I just knew they called me a suspect.

I called Donald, my best friend, he works with cops and has cop friends and his neighbor is a friend of ours and a cop, so I was hoping he could get some help but no one was home at the time. Donald asked me what Victor said and I told him. He told me to call him back to make sure he didn't try to set me up. So I did. I called Victor back on three way with Donald on the phone and I asked him what all he said to the police about me.

Victor told me that he told the police that I told him to call Will and they came to my apartment. He also told them what he needed to get off probation. I hung up on him again. Donald told me it wasn't against the law to tell someone to call someone and if they did something without me being there or knowing about it then I had nothing to worry about. If Victor and his friends were framing me, they would have to prove what was being said.

Donald then told me I had nothing to worry about and I should talk to the cops so they don't think I have something to hide, so I said okay. On Thursday, the cops called Phalecia's phone while she was at work and asked her a few questions. She told them I was home when they came over on Saturday, but the cops didn't keep her conversation on record, so it's like that never happened. 

When she came home I called the cop. He asked me where I lived and I told him. He asked me if I would come speak with him to ID some photos. I agreed. I was cooking, so I asked him if it was okay if I came when I was done. He agreed. The cop then called me back about thirty minutes later and asked if I was still coming. I told him that I would me there in fifteen minutes, and I was.

When I got there we shook hands and he put me in hand cuffs, emptied my pockets, read me my rights, took me in a room, and asked me if I knew the people on the photos. It was Victor and Gene. I told him Victor was my roommate's boyfriend and Gene was his friend, but I didn't know him or his name. I met him Saturday night and we didn't really talk to each other. 

I asked him if I was under arrest and he said we would get to that after I told him what happened. I told him the story without telling him I heard them talking and without telling him why I went to Victor's on Monday. I told the cop a story that I assumed would keep me, my family, and Phalecia safe, but at the same time, let him know that I saw them with Willy.

I never accused Victor, Gene, and Jeremy of anything because I didn't see it with my own eyes, nor did I want the cops to use me by making them think that it was my fault they were in jail or being pursued. That's why I told the cop the story the way I did. I wanted to help Willy but be safe at the same time. I really told him a lot of assumptions other than what I saw. 

The cop tried to put words in my mouth about making the phone call to set the drug deal up, but I told him that I didn't call anyone but my girl. I don't smoke or sell, so I wasn't calling anyone for weed. The cop sensed me shutting down, so he went to get a recording of him talking on the phone with Victor and he played it.

Victor told the officer that we were together all day trying to rob people so he could get money to pay his rent, that some guy owed him money and we were going to rob him as well. He told the cop that I called Will and set the drug deal up, that I was there when they robbed Willy and when the gun went off we said to each other 'I hope he didn't shoot them', before I took off running. Then he said I let them hide in my apartment where I gave him a bucket of water to put the phones in. Then he said I gave him a shoe box to put the gun in. He told the cop that I took the phones and put them in the woods and he gave me some of the weed he took. He went on to say that I told him to put the gun in a lake in my so called shoe box. 

I broke down and told the cop that he was framing me and all of that was a lie and that I could prove it but the cop didn't care. After that phone call between Victor and the cop, Victor called back 15 minutes later and told the cop he was lying and that I didn't know about what happened. The cop said he was lying and trying to save me because I was scared. 

I had all types of proof when this first happened, but I sat in the county jail without any help or a lawyer for seven to eight months. My first time in court Phalecia came and told them I was being framed and she had a text from Victor to prove it. He texted her telling me to just 'go tell them the truth and I should be fine.' That was five days after he called the cops and framed me. But because it was my first appearance in court, they said there was nothing they could do and I had to wait to go before the judge.

I went to court a number of times before I went in front of a judge, but one of the trips to the courthouse I was on the bus with Gene and he told me what he did and that they were going to rob me. That's why Victor told me he was having a barbeque. It was to get me out of the house. Gene and Jeremy were supposed to go rob the apartment, but their ride didn't come to take them. 

He also told me how the story they were going to tell about what happened was to set me up because Victor knew I had a clean record and thought they would never prosecute me. Now the bus has a camera on it and he said everything out loud so everyone could hear him. It was like he was bragging about it. At this point that tape may not even exist anymore. I don't know. I don't know how to retrieve it for evidence. He didn't like what Victor was doing to me and he said he would tell his public defender what was going on. 

On this bus, there was a guy that was in the same dorm as me, named  Glen. He heard everything that Gene said and Glen wrote a statement and gave it to me when we got back to the jail, letting it be known that he heard the murderer say I knew nothing and was being framed. 

On the way back from the court house, I was with Willy on the bus and in the holding cell. Glen was there as well. He heard Willy tell me he knew I had nothing to do with it and he watched me go home. Willy also told me he would do whatever to help me because he knows I didn't call him and I wouldn't do anything like that. 

After this, I told my mom to call the DA and have him come talk to me, but she was advised not to do that. When Victor got locked up he put a hit out on me through his gang, and I know this because the person he told ended up in a holding cell with me at the court house and I prayed for him before he went to court.

He asked me what happened and I told him and he said he could tell I didn't belong there. He told me Victor put a hit out on me through him and he was going to try to call it off, but that Victor knew how the system works and he knew he could help himself by putting me in it. Apparently he did it before to someone else to get off his last case. The guy told me Victor thought I was going to run to the cops when I figured out what he did, so he told the cops a story first so they wouldn't listen to me. He said Victor knew I was lame and didn't know anything about anything, so I was easy to frame. 

I had a roommate that came from Victor's dorm for one  day and we got to talking about our cases. He told me that he had just left Victor's dorm and that he talks about me and Phalecia all the time. This man I had never seen before told me my case and that I was being framed because Victor felt like I was stupid. He said I was always at work while Phalecia was at home doing whatever and Victor was trying to take her from me. He said Phalecia's name, and that's how I knew he was telling the truth. I don't talk about her to anyone.

When I finally went in front of the judge, I had a court lawyer that talked to me for five minutes before we went in. I told her what I could in that time. When the cop took the stand he said what Victor told him over the phone. He also said that Willy told him I didn't call him -- that the person who robbed him was the person who called him. Willy told them I was not there at all and I didn't even know he was called. The cop said he was waiting for finger prints and phone records to link me to anything, but at that time all he had was what Victor said and the fact that Gene's phone called Phalecia's phone and vice versa. It was the unsaved number Phalecia called me from when they came back to the house and she didn't let them in.

It also came out that she didn't let them in because it was just Gene and Jeremy standing there and we don't know them. At that time Victor was putting the phones in the woods. But the cop didn't say that part or the part about how the shoe box was a female shoe box. He also didn't say how there were ten eye witnesses and none of them said anything about me. 

There was a man sitting in his car in the parking space right next to them, watching the whole thing, plus, some people on their balconies looking over the whole parking lot. The cop had no evidence on me at all, but Victor's lies. My public defender made it very clear that I was not a criminal based off my record.

Everyone was denied bond because of their records. When they got to me they saw I had no record, then the man on the side with the laptop, who I think became the prosecutor on the case, said nothing was showing up but one screen was locked. So my court attorney asked me if I ever had any charges. I told her I got a ticket five years ago for driving without a license. She smiled and told the judge I never had any criminal charges. The judge denied bond for no reason. She told me she would give me one in two weeks when we came back to see her, but that never happened.

Next, they got the finger prints back and mine were not on anything. The phone calls were how I said they were. They tried to indict me alone, but they didn't have any evidence and they were turned down. So they indicted me with everyone else and gave me nineteen charges: murder, seven counts of felony murder, hijacking a motor vehicle, two counts of armed robbery, two counts aggravated assault with a deadly weapon, criminal attempt to commit violation of Georgia controlled substances act, conspiracy to commit violation of the Georgia controlled substances act, two counts of possession of a firearm during commission of a felony, possession of a firearm by first offender probationer, and tampering with evidence.

When I did get a public defender in November, he told me they were able to do that because I knew Victor and Willy were together. His name was Mr. Farmer, but I had another public defender before Mr. Farmer for two weeks. I called him on the jail phones and he told me to try to get statements from my co-defendants to prove my innocence. I knew if I did that, he couldn't use it, so I called my mom and told her was I was told to do. The next week I was assigned to the director, Mr. Francis.

When I spoke with Mr. Francis, I could tell something funny was going on, but I didn't know what. He told me they had nothing and that's all he really said. After that he just kept telling me don't talk on the phones and he told my mom not to talk to me on the phone. 

I went to a bond hearing with him and he didn't really fight to get me a bond at all and he knew I was innocent. Back then I didn't realize what was going on, but now I know they were listening to my phone calls between me and my mom. The DA on my case was crooked and Mr. Farmer told me as much. The DA knew I wouldn't go to trial because Mr. Farmer told me they can give me a life sentence with no proof and no evidence -- they do whatever they want. I told my mom everything he said to me over those phones and they rail-roaded me with it.

Mr. Farmer told me the DA said he had no evidence on me and didn't want to give me a life sentence, but if I went to trial he would make me look guilty by association and that is illegal, but he could do it. Mr. Farmer didn't know why they were doing this to me, but I did. They knew me and my mom would fight this to the end. 

So Mr. Farmer started trying to get proof to prove my innocence and he did. He talked to Will and found out that Victor was the person that called him. I took a drug test two days before April 14. He was able to get that to prove that I don't smoke. Phalecia was going to testify to the fact that none of the thing Victor said happened in the apartment happened. Donald was going to testify as well. Karl was willing to help, but didn't remember everything, so Mr. Farmer said we couldn't use him. He got the statement from Glen and he talked to him and he said him being an outside witness couldn't help. He never tried to get the recording from the jail. He did talk to Victor and he lied about something different every time. Mr. Farm realized Victor didn't remember his lies. He also talked to Willy and he told Mr. Farmer he would help me, but the DA gave him a five year plea to testify against me and he said okay, after already giving three statements saying I had nothing to do with it.

I didn't see the tape, but Mr. Farmer said it is clear to see that his lawyer and the DA made him do it, or he was looking at life. At this point they had lies from Victor and now Willy, which could have been proven without trial. But Mr. Farmer didn't file the motions to discredit them, which would have been easy because they both gave more than one statement. He couldn't talk to Gene because he didn't take a plea yet.

The week before I went to court, Mr. Farmer told me that the DA was offering ten years. I told him no way. I had nothing to do with it and that's just not fair. I understood they were going to make me take some type of charge, because if they didn't they knew my mom was going to sue them for what they did. We also talked about that over the phone. Mr. Farmer said he was going to try to get me five years, which I still didn't understand. But he told me I would only do 18 months. When Mr. Farmer came back, he said fifteen years -- five in jail with time served. I asked him was there a way I could talk to the judge before I did this to get my side out and let them hear the truth and what was being done. He said yes.

I told my mom this over the phone as well. I told her I felt like Mr. Farmer was trying to take me to trial because he didn't like the prosecutor. When I went to court, I thought I was going to talk to the judge, but when I got there Mr. Farmer told me he wasn't in the best of moods and the DA told him if I tried to talk to the judge he would take the plea off the table. Mr. Farmer went on to say that he was sorry and didn't know why they were doing me this way. He asked me if I was a citizen and if he did a good job. He also asked me if I wanted to pick a jury and I told him no. 

I asked if there was anything else I could do and he told me no. Then he had me sign the plea paper and we went in the court room. I took a best interest plea, letting the court know that I was not guilty of any of the charges and that I was being framed by mo co-defendant. The prosecutor told the judge lies and statements that he had Willy take a plea on to make me look guilty. The judge gave me first offenders and fifteen years. 

Now at the time, I didn't know there was a difference between fifteen, do five and fifteen. I thought the judge was saying the overall sentence and the jail took care of the rest. Mr. Farmer made me think I understood what was going on, and I thought I did, but he misinformed me about a lot of things.

First was the plea, Mr. Farmer told me fifteen, do five, not fifteen. I would have never signed the plea for fifteen years, knowing that I had nothing to do with what happened. I signed my life away for nothing. Another thing he told me was it would be easy for me to get legal help after I take the plea and appeal it, but he never told me my appeal options or the time span I had to do it in.

I have my transcript from that court date and Mr. Farmer never said anything to the judge about me talking with him, nor did he say anything to the DA. I tried to reach Mr. Farmer via phone and mail after that court date and I have still not received a reply from the multiple attempts my family and I have made to reach him.

Two weeks after that court date I retained a private attorney by the name of Mr. Williams. Mr. Williams came to see me after my mom and Donald paid him and sent him my discovery pack. I told him what happened and he seemed like he was going to help me, but the thing was, he was Willy's lawyer on that case. After I told him the story, he told me that he was his lawyer and I told him that he must know what I'm talking about then. I asked him why did Willy lie on me and he told me it was because he advised him to. At the same time, Mr. Williams told me that Willy told him I had nothing to do with it. If I used his help, he would not be able to make Willy contradict himself because that would be a conflict of interest. 

The next time he came to see me he told me he called the BAR and they said he would not be able to help. So he tried to tell me he would turn the case over to a friend of his for five thousand more. I said okay and he left. He never gave my money back. 

When I got to Jackson, I was there with Gene. He told me that he told his lawyer, but his lawyer was not trying to help him at all. He also told me had no problem telling the truth to help me. He told some random people that I was framed while we were at Jackson and I still talk to one guy. He is willing to help me as well.

When I went to the counselor at Jackson, she told me I was close security because of my charge and my sentence. She told me I had a murder charge and 25 years. I told her that was wrong. She told me to write her and she would look into it, so that's what I did. She didn't fix anything.  I also wrote the head counselor and told him what was going on. And no one did anything. So I was sent to the worst prison in Georgia.

When I got to Hays State Prison, I talked to a counselor that told me I shouldn't be here. The counselor at Jackson was supposed to fix my paperwork, but she was being lazy, so it got fixed here. 

My first day here, I overheard some guys saying they were going to get me and Gene, so I went into PC to be on the safe side. I had someone check for me to see if Gene was here and he was, so I've stayed in PC so I don't get killed. I didn't know anyone but the people I met along the way. I tend to stay to myself in my cell.

I'm on 24 hour lockdown, but I'm safe. It's a hard situation to deal with knowing that life will never be back the way it was, but so far God has been holding my hand and I pray he doesn't let go."


Thank you for your time and your donations. 

For more information, please email chelsearmetcalf@gmail.com.
story_txt: James was framed for murder, tried and convicted as murderer, and is currently in the worst prison in Georgia, despite the fact that there is no evidence against him except for two statements that should have been thrown out, as they are proven to be lies. In his dealings with the justice system, he found nothing but injustice. His only chance to receive justice is to appeal his case. This is a costly expense, however, when murder is involved. We need your help obtaining an appellate attorney so that James can get the trial he deserves. He is innocent of the crime for which he has been charged. The attorneys we have spoken with are asking for $25K up front and potentially additional charges.Whatever you can spare, we will be more than grateful for. Please donate and share even if you can't donate. Everything counts. This is James's account of the incident and the proceedings thereafter:"This is a detailed recap of the events which place on April 14, 2012 (ultimately resulting in my arrest) to date in reference to the criminal case. I certify and attest all statements are true and acurate to the best of my knowledge.On the evening of April 14, 2012, I was invited by Victor Scott to his apartment for a barbeque. Vick, at this time, resided with a guy named Mike. I only know Vick because he recently dated my roommate, Veronica. Vick was often at my apartment, so frequently that he basically lived with us. A week prior to the events mentioned here, Vick and Veronica ended their relationship. As a result, Vick moved in with Mike.Upon arriving at Mike and Vick's apartment, I encountered a total of five individuals: Mike, his wife, Vick and two guys I did not know (I found later to be named Gene and Jeremy). I asked Vick about the barbeque and he stated that he never told me about a barbeque. Gene and the other guy laughed as if an inside joke existed. Realizing the barbeque was not going to take place, I asked Vick if I could borrow his phone to call Phalecia, since mine was off. He said yes and I called her, asking her to order pizza because Victor was not having a barbeque. She was upset because I should have gone to the store, rather than being lazy, and now we had to waste money on pizza.She told me to make sure I was back at the apartment when the pizza arrived because she was on her way home from work (via public transportation) and didn't know if she would be there in time. After hanging up and giving Victor his phone back he asked me if I knew anyone with some weed. I told him 'not really, only Will.'Will is a mutual friend of mine and Victor and is actually the person that introduced Victor to Veronica. Will was my roommate in college. That's how we met and we have been friends ever since. Victor called him and asked him if he had some weed and Will told him yes, but he didn't know if he could get a ride to bring it to Victor, so he would have to call him back and let him know. While Victor waited, he was calling other people because Will is known for standing people up. While victor was calling other people, Phalecia called back to tell me she ordered the pizza and to head home. I gave Victor his phone back and told him I was leaving. I still needed to walk to the store and make it home to get the pizza. Victor asked me if I would wait for him. He wanted to walk with me but wanted to let his phone charge up a bit. I agreed.While we were waiting, he started asking me about Veronica and if she was talking about him since he had been gone. I told him I hadn't really talked to her. He asked if I thought she would talk to him and I said yes. So he started calling her while his phone was plugged in. A few minutes went by and another guy came over that I've never seen before. He asked Victor if he had some weed. Victor told him no, but that he was about to get some. He told the guy to give him his money and he would bring it to him when he got it. At this point, I could see what was going on, but I don't smoke or sell weed, so I wasn't concerned with what he was doing. I was just ready to go. Since Victor was still using his phone and there was no way it was charging, I told him again I had to go. He said okay and then he came with me, along with Gene and Jeremy. Everything looked normal. Gene and Jeremy had Nike sports bags on their backs with what I thought was clothes in them because I heard them say they had stayed over the night before. As we were walking to the store, Victor was still calling people trying to get weed. He either called Will back or Will called him and Victor asked if Will knew someone else that he could get some weed from Will texted him someone's number, but when this happened I didn't know it. Victor told me Will found a ride and would meet him in front of my apartment complex. He didn't really say anything else about weed after that. Victor was on the phone with some female I didn't know. We made it to the store and on the way back Victor told me that the female was going to come pick them up. Gene was on the phone as well on the way back but I don't know him, so I wasn't walking close enough to know what he was talking about, nor do I remember him saying anything about weed. I remember Gene talking about going to some girl's house and Jeremy saying he had to get home because his dad was mean and he didn't want to get in trouble. Victor told me after Will met him in front of my apartment that the girl was going to pick them up from there, too. As we were walking into the entrance of the complex, Willy pulled up. I know Willy from school six years before. We lived in the same apartment complex -- the same place that I lied with Will in student housing. Will knew Willy as well. Originally when Willy pulled up, I thought he saw me walking and was stopping to say hello. I walked up to the car where Willy was sitting in the passenger seat. I didn't know the driver. Willy and I talked for a minute, just catching up, because it had been a while since we had seen each other. After or quick catch up, Willy asked me if I called him for some weed. I told him no, that I don't smoke anymore. I stopped about a year and a half ago for a better job. He then told me someone had called him from the complex and I told him it wasn't me. I didn't even have his number anymore. He said okay and I told him I had to get home to get the pizza. I walked back to the sidewalk and told Victor I would see him later and I walked in the gate and went to my apartment. As I was walking away I saw Victor walk up to Willy's car, but I don't know what was said. Then I saw Gene and Jeremy get in the backseat.Victor ran up to me after I was in the gate. He was still on the phone. When we reached the first building and parking lot, Victor stopped and I kept walking home. I didn't introduce Willy and Victor or anyone else. I didn't tell Willy that Victor was looking for weed because Victor said Will was coming. And that's the same reason I didn't tell Victor that Willy sold. I wasn't thinking about it. I was just trying to get home to get the pizza because I didn't know if Phalecia had made it home yet.I walked past my neighbor, Karl, on the way to the apartment and I told him I needed to talk to him. At the the time, he was on the way to the dumpster. I told him I would come by his apartment after I ate.When I got home, Phalecia was there and she had the pizza already. I went to the bathroom and then I went to get a plate of pizza. We ate together in the living room while watching TV. The show was Criminal Minds and I know this because at that time of night, we watched this show almost every night. When a commercial came on I went to take the plate in the kitchen and she went to the bathroom.Victor, Gene, and Jeremy were knocking on the door. I opened it and Victor asked me if I could let his friend use the bathroom. I led Jeremy to Veronica's bathroom and I stayed in Veronica's room while he was in there. While I was in the room waiting for Jeremy, I heard Victor in the kitchen and I saw Gene standing in the middle of the room, changing his shoes and his shirt. Gene put on some new shoes and a nice shirt. I was thinking he was getting ready to go to the girls house he had been talking about earlier. I also heard Victor and Gene talking, but it was hard to make out what was being said over the TV. But I remember feeling funny because it was like they were whispering or something. I figured it had nothing to do with me, so I ignored it. When Jeremy came out of the bathroom, Victor asked me if I had some sandwich bags and I told him where they were. He grabbed a few bags. On the table there were three phones, two black phones and one red. Gene put all of them in his back pack. Victor had his phone plugged in the wall and it rang as they were standing there. He answered it and told the girl that was coming to get them to meet them at the mail box. I sat back own on the couch and got back into the show. Victor told me they were about to go. I said okay and that I was about to head out, too. I was going to go upstairs to talk to Karl. I went to grab Phalecia's phone and they left. I told her I would call her when I got to the grocery store.Victor, Gene, and Jeremy were at my apartment for ten minutes or less. They didn't give me anything, nor did I take anything from them and they didn't tell me what they had done, nor did they act funny other than Victor and Gene whispering. I didn't see how much weed they had, nor did I see a gun. I did not become aware that they had a gun until later.When I walked outside, they were gone. Karl was standing in the parking lot. I asked him if he could give me a ride to the grocery store and he said yes. As we were standing there a lot of cops came driving fast past us and drove back out of the parking lot the way they came in. Karl and I were wondering what was going on, so we walked the way the cops went to see. The street was roped off, making everyone come park in our building's parking lot.As we were standing there, other neighbors were talking about what happened. They were saying someone was shot and car jacked by some black dudes. Others were saying it was a drug deal gone bad. Karl and I spoke to a cop and he told us it looked like a drug deal gone bad, so we said okay.Phalecia called her cell phone that I had from an unsaved number. The first time she called, I didn't answer, but when she called back, I picked it up. She told me Victor, Gene, and Jeremy were back at the apartment and she wasn't letting them in. I walked home to find Victor, Gene and Jeremy outside the door. I asked Victor what happened, as I was opening the door and his phone rang. It was his ride. She was waiting for him, so I locked the door back without opening it and walked with them to the car. I walked back over to Karl and that's when I heard all the different stories from the neighbors. When Victor left, I knew he had to drive through the area that was roped off, so out of concern I called him to make sure they didn't have any problems leaving. I don't remember how the phone call went, but I know called him on his phone and he didn't pick up, so I called the number Phalecia called me from when they were at the apartment. Victor picked up.I asked if everything was okay. He said yes. I asked if he saw what happened when he went outside coming to the apartment. He said no and that he had to go and then he hung up. I told Karl that I thought I knew who did this. He told me not to say anything for a number of reasons. This was the story I told the police at our first encounter, but the truth is, when Gene and Victor were whispering in my apartment while I was in Veronica's bedroom, I did hear them. I heard Victor ask Gene why he shot them and took their stuff and Gene said because they didn't need it. At that point I was scared for my life and Phalecia's life. I didn't know how bad it was, but I knew something happened and I didn't want to let them know that I knew because, like I said, they were whispering so that I couldn't hear them and I knew I was the only one that knew they were with Willy. When I told Karl what I heard and what I thought happened, he asked me if I knew their names. At the time, I didn't. The only person's name I knew was Victor and I only knew his first name. I didn't even know Willy's full name at that point. All I could think of was that they knew were I lived and I knew nothing about them. I figured if I said anything to the police, they would know it was me, since I was the only one who knew they were with Willy, and they would come to kill me and Phalecia, or send someone else to do it.I really called Victor when they left, not out of concern, but to make him think I didn't know what they did, so he wouldn't come after me. I called Will to ask him if me and Phalecia could come stay with him for a little while. I told Will what happened, thinking that he gave Victor Willy's number, but I found out later that he didn't. It was someone else's number. I wanted to leave that night, but Karl told me not panic and that they wouldn't be back. Mentally, though, I was still panicking. I had never been around something like that to know what would happen next or what to do. I wanted to do whatever I could to help Willy, but at the same time, I was thinking about the lives of Veronica, Phalecia, and me. I called my best friend, Donald, but he told me to call him back, so I called my brother in Texas, Bernard, and told him what happened.I let him know if something were to happen to me or Phalecia, that Veronica's boyfriend Victor would be behind it. And he also told me to stay out of it. Two days later I walked to the store and on the way back I stopped by Mike's apartment to make sure Victor thought I didn't know anything. I asked him if he heard about what happened that night. He said no and asked me what happened. I told him the neighbors said someone was shot. He then changed the subject and asked me if his probation officer called me. I asked why they would be calling me. I didn't even know he was on probation. Then he said if they didn't call, not to worry about it. I said okay and then I left because I was meeting up with Phalecia at the bus stop to walk home with her. I was trying to be as safe as I could because I didn't know what Victor and his friends were thinking, but I tried to stay friendly so he wouldn't think I was acting suspicious. In my first encounters with the police, I told the cops that I went over there to get some weed from him for a friend, so I wouldn't have to tell them I knew what he did up until that point. Then I told the cops I knew Victor had something to do with it when he asked me about his probation officer.When I got to the bus stop, I told Phalecia we needed to stay away from him. We thought about reaching out to Willy to assure him that I had nothing to do with it and let him know that I was just walking from the store with them, but we also didn't want to make him think I had something to do with it. Willy had known me for six or seven years and we never had a problem with each other. He knows that I'm not the type of person to be in anything like this. I don't live my life like that at all and I don't hang with people that do, knowingly. That was Monday.Two days later, Phalecia and I were sitting on the bed and saw about four cops with dogs in the woods outside our bedroom window. They were so close we could hear what they were saying. At first we were thinking they were just checking because of what happened over the weekend, but as we sat there we saw them pull the cell phones out of the woods that Victor and Gene had on the table when they came over, two black, one red. Then we heard the cops say my name and that's when we started panicking. Phalecia told me to go to check the bathroom Jeremy had been in. The trash and everything just to make sure nothing was in the house where they had been. She told me right then that Victor had to be framing me because he is the only person that knew my name and he had those phones when he came over that Saturday. Why else would the cops search there when the incident took place two buildings before ours?I listened to what she was saying and it made good sense, so I got mad and called Victor and asked him why the cops were outside my window with the phones I saw them with and saying my name like I was a suspect. Victor told me it was okay, that I wasn't in trouble. He just told the police that they came to my apartment after they got the weed. I asked him why he would say anything about me at all. He came there because it was his girlfriend's apartment and his friend needed to use the bathroom. I hung up on him.At that point I was scared and going crazy. I didn't know what to do. I wanted to go outside and tell the cops, but I knew if I did Victor would come shoot the apartment up. Then, on the other hand, I didn't know what the cops were going to do. I just knew they called me a suspect.I called Donald, my best friend, he works with cops and has cop friends and his neighbor is a friend of ours and a cop, so I was hoping he could get some help but no one was home at the time. Donald asked me what Victor said and I told him. He told me to call him back to make sure he didn't try to set me up. So I did. I called Victor back on three way with Donald on the phone and I asked him what all he said to the police about me.Victor told me that he told the police that I told him to call Will and they came to my apartment. He also told them what he needed to get off probation. I hung up on him again. Donald told me it wasn't against the law to tell someone to call someone and if they did something without me being there or knowing about it then I had nothing to worry about. If Victor and his friends were framing me, they would have to prove what was being said.Donald then told me I had nothing to worry about and I should talk to the cops so they don't think I have something to hide, so I said okay. On Thursday, the cops called Phalecia's phone while she was at work and asked her a few questions. She told them I was home when they came over on Saturday, but the cops didn't keep her conversation on record, so it's like that never happened. When she came home I called the cop. He asked me where I lived and I told him. He asked me if I would come speak with him to ID some photos. I agreed. I was cooking, so I asked him if it was okay if I came when I was done. He agreed. The cop then called me back about thirty minutes later and asked if I was still coming. I told him that I would me there in fifteen minutes, and I was.When I got there we shook hands and he put me in hand cuffs, emptied my pockets, read me my rights, took me in a room, and asked me if I knew the people on the photos. It was Victor and Gene. I told him Victor was my roommate's boyfriend and Gene was his friend, but I didn't know him or his name. I met him Saturday night and we didn't really talk to each other. I asked him if I was under arrest and he said we would get to that after I told him what happened. I told him the story without telling him I heard them talking and without telling him why I went to Victor's on Monday. I told the cop a story that I assumed would keep me, my family, and Phalecia safe, but at the same time, let him know that I saw them with Willy.I never accused Victor, Gene, and Jeremy of anything because I didn't see it with my own eyes, nor did I want the cops to use me by making them think that it was my fault they were in jail or being pursued. That's why I told the cop the story the way I did. I wanted to help Willy but be safe at the same time. I really told him a lot of assumptions other than what I saw. The cop tried to put words in my mouth about making the phone call to set the drug deal up, but I told him that I didn't call anyone but my girl. I don't smoke or sell, so I wasn't calling anyone for weed. The cop sensed me shutting down, so he went to get a recording of him talking on the phone with Victor and he played it.Victor told the officer that we were together all day trying to rob people so he could get money to pay his rent, that some guy owed him money and we were going to rob him as well. He told the cop that I called Will and set the drug deal up, that I was there when they robbed Willy and when the gun went off we said to each other 'I hope he didn't shoot them', before I took off running. Then he said I let them hide in my apartment where I gave him a bucket of water to put the phones in. Then he said I gave him a shoe box to put the gun in. He told the cop that I took the phones and put them in the woods and he gave me some of the weed he took. He went on to say that I told him to put the gun in a lake in my so called shoe box. I broke down and told the cop that he was framing me and all of that was a lie and that I could prove it but the cop didn't care. After that phone call between Victor and the cop, Victor called back 15 minutes later and told the cop he was lying and that I didn't know about what happened. The cop said he was lying and trying to save me because I was scared. I had all types of proof when this first happened, but I sat in the county jail without any help or a lawyer for seven to eight months. My first time in court Phalecia came and told them I was being framed and she had a text from Victor to prove it. He texted her telling me to just 'go tell them the truth and I should be fine.' That was five days after he called the cops and framed me. But because it was my first appearance in court, they said there was nothing they could do and I had to wait to go before the judge.I went to court a number of times before I went in front of a judge, but one of the trips to the courthouse I was on the bus with Gene and he told me what he did and that they were going to rob me. That's why Victor told me he was having a barbeque. It was to get me out of the house. Gene and Jeremy were supposed to go rob the apartment, but their ride didn't come to take them. He also told me how the story they were going to tell about what happened was to set me up because Victor knew I had a clean record and thought they would never prosecute me. Now the bus has a camera on it and he said everything out loud so everyone could hear him. It was like he was bragging about it. At this point that tape may not even exist anymore. I don't know. I don't know how to retrieve it for evidence. He didn't like what Victor was doing to me and he said he would tell his public defender what was going on. On this bus, there was a guy that was in the same dorm as me, named  Glen. He heard everything that Gene said and Glen wrote a statement and gave it to me when we got back to the jail, letting it be known that he heard the murderer say I knew nothing and was being framed. On the way back from the court house, I was with Willy on the bus and in the holding cell. Glen was there as well. He heard Willy tell me he knew I had nothing to do with it and he watched me go home. Willy also told me he would do whatever to help me because he knows I didn't call him and I wouldn't do anything like that. After this, I told my mom to call the DA and have him come talk to me, but she was advised not to do that. When Victor got locked up he put a hit out on me through his gang, and I know this because the person he told ended up in a holding cell with me at the court house and I prayed for him before he went to court.He asked me what happened and I told him and he said he could tell I didn't belong there. He told me Victor put a hit out on me through him and he was going to try to call it off, but that Victor knew how the system works and he knew he could help himself by putting me in it. Apparently he did it before to someone else to get off his last case. The guy told me Victor thought I was going to run to the cops when I figured out what he did, so he told the cops a story first so they wouldn't listen to me. He said Victor knew I was lame and didn't know anything about anything, so I was easy to frame. I had a roommate that came from Victor's dorm for one  day and we got to talking about our cases. He told me that he had just left Victor's dorm and that he talks about me and Phalecia all the time. This man I had never seen before told me my case and that I was being framed because Victor felt like I was stupid. He said I was always at work while Phalecia was at home doing whatever and Victor was trying to take her from me. He said Phalecia's name, and that's how I knew he was telling the truth. I don't talk about her to anyone.When I finally went in front of the judge, I had a court lawyer that talked to me for five minutes before we went in. I told her what I could in that time. When the cop took the stand he said what Victor told him over the phone. He also said that Willy told him I didn't call him -- that the person who robbed him was the person who called him. Willy told them I was not there at all and I didn't even know he was called. The cop said he was waiting for finger prints and phone records to link me to anything, but at that time all he had was what Victor said and the fact that Gene's phone called Phalecia's phone and vice versa. It was the unsaved number Phalecia called me from when they came back to the house and she didn't let them in.It also came out that she didn't let them in because it was just Gene and Jeremy standing there and we don't know them. At that time Victor was putting the phones in the woods. But the cop didn't say that part or the part about how the shoe box was a female shoe box. He also didn't say how there were ten eye witnesses and none of them said anything about me. There was a man sitting in his car in the parking space right next to them, watching the whole thing, plus, some people on their balconies looking over the whole parking lot. The cop had no evidence on me at all, but Victor's lies. My public defender made it very clear that I was not a criminal based off my record.Everyone was denied bond because of their records. When they got to me they saw I had no record, then the man on the side with the laptop, who I think became the prosecutor on the case, said nothing was showing up but one screen was locked. So my court attorney asked me if I ever had any charges. I told her I got a ticket five years ago for driving without a license. She smiled and told the judge I never had any criminal charges. The judge denied bond for no reason. She told me she would give me one in two weeks when we came back to see her, but that never happened.Next, they got the finger prints back and mine were not on anything. The phone calls were how I said they were. They tried to indict me alone, but they didn't have any evidence and they were turned down. So they indicted me with everyone else and gave me nineteen charges: murder, seven counts of felony murder, hijacking a motor vehicle, two counts of armed robbery, two counts aggravated assault with a deadly weapon, criminal attempt to commit violation of Georgia controlled substances act, conspiracy to commit violation of the Georgia controlled substances act, two counts of possession of a firearm during commission of a felony, possession of a firearm by first offender probationer, and tampering with evidence.When I did get a public defender in November, he told me they were able to do that because I knew Victor and Willy were together. His name was Mr. Farmer, but I had another public defender before Mr. Farmer for two weeks. I called him on the jail phones and he told me to try to get statements from my co-defendants to prove my innocence. I knew if I did that, he couldn't use it, so I called my mom and told her was I was told to do. The next week I was assigned to the director, Mr. Francis.When I spoke with Mr. Francis, I could tell something funny was going on, but I didn't know what. He told me they had nothing and that's all he really said. After that he just kept telling me don't talk on the phones and he told my mom not to talk to me on the phone. I went to a bond hearing with him and he didn't really fight to get me a bond at all and he knew I was innocent. Back then I didn't realize what was going on, but now I know they were listening to my phone calls between me and my mom. The DA on my case was crooked and Mr. Farmer told me as much. The DA knew I wouldn't go to trial because Mr. Farmer told me they can give me a life sentence with no proof and no evidence -- they do whatever they want. I told my mom everything he said to me over those phones and they rail-roaded me with it.Mr. Farmer told me the DA said he had no evidence on me and didn't want to give me a life sentence, but if I went to trial he would make me look guilty by association and that is illegal, but he could do it. Mr. Farmer didn't know why they were doing this to me, but I did. They knew me and my mom would fight this to the end. So Mr. Farmer started trying to get proof to prove my innocence and he did. He talked to Will and found out that Victor was the person that called him. I took a drug test two days before April 14. He was able to get that to prove that I don't smoke. Phalecia was going to testify to the fact that none of the thing Victor said happened in the apartment happened. Donald was going to testify as well. Karl was willing to help, but didn't remember everything, so Mr. Farmer said we couldn't use him. He got the statement from Glen and he talked to him and he said him being an outside witness couldn't help. He never tried to get the recording from the jail. He did talk to Victor and he lied about something different every time. Mr. Farm realized Victor didn't remember his lies. He also talked to Willy and he told Mr. Farmer he would help me, but the DA gave him a five year plea to testify against me and he said okay, after already giving three statements saying I had nothing to do with it.I didn't see the tape, but Mr. Farmer said it is clear to see that his lawyer and the DA made him do it, or he was looking at life. At this point they had lies from Victor and now Willy, which could have been proven without trial. But Mr. Farmer didn't file the motions to discredit them, which would have been easy because they both gave more than one statement. He couldn't talk to Gene because he didn't take a plea yet.The week before I went to court, Mr. Farmer told me that the DA was offering ten years. I told him no way. I had nothing to do with it and that's just not fair. I understood they were going to make me take some type of charge, because if they didn't they knew my mom was going to sue them for what they did. We also talked about that over the phone. Mr. Farmer said he was going to try to get me five years, which I still didn't understand. But he told me I would only do 18 months. When Mr. Farmer came back, he said fifteen years -- five in jail with time served. I asked him was there a way I could talk to the judge before I did this to get my side out and let them hear the truth and what was being done. He said yes.I told my mom this over the phone as well. I told her I felt like Mr. Farmer was trying to take me to trial because he didn't like the prosecutor. When I went to court, I thought I was going to talk to the judge, but when I got there Mr. Farmer told me he wasn't in the best of moods and the DA told him if I tried to talk to the judge he would take the plea off the table. Mr. Farmer went on to say that he was sorry and didn't know why they were doing me this way. He asked me if I was a citizen and if he did a good job. He also asked me if I wanted to pick a jury and I told him no. I asked if there was anything else I could do and he told me no. Then he had me sign the plea paper and we went in the court room. I took a best interest plea, letting the court know that I was not guilty of any of the charges and that I was being framed by mo co-defendant. The prosecutor told the judge lies and statements that he had Willy take a plea on to make me look guilty. The judge gave me first offenders and fifteen years. Now at the time, I didn't know there was a difference between fifteen, do five and fifteen. I thought the judge was saying the overall sentence and the jail took care of the rest. Mr. Farmer made me think I understood what was going on, and I thought I did, but he misinformed me about a lot of things.First was the plea, Mr. Farmer told me fifteen, do five, not fifteen. I would have never signed the plea for fifteen years, knowing that I had nothing to do with what happened. I signed my life away for nothing. Another thing he told me was it would be easy for me to get legal help after I take the plea and appeal it, but he never told me my appeal options or the time span I had to do it in.I have my transcript from that court date and Mr. Farmer never said anything to the judge about me talking with him, nor did he say anything to the DA. I tried to reach Mr. Farmer via phone and mail after that court date and I have still not received a reply from the multiple attempts my family and I have made to reach him.Two weeks after that court date I retained a private attorney by the name of Mr. Williams. Mr. Williams came to see me after my mom and Donald paid him and sent him my discovery pack. I told him what happened and he seemed like he was going to help me, but the thing was, he was Willy's lawyer on that case. After I told him the story, he told me that he was his lawyer and I told him that he must know what I'm talking about then. I asked him why did Willy lie on me and he told me it was because he advised him to. At the same time, Mr. Williams told me that Willy told him I had nothing to do with it. If I used his help, he would not be able to make Willy contradict himself because that would be a conflict of interest. The next time he came to see me he told me he called the BAR and they said he would not be able to help. So he tried to tell me he would turn the case over to a friend of his for five thousand more. I said okay and he left. He never gave my money back. When I got to Jackson, I was there with Gene. He told me that he told his lawyer, but his lawyer was not trying to help him at all. He also told me had no problem telling the truth to help me. He told some random people that I was framed while we were at Jackson and I still talk to one guy. He is willing to help me as well.When I went to the counselor at Jackson, she told me I was close security because of my charge and my sentence. She told me I had a murder charge and 25 years. I told her that was wrong. She told me to write her and she would look into it, so that's what I did. She didn't fix anything.  I also wrote the head counselor and told him what was going on. And no one did anything. So I was sent to the worst prison in Georgia.When I got to Hays State Prison, I talked to a counselor that told me I shouldn't be here. The counselor at Jackson was supposed to fix my paperwork, but she was being lazy, so it got fixed here. My first day here, I overheard some guys saying they were going to get me and Gene, so I went into PC to be on the safe side. I had someone check for me to see if Gene was here and he was, so I've stayed in PC so I don't get killed. I didn't know anyone but the people I met along the way. I tend to stay to myself in my cell.I'm on 24 hour lockdown, but I'm safe. It's a hard situation to deal with knowing that life will never be back the way it was, but so far God has been holding my hand and I pray he doesn't let go."Thank you for your time and your donations. For more information, please email chelsearmetcalf@gmail.com.

story:
My wish is to contribute with animal welfare and do anything I can to help these vulnerable and innocent animals. I have visited Cat Cafe's up and down the country and witnessed the difference they make. Bringing one to Southampton will continue the help and support these cafe's do by raising awareness for cats in need.

Paws For Thought Cat Café is solely in the interest of the cats; creating awareness, helping local re-homing and rescue centres, providing information on the adoption process, whilst creating a  forever home for our resident cats.

I am personally an owner of a rescue cat who we named Bree.... (not to be confused with the cheese!) She is the most precious little girl who was looking for her forever home after a bad start in life, being kept in a shed as a kitten which broke my heart to hear. I've seen Bree change from being scared and nervous of people, to now being a beautiful affectionate cat that loves nothing more than a tummy tickle and fuss. I want to bring this change and happiness to as many cats as possible and we can do that together by raising the money to open our very own cat cafe in Southampton.

Whats a Cat Cafe?

Its a place where you can come to relax, catch up with friends or just take an hour away from your busy day to enjoy a hot or cold drink and some delicious food whilst being in the company of our beautiful rescue cats. It as simple as that! 

The cafe will be booking only and not a walk in café. This is to ensure control of who is coming in and out of the café at all times for the safety of the cats. However, you're more than welcome to phone the cafe and check for available slots on the day if you are passing by.

A small cover charge for the care and wellbeing of the cats will be included within the bill. Reasonably priced quality food and drinks menu will be available to all guests.

At Paws For Thought we want to bring a Cat Café with a difference. A place to share your stories and show us the cats you have in your lives. As a owner I know how much happiness these kitties can bring but also the pain of losing one, Paws For Thought will offer support on bereavement of pets. We will create a space in the cafe for you to come and share your stories or photos of past and present pets for everyone to see.

What we are asking of you!

Your donation will help us bring this cat café to Southampton, a place to create and promote animal welfare, pet bereavement, re homing and volunteering projects.

Our £25,000 target will create this home/sanctuary for our rescue cats:

We are currently looking for a suitable premises for our cats home and café. Once secured your donations will help us to start our journey to opening the doors to the first cat cafe in Southampton. 

We will keep everyone updated throughout this Campaign from the moment we find our home, throughout the refurbishment, finding and introducing our new resident cats, right through to opening our doors to you.

The £25,000 will help with -

Decorating - the premises will require enough exercise and play equipment for the cats along with high up areas and hiding places for them to escape to if they wish. They will require their own areas for when they don't feel sociable including their cat-care room as well as making a space only they can have individual access to.

Healthcare - All of the cats will require ongoing healthcare including vaccinations, treatments, medications and micro-chipping. We will also require animal behaviourists to work with us in making sure the cats are completely happy and the five freedoms of the Animal Welfare Act 2006 are met in their entirety.

Refurbishing - As well as making the cafe a purrfect place for our resident cats, we need to make a comfy and welcoming place for you to visit. 

A layout that makes it as comfortable for you as well as the cats and this means creating lots of separate areas within the cafe. One of our main concerns is having a place the food and drink can be stored and prepared away from the cats, so your food and drink arrives purrfectly and cat hair free!

We will also need to install air-conditioning, air purifiers, ventilation and temperate control, so the cats and you are comfortable at all times.

What we will do in return for your generosity - 

We are hugely grateful for any donations received and as a thank you for your support, every donator will be named on the cafes personal 'thank you' wall for everyone to see. However, should you wish to donate £25.00 or more we thought of a few extra thank you's to show our appreciation  -

Donation over £25.00

  • Your very own Paws For Thought mug 

Donation over £50.00

  • Paws For Thought mug 
  • A free drink voucher 

Donation over £100.00

  • Paws For Thought T-Shirt  
  • Paws For Thought mug 
  • A free drink voucher 

Other Ways You Can Help - 

If you'd like to help us on our journey in any other way, please get in touch with us at pawsforthoughtcatcafe@outlook.com  We need all kinds of help to make Paws For Thought the purrfect home for our cats. 

Please share our campaign and help spread the word as much as possible online and in conversation and with the help of Indiegogo share tools, it couldn't be easier!

Thank you for bringing Paws For Thought to Southampton!

story:
My newly launched organic candle is a result of not finding a rich chocolate scented candle that was not "musky" or not chocolaty enough. I customized a scent with longtime friend Maria Murphy at Soy Spacasso, who is manufacture of organic home products and skin care. We achieved the most perfect and seductive natural chocolate candle I ever smelled. With 4 years in the talks, the idea materialized late this past summer 2016 to join forces to launch a line of special organic candles. 

As a natural creative I pushed limits and sampled scents for months to achieve the perfect chocolate candle, with the optimal notes of raspberry in beautiful and minimalist eco-friendly container. I am not a fan of strong scents and the perfumes found in many expensive candles, and wanted to develop a collection that was unique and free of those elements, natural and affordable.

CREATIVE No.1 is the first of my new CREATIVE by AR Waters collection, the first of many rich, custom organic aromas created from 100% vegan soy, inspired by natural ingredients you’d find in your kitchen. 

CREATIVE stands out from the rest because each scent is a custom process and  big deal, launching only twice a year, and kept secret until revealed the twice-a-year launch party for each scent. The launch is an expected to be an experience for the 5 senses, an unforgettable introduction; themed visuals are present with food and drink served to be inspired by the scent.

It is now time to get the word out about my latest creative venture, and that’s where you come in! I want everyone to experience CREATIVE No.1 by AR Waters.

By funding CREATIVE No.1 you help with the marketing efforts to kick off the first scent and with holiday production. The perks are excellent, they make for easy gift giving during the holidays and everyone gets rewarded. All backers receive free shipping in the USA for their orders. 

Click here to shop post-campaign
