Innovative application of absolute data security
The file to be saved “breaks down” in three different bit files and it is saved in three different servers located in three different continents with the exact location being kept a secret, since the existence of these servers is known to only two people in the world (people that work with those servers do not know that they work for a data retention company).
It is designed in a way that even if a file ends up in the wrong hands, the access to its content will be impossible.
This way even if the file is delivered after the order of the public prosecutor of a country, this file will not be readable because it will just be a 0-1 sequence with no meaning. 
Even if a file is stolen from a server, it would be totally useless because in order for the file to be readable the two other files are required and these files would be saved in different servers in different unknown continents.
Some features of the application:

Recovery only via e-mail that you confirm.


Notification via e-mail of every activity of your files.


All-out destruction of the files on a specific date or via e-mail notification or in case you do not reply to an automatic e-mail which will be sent  as frequent as you determine.


When starting your subscription, you will receive a full contract which guarantees that these files will not be used for any other purpose but strictly for retention.


This application will be able to connect and function automatically with all the aforementioned applications, providing you with the best concealment and safety of your data.



Amazing  jigsaw puzzle application that is destined to enhance remarkably your patience, persistence, power of observation and organizational  skills, with great features like:



Turn into jigsaw puzzle any photo you choose.


The pieces of the jigsaw puzzle can be adjusted to be from 12 to 108.


Possibility to conceal or show the initial photo during the creation of the puzzle.


Hundreds of pictures (photos and graphics) ready to use divided into categories such as “easy”, “normal” ,“hard”.





A program that will give you the opportunity to test your IQ whenever you like, having also the ability to record your performance.



A magnificent game for you to practice your persistence and patience.
This game may be simple, but it is also addictive, with many levels of difficulty.
 
* All applications run on pc, laptop, tablet and smartphones
** ATTENTION
In all aforementioned cases but especially as far as the website is concerned, subscribers will connect to servers using domain names irrelevant to the main websites.
E.g. let’s assume that the website thedevilsbible.com is the homepage of the website. Once you become subscribers you do not enter in this website but in a website where the domain name will be irrelevant, e.g. www.glm.com or www.123xyz.org or www.NewBiz.com  etc.
This way, no one will be able to relate the name of the website with its content.
Even for the same application for groups of users (e.g. groups of 100) the name will be different.
The user may also have the possibility to choose domain name.




In some thematic sections there is no product order code, how can I order them?


The thematic sections that have no product order code are included
exclusively in the whole package ( "All thematic sections (33)" )  and cannot be acquired otherwise. These
thematic sections are as powerful as weapons and cannot be distributed separately,
because only when combined with the other thematic sections, can they be used safely and
have the desired results.
Is this method
suitable for everyone?
NO, this method is not for everyone, it is given as a
package deal here only for a few days. 
This is why there
will be a questionnaire in the official website  thedevilsbible.com though which the candidate
“clients” will be assessed and they may not be admitted. The ones that are
denied admission will not have the right to “purchase” this method or have
access to this “training”.  
Please refer to section “ And then, what?”

And then, what?
The “training” is only the beginning. The true goal is the
creation of a new innovative and original, universal network community with
people that present the same characteristics (not racial), possibilities and
capacities (not physical) on a common, democratic base of values that all
members would share. This is why in the original website there is a
questionnaire that will help us assess the “clients”. The ones that will be
considered to be “inadmissible” do not have the right to “purchase” and have
access to the “training” of this method. 
This method is basically a preparation in order to be able
to speak the same language, share knowledge and comprehend and understand
common concepts. 
This community will not be governed by one leader, but it
will function democratically. 
One of the goals of the community is to build not only
local but also internet businesses and companies. 
The support of these companies will be shown through
advice and experience provided by the members of the community and the purchase
of products of these very members. 
Another goal could be the creation of an internet bank
like "PayPal" so that the companies owned by members of the community but also the
members themselves are not taxed for their transactions or are able to take out
interest-free loans. 

Also we aim to the purchase of fields and agricultural real estate
and the production of agricultural eco-products (by members of the community), therefore
we will control what we consume. 
We also have as target the purchase of areas rich in fresh water
so we would know what we drink. 
The creation of data storage places that will belong to the community in order to know where our data is safely saved (the employees there will be members of the community) or even the development of our own web search engine is another important goal.
All the great miracles were achieved by groups, come with us to
make our own group or community. This community will be the first in history
presenting these characteristics. Come with us, let’s all join our forces to
commence a revolution and build our own world.
All together we can achieve our purpose.

In the last
offer you mentioned, the offer that includes all sections, you stated that I
can be founder member. Did you mean founder member of the website?
NO, we mean founder member of the community that will be created
and will be named after voting with the participation of all members. We have
to remind you at this point that this is the first web community in the history
of the world that is created based on development and entrepreneurship. 
We assume that the name will be related to a new universal web
community. 
Our suggestions are “Global Web Society” (GWS) or “Wide Web World”
(WWW)  or something like that. 
To conclude, your card will be uniquely and impressively designed
and only founder members will have it, with a unique authorization number.

story:
AshevilleFM IS BROADCASTING AT 103.3 ON THE FM DIAL IN ASHEVILLE!

103.3AshevilleFM is a volunteer-based, grassroots community radio station created by Friends of Community Radio, a non-profit 501(c)entity. The idea for AshevilleFM was hatched in early 2009, when radio lovers from Western North Carolina came together to serve pipin’ hot sounds and have fun while doing it.

Our goal is to add to and reflect the rich stew of arts, culture and community involvement that is Asheville. We want to hear music, news, and the unusual all produced right here in our neck of the woods. We want to hear sounds from around the world, discerned and distilled just for us by our neighbors. We want to help make connections between diverse groups and support the local economy of ideas. We believe people from all parts of our community should have a chance to let their voice be heard. Sound Good? It’ll sound even better if you get involved and help us bring this vital local programming to our community!

Broadcasting online since 2009, our programming is truly free-form, including jazz and comedy, pop and poetry, rock ‘n’ roll and sports talk, world music and local news, hip-hop and health, old-school country and anarchist journalism, blues and kids’ shows, politics and dance music, live simulcasts and Spanish-language programming, and spotlights on local non-profits and community causes, with everything in between and more to come!

In the fall of 2013, we applied for a license during the first Low-Power FM application window in over a decade. The Federal Communications Commission granted our construction permit, which means that our mission to serve as a community radio station will be now be served on the airwaves on 103.3 FM, at a full 100 watts, from atop the Hotel Indigo in downtown Asheville.

This is your chance to be part of the community that is AshevilleFM. We have some great incentives, featuring our new logo, that you'll want to have as a keepsake for this inaugural transmission, so please take a moment right now to donate to the cause, and join us in celebration!

About the Campaign

AshevilleFM and our founding organization, the Friends of Community Radio, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, are so thankful for all of our supporters! This is a special time for us to celebrate with all of the people in our community, and supporters from around the globe, who have contributed to get us on the air. When you make your donation today, you're stating that you know the importance of community radio, so please donate now to help us meet our goal!

FAQ (Frequently Asked Questions)

Does anyone get paid at Asheville FM?

No, not yet. We’re an all-volunteer operation, with dozens of folks laboring away constantly, because we love community radio and we love Asheville! We’ve made it work for more almost 6 years now, but later this year, we’ll be having our first on-air fund drive, and we’re hoping that will allow us to hire a part-time station manager. A next step will be to hire a full-time station manager as soon as we can. With community support, we’ll grow quickly!

My business would like to underwrite the station. How do I do that?

We’d love to have you as an underwriter! Drop us a quick line at manager@ashevillefm.org, and we will fill you in on all the details!

How can I get in touch to tell you about my favorite program or give feedback?

Yes! Click the Volunteer tab on AshevilleFM.org and fill out the application!

How can I get in touch to tell you about my favorite program or give feedback?

Email  info@ashevillefm.org for feedback, or to get more information.

(Logo design by NathanaelRoney.com)

story:
Early October 24, 2013 I awoke to a phone call...the call that all parents of active duty service members dread. My son had become a casualty of war.But this did not happen on the battle field.My son suffered from the debilitating effects of PTSD.

After surviving the battles fought by First Battalion Fifth Marines his injuries would linger for years.The physical and mental effects of this disorder are well
documented. They effect all areas of the veterans’ life. Relationships, educational
goals, social interactions, holding down a job, at times all seemingly impossible tasks.
My name is Robert Slack. I am a Third Generation United States Marine Corps Veteran. Father of two Marine Corps Veterans and Director of Veterans Empowered through Technology VETT.

  • Vietnam‐era veterans comprised the largest group of veterans, making up 31.7 percent of California’s total population of veterans. More than three out of every five (63.8 percent) Vietnam‐era veterans were between the ages of 55 and 64. Nearly 3 out of every 10 (28.6 percent) Vietnam‐era veterans were age 65 or older.
  • Gulf War veterans from September 2001 forward, or recent veterans, comprised 15.0 percent of California’s veteran population, followed by veterans who served between the Vietnam era and the first Gulf War (12.6 of all veterans), and Gulf War veterans who served between August 1990 and August 2001 (10.0 percent of all veterans). World War II veterans comprised less than 10 percent of California’s veteran population in 2009. 



EMPLOYMENT

 Nearly 80 percent of all male veterans participate in the employment pool while only 73 percent of civilian men do. However, our young male veterans, those 18-24, have a higher unemployment rate than their civilian counterparts: 20.4 percent compared to 16.4 percent. Young women veterans (those aged 34 and under, have higher unemployment rates than either male veterans or their female civilian counterparts (civilian women aged 25-34 have 8.3 percent unemployment whereas women veterans 25-34 have 11.6 percent unemployment and women from the most recent conflict have 12.5 percent unemployment).

HOUSING

Male veterans living in poverty are about 1.2 times more likely to progress to homelessness when compared to civilians living in poverty. Women veterans, however, are twice as likely as other adults to move into homelessness, and women veterans in poverty are 2.7 times as likely to move into homelessness as other adults living in poverty. For 18-30 year old veterans living in poverty, when compared to non veteran adults living in poverty, veterans are 3.4 times as likely to become homeless.


PHYSICAL HEALTH

Veterans face different health problems than the civilian population. While heart disease, high blood pressure, and musculoskeletal problems are common among veterans, other physical issues not as common in the civilian population occur at high rates for veterans. “Hearing impairment was the most common traumatic injury, affecting some 63 percent of the veterans, followed by vision loss, orthopedic injuries, traumatic brain injury (4.2 percent), burns, spinal cord injury, and amputation (1.3 percent). Just over five percent of the veterans had polytrauma wounds — multiple, complex injuries requiring intensive therapy.”

BEHAVIORAL HEALTH

Veterans face an array of mental health problems. Depression, anxiety, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and substance abuse all occur at higher rates for veterans than they do for their civilian peers. Women veterans appear to be at greater risk for developing behavioral health problems than their male counterparts.

Where do I start?
What do I do?
How do I succeed?


The demands of our society puts great stress on the individual. Family and personal lives, social interaction, education and career choices are challenges we all face. Our veterans deal with these same challenges but with the added baggage of physical and mental trauma. Service to our country comes with many costs. When reentering the job market one penalty we face is “Lost Time”. Often military occupations do not carry directly over to civilian equivalents. And years of faithful service seem to have lost their value.


The VETT Program supports the interests of the Veterans Administration, as well as the Education Community and organizations like AARP, in finding new ways of providing Veterans with resources that will help them improve their economic position, live healthy fulfilling lives while continue to be productive contributors to their communities. 

TECHNOLOGY BOOT CAMP

VETT BOOT CAMP. This ‘boot camp’ challenges the individual to expand his or her talents and skills through a 6 week, rigorous series of classes and hands on training focused on all aspects of prototyping and design. Following the classroom instruction members apply the training through participation in group prototyping sessions. These group activities and workshops address the development of important collaborative skills, required to maintain gainful employment and be comfortable in normal social situations.

TECHSHOP AND VETT PARTNERSHIP

   

TechShop is a membership-based do-it-yourself workshop and fabrication studio that supports a growing community of makers and innovators. Along with classes and personal instruction Veterans can use TechShop's cutting edge training and equipment to become more competitive in the job market or pursue entrepreneurial goals while interacting with other TechShop and community members, including fellow Veterans.       

     
         
                     VETT Journey Map: Program Overview /  VETT Full Class List

                 


What can $32,585 do?



IMMEDIATE IMPACT

  •  Upstream Suicide Intervention.
  •  Improving Veterans receptivity to Mental Health Care,
  •  Promote treatment, Engagement, and Participation.
  •  Improve mental wellness by creating Innovative method of incentivizing        behavior.
  •   Provide an atmosphere that stimulates Veterans to achieve their Educational  and Career goals.
  •  Provide a usable skill set that can provide immediate job opportunities as  Private Contractors.
  •  Exposure to Entrepreneurial opportunities in a wide array of Emerging                 Technologies.

NATION WIDE IMPACT

The explosion of Maker Spaces around the country is creating an innovation revolution. Techshop is a leader with 8 facilities running and two in planning. The Techshop Business model allows the VETT program to be ‘facility independent’ and thus expansion and reach of services is unlimited.

NETWORKING

The final stage of the VETT program is to create a pool of skilled veterans for the large quantity of California Tech Start-up businesses. Also many established businesses need labor for overflow work. Contract labor fills this need with lower costs to the employer and flexibility for the veteran contractor. The contacts gained through networking can lead full time employment or other business opportunities.

Project 1
Unmanned Arial Vehicle Systems

UAV remote sensing functions include electromagnetic spectrum sensors, gamma ray sensors, biological sensors, and chemical sensors. A UAV's electromagnetic sensors typically include visual spectrum, infrared,  or near-infrared cameras as well as radar systems. Biological sensors are sensors capable of detecting the airborne presence of various microorganisms and other biological factors.Chemical sensors use laser spectroscopy to analyze the concentrations of each element in the air.
Aerotestra, an innovator in the emerging field of Unmanned Arial Vehicle Systems, is collaborating with VETT to provide real world manufacturing experience to VETT participants. The UAV’s created using Techshop facilities will be donated schools, and Not-For-Profit organizations involved in research for land and watershed sustainability, forestry, sustainable land management & conservation


Project 2
Cloud Based Telecommunications

Cloud communications providers deliver voice & data communications applications and services, hosting them on servers that the providers own and maintain, giving their customers access to the “cloud.” Because they only pay for services or applications they use, customers have a more cost-effective, reliable and secure communications environment, without the headaches associated with more conventional PBX system deployment.
Semper Fi Telecommunications, a Veteran owned and operated tech company provides opportunities for veterans choosing VETT Electronics Class track. Network equipment installation and maintenance, troubleshooting, marketing and customer relations to support other Non Profit and Veteran assistance organizations as well as the general public. 


Project 3
3d prototyping systems

Rapid prototyping is a group of techniques used to quickly fabricate a scale model of a physical part or assembly using three-dimensional computer aided design(CAD) data.Construction of the part or assembly is usually done using 3D printing or "additive layer manufacturing" technology. As with CNC subtractive methods, the computer-aided-design - computer-aided manufacturing CAD-CAM workflow in the traditional Rapid Prototyping process starts with the creation of geometric data, either as a 3D solid using a CAD workstation, or 2D slices using a scanning device.
GMax 3d printing system. The gMax printer is ideal for printing large sized products that can be used in the real world, high resolution models, as well as functional prototypes. All of the printable component are available as downloads. Sources for all equipment and materials are also available. The printers created in the program are donated. VETT participants can then use Techshop to create their own 3D printer.


Beyond money — we need your help spreading the word!

At its heart, the VETT Program is a grassroots movement driven by family, therapists, educators and Veterans who want help change the conditions that exist for some of our bravest. Whether you donate to our campaign or not, you can still help make change for the future.

Ways you can help:
·  Spread the word about theVETT Program on FacebookorTwitter.
·  Get involved in bringing a Makerspace to your city.
·  Stay connected. Follow VETTprogram.Org on Facebook and on Twitter to stay up-to-date on the Innovation movement.
·  To date, we've been privileged to have the support of many generous individuals,But to sustain our organization for the long haul, we need to engage local businesses, corporations, and foundations. All donations, regardless of the amount, help further our mission and allow us to reach more Veterans. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Are you a non-profit?

Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes? Yes, VETT program.org is registered as a public 501(c) (3) nonprofit. Contributions to VETT program.org are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. VETT program.org tax ID number is EIN 47-3006274.

How can I get a tax deductible receipt? 

When you contribute, you will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit payments processor) confirming your contribution. This email receipt can be used for tax deductible purposes. For all contributions over $250, you will receive an official receipt for tax-reporting purposes by email after the campaign ends.

Payment methods do you accept?

Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

Large Contributions - How can I make a contribution over $10,000?

The nonprofit payment processor (FirstGiving) that is handling the transactions for this campaign is able to accept direct wire transfers for contributions of $10,000 or more. If you are interested in making a large contribution through a wire transfer to FirstGiving, please contact us at(                       ) . We’ll connect you with a specialist at Indiegogo who will assist you with the contribution transfer process.

Is shipping included?

Yes.

Does international shipping cost extra?

Yes, but Indiegogo doesn't allow us to add any extra shipping to the perks, so it is included in the suggested donation price.

I have more questions. Who do I ask?

Please contact robertkslack@gmail.com to ask your question. We’ll get back to you as soon as we can.

deployment.Semper Fi Telecommunications, a Veteran owned and operated tech company provides opportunities for
veterans choosing VETT Electronics Class track. Network equipment installation
and maintenance, troubleshooting, marketing and customer relations to support other
Non Profit and Veteran assistance organizations as well as the general public. 


Project 33d prototyping systems

Rapid prototyping is a group of techniques used to quickly fabricate a scale model of a
physical part or assembly using three-dimensional computer aided design(CAD) data.Construction of the part or assembly is usually done using 3D printing or "additive layer manufacturing" technology. As with CNC subtractive methods, the computer-aided-design -
computer-aided manufacturing CAD-CAM workflow in the traditional Rapid Prototyping process
starts with the creation of geometric data, either as a 3D solid using a CAD workstation, or 2D slices using a scanning device.GMax 3d printing system. The
gMax printer is ideal for printing large sized products that can be used in the
real world, high resolution models, as well as functional prototypes. All of
the printable component are available as downloads. Sources for all equipment
and materials are also available. The printers created in the program are
donated. VETT participants can then use Techshop to create their own 3D
printer.



Beyond money — we need your help
spreading the word!
At its heart, the VETT
Program is a grassroots movement driven by family, therapists, educators and
Veterans who want help change the conditions that exist for some of our bravest.
Whether you donate to our campaign or not, you can still help make change for
the future.
Ways you can help:· 
Spread the word about theVETT Program on FacebookorTwitter.· 
Get involved in bringing a Makerspace to your city.· 
Stay connected. Follow VETTprogram.Org on Facebook and on Twitter to stay up-to-date on the Innovation movement.· 
To date, we've been privileged to have the support of many generous individuals,But to sustain our organization for the long haul,
we need to engage local businesses, corporations, and foundations. All
donations, regardless of the amount, help further our mission and allow us to
reach more Veterans. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Are you a non-profit?
Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes? Yes,
VETT program.org is registered as a public 501(c) (3) nonprofit. Contributions
to VETT program.org are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. VETT program.org
tax ID number is EIN 47-3006274.How can I get a tax deductible receipt? 
When you
contribute, you will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit
payments processor) confirming your contribution. This email receipt can be used for tax
deductible purposes. For all contributions over $250, you will receive an official
receipt for tax-reporting purposes by email after the campaign ends.

Payment methods do you accept?
Indiegogo
accepts all major credit cards.
Large Contributions - How can I make a contribution over
$10,000?
The
nonprofit payment processor (FirstGiving) that is handling the transactions for
this campaign is able to accept direct wire transfers for contributions of
$10,000 or more. If you are interested in making a large contribution through a
wire transfer to FirstGiving, please contact us at(                       ) . We’ll connect you with a specialist at Indiegogo who will
assist you with the contribution transfer process.
Is shipping included?

Yes.

Does international shipping cost extra?

Yes,
but Indiegogo doesn't allow us to add any extra shipping to the perks, so it is
included in the suggested donation price.


I have more questions. Who do I ask?


Please
contact robertkslack@gmail.com to ask your question. We’ll get back to
you as soon as we can.

story:
My name is Toby Bogard and I am a long haul truck driver, I've been on the road away from my family for 14 years now. 

I've always loved the feeling of Hope it gives someone when you help them, and I've always believed you should never look down upon anyone unless you're helping them up. The H.O.P.E. Center and Operation HOPE are life long dreams of mine. To be able to help people from all walks of life pick themselves up and believe in themselves again. My phillosophy about life is very simple Help People Find A Way. That is the true meaning of Help Our People Excel (H.O.P.E.) to me.

By being a part of H.O.P.E. you will be also be supporting 18 Wheels of Hope which is a program that allows terminally ill children to see a Big Truck up close and personal. If physically able they will be allowed to sit in the truck and what child doesn't love a Big Truck. You will also be helping to establish H.O.P.E. as a non-profit 501 (c)(3) organization in an effort to spread Hope. To children and adults nationwide that just need a little H.O.P.E.

All initial fundiing will go towards legal fees for establishing H.O.P.E.  as a fully registered and credited Non-profit. The remamining funds of the initial start up will go towards retaining legal council as well. As a fully registered Non-profit Organization, we will be able to reach people not just locally but nationwide. In an effort to help those with various needs. From Clothing, Food, Emergency Shelter, Emergency Funds and various other needs they may have. Funds will also go towards paying a small salary to our 1 person staff although we anticipate taking on more staff later, however we anticipate primarily having volunteers. This paid staff person will be handling all logistics and organization as well as administrative duties. The empolyment staff however must be paid according to IRS regulations. 

Everyone that donates in this campaign will receive either a picture on our Wall of H.O.P.E. a H.O.P.E., T-shirt and/or recognition on Social Media outlets used by H.O.P.E.

As a 14 year Long Haul Trucking Veteran with over 1.3 Million Miles Safely logged I am uniquely qualified to be Founder of 18 Wheels of HOPE. 

Every person has encountered hard times at one point or another in their lives. And all they really needed is a ray of HOPE a chance to take a breath and some encouragement. Everyone needs help from time to time. H.O.P.E is a way of reaching out to others who are in a position that YOU yourself may have been in at one point in your life. All you needed was a little help. That's all any of us really need just a little help. Whether it be a winter jacket, a few extra groceries to get them through to pay day. Maybe help finding a job. Diapers or wipes for their child, or maybe help with a car repair because things are tight. All of these things provide HOPE! You can help provide HOPE!

It is true that there are other organizations similar out there. But what really seperates H.O.P.E. is we truly believe in our core value which is Help People Find A Way! Find a way not to give up hope so we and they can Help Our People Excel! Hope literally changes everything.

Financial aid is greatly appreciated especially at start up. However it is not the only way to help or contribute. If you can provide donations of food, clothing diapers wipes anything you feel will help us, we are very open. Also if you can provide guidance or counselor services or some type again we are very open to these things.
